name: Youth Combat Marshal Collegia: Weapons
description_book: Come learn how to make youth combat weapons suitable for different ages of fighters. Materials available at cost to make your own.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi. Bring your own mat or towel and water! Power up and stretch!
description_web: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi, dancer, fighter, artisan, merchant or royal! Bring your own mat or towel and water, wear easy-to-move-in clothes. Get ready to power up and stretch!

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi. Bring your own mat or towel and water! Power up and stretch!
description_web: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi, dancer, fighter, artisan, merchant or royal! Bring your own mat or towel and water, wear easy-to-move-in clothes. Get ready to power up and stretch!

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Thrown Weapons Range Set-Up
description_book: Do you participate in thrown weapons? Come help us set up the range for all to enjoy!

name: Anglo-Saxon (Early English) Embroidery (Virtual)
description_book: Very little Anglo-Saxon embroidery exists. Come see the pieces upon which we base our speculation.
description_web: Very little Anglo-Saxon embroidery exists. Come see the pieces upon which we base our speculation.

name: Anglo-Saxon Magical Beliefs and Amulets  (Virtual)
description_book: Learn about items (stones, shells, glass, threads, plants, etc.) used by Anglo-Saxon women to perform magic. **18+**
description_web: Come learn about items (stones, shells, glass, threads, plants, etc.) used by Anglo-Saxon women to perform magic. **Age 18+.**

name: Archery Range Set-Up
description_book: Many hands make light work. Come out to help set up the Archery Range. You do **not** need to be a marshal to help; we welcome one and all.
description_web: Many hands make light work. Come out to help set up the Archery Range. You do **not** need to be a marshal to help; we welcome one and all.

name: Game of the Goose
description_book: Period game in the style of "Chutes and Ladders". Suitable for children, but also a popular tavern game for adults.
description_web: Period game in the style of "Chutes and Ladders". The game is purely deterministic dice-based so it is suitable for children. It was also known from its tavern version which required gambling and/or drinking. We will review the rules and then play through a game.

name: Sustainability in Costuming (Virtual)
description_book: Tips and trick on how to both save money and make costumes in more sustainable ways.
description_web: Learn how to be frugal and make costumes in more sustainable ways. Learn about ways to use up your scraps! Remake old garb. Trade garb. Save money. Shop second-hand. This is a good class for new members.

name: Dressing as an Early Anglo-Saxon Woman (Virtual)
description_book: This is a beginner's class about dressing as an Anglo-Saxon woman between 450 and 700 A.D.
description_web: This is a beginner's class about dressing as an Anglo-Saxon woman between 450 and 700 A.D.

name: Pit and Stone Games
description_book: Pit and Stone games are an ancient family of games that includes *mancala*. We will learn several variations, including *Wari*, and play some games.
description_web: Pit and Stone games are an ancient family of games that includes *mancala*. They are played by moving stones (or sowing seeds) into pits with a goal of capturing the most stones (or seeds). These games have been played since at least 1000 BC, and there are hundreds of both traditional and modern versions. We will learn several variations, including *Wari*, and we'll play some games.

name: Early Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 5th -11th centuries from Europe and the Middle East! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Here. Play This. Now.
description_book: Sight-read with us! Bring your recorder, or a C or F instrument. Bring a music stand and a sense of humor.
description_web: Sight-reading class for recorders or other C and F instruments. Bring a music stand, or use one of our loaners. Safe space for honing your sight-reading skills.
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: Morris Games
description_book: Come learn to play a classic! *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe) will be taught.
description_web: Come learn to play a classic! *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe) will be taught.

name: Italian Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 14th-16th centuries in the Italian style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: *Alquerques*
description_book: A checkers-style period game from the Middle East. We will review the rules and then play through some games to learn the basic strategies.
description_web: A checkers-style period game from the Middle East. We will review the rules and then play through some games to learn the basic strategies.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Come join us in the Dance Tent for open dancing!

name: Intermediate Archery Class
description_book: Designed to improve your skills beyond basic archery. Class will concentrate on range shoots and war point shooting.
description_web: Archers must bring their own equipment to the range.
fee_itemization: None

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi. Bring your own mat or towel and water! Power up and stretch!
description_web: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi, dancer, fighter, artisan, merchant or royal! Bring your own mat or towel and water, wear easy-to-move-in clothes. Get ready to power up and stretch!

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 1 is more linear; *Étude* 2 adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Lucet Cord for Beginners
description_book: A square lucet cord that dates back to the Viking period can be quickly made for lacing, bag closure or belt hanging.
description_web: Lucet cord has been dated back to the Viking and throughout the medieval periods. This two-pronged tool is easy to use and makes a quick cord that is not limited in length. This class is an introduction to lucetting and we will make a single color square cord.
fee_itemization:
Lucet $15
Cord and bobbins $5

name: Introduction to Kumihimo
description_book: Learn the ancient Japanese art of *kumihimo*. This is a hands-on beginner class and each kit contains all you need to complete a *kumihimo* cord.
description_web: Learn the Japanese art of weaving/braiding. Kit includes all you need to make a *kumihimo* cord, instructions, and a brief history of *kumihimo*.
fee_itemization:
Foam disk
Craft yarn
Counter weight
Kumihimo history
Kumihimo instruction
Instructions on various patterns

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Putting Punic Back in Pennsic
description_book: There's more to Carthage than the Punic Wars. Introduction to Punic and Neo-Punic culture, with a focus on dress. Revised and updated 2022.
description_web:
There's more to Carthage than the Punic Wars. Their influence on the Western Mediterranean lingered well past 146 BC. The goal of this class is to provide an overview of Punic and Neo-Punic culture in North Africa and the Western Mediterranean, plus starting points for further research on a variety of topics core to constructing and outfitting an SCA persona or adding historically accurate flavor to a Hannibal-themed event. A substantial portion of this class is on dress. Language and personal names will be covered briefly but are their own class.
Revised and updated 2022. Online resources are available. Please email me: suphunibal@gmail.com .

name: Open Crafting Time
description_book: Family Point is open for parent-guided crafts. We will have a craft and instructions, but there will not be a teacher to guide the activity.

name: Thrown Weapons Range Set-Up
description_book: Do you participate in thrown weapons? Come help us set up the range for all to enjoy!

name: Introduction to Improv
description_book: Get comfortable performing by learning the basics of improv! We will learn the "rules" of improv with warmups, and play fun improvised games.
description_web: Get comfortable performing by learning the basics of improv! We will learn the basic "rules" of improv with warmups, and play fun improvised games with the group (like “Whose Line is it Anyway”). Improv skills can help your bardic or theater performance and are helpful for anyone who needs to speak in front of a group!

name: Heralds Don't Pun; We Cant!
description_book: A discussion on canting arms; puns in heraldic devices.
description_web: A discussion on canting arms; puns in heraldic devices.

name: Running or Winning Siege Cooking Contests
description_book: How to run, enter and win "siege cooking" contests, from picking the foods, to handouts, to adding theater to your entry. Bring paper/pen.
description_web: "Siege cooking" contests pit contestants, provided with identical raw ingredients, against each other or a pre-announced standard. A popular feature of weekend events, such contests can spice up a household dinner or provide the entire feast. The instructor has run the Maison Rive siege cooking contest at Pennsic for more than twenty years now; learn what worked and what didn't from both sides of the judging table. Come prepared to take notes.

name: Phoenician-Punic *Stelae* Translation/Pers'l Names
description_book: Part I: Translate a Phoenician-Punic inscription or two into English. Part II: Spot the personal names! Multiple inscriptions will be available.
description_web:
Translate a Phoenician-Punic inscription or two into English and spot the personal names! Multiple inscriptions will be available. The second part of this class will explore naming conventions and the foibles of transliteration and our modern understanding of vocalization. 
Class materials are available here: https://wakelet.com/wake/vm8-nUPMJjMb27-aUI9sN .
Please bring 3 pens, markers, or pencils of different colors. I will be bringing enough pens for 10 people.

name: 16th-Century Arbeau Historical Field Drum Class
description_book: Class for drummers who own and play historical field drum (this is the rope tension drum with sticks), including *tupon* with drum sticks.
description_web: Class for drummers who own and play historical field drum (this is the rope tension drum with sticks), including *tupan* (aka *davul, tapan, atabal* or *tabl*) with drum sticks. The class will study the only historical manuscript instructions on both military and dance rhythms. Possible coordination to support one of the field battles as a historical drum corps.

name: Áine's Teen D&D Adventure
description_book: Join Lady Áine and her D&D5E home-brew Pennsic 49 campaign! Every year a different adventure. What will it be? Must attend all sessions (age12-17).
description_web: Join Lady Áine and her D&D5E home-brew Pennsic 49 campaign! Every year is a different adventure. What will it be? Must attend all sessions (age12-17). The number of players is limited to seven.

name: Open Crafting Time
description_book: Family Point is open for parent-guided crafts. We will have a craft and instructions, but there will not be a teacher to guide the activity.

name: Illuminated Origami Star Baskets for Youth
description_book: Create a tea-lighted origami basket! Drop-in craft; feel free to come at any point in the block. (Ages 8-14)
description_web: Create a tea-lighted origami basket! Drop-in craft; feel free to come at any point in the block. (Ages 8-14)

name: Janissary Music Class
description_book: Two to three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice.
description_web: Two to three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice. The songs to be taught are *Ceddin Deden, Genc Osman*, and *Hucum* march. Perfect for those who have marching band experience and want to make a big noise.

name: *Strammazone, Stromboli*, Whatever!
description_book: This class will examine the *Strammazone*: how to perform, the practical application, and the historical context.

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Building a Camp Bread Oven
description_book: Join us in building our camp's beehive bread oven.
description_web: A hands-on lesson in one method of constructing a temporary beehive bread oven, one that's been built at Pennsic for two decades.

name: *Kamon*: Designing and Documenting Japanese Armory
description_book: Make "Individually Attested Patterns" work for you! Learn to use online resources to design, document, and register a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.
description_web: Do you want to design and register real Japanese heraldic designs called *kamon*? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culturally specific heraldic design resources? Then this class is for you. Learn how to use online resources to design, document, and register a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.
fee_itemization: There will be a multipage handout.

name: Making an Italian Renaissance Chemise
description_book: Instructions and walk-through for making an Italian Renaissance chemise. Includes a look at both pleating and gathering.
description_web: Instructions and walk-through for making an Italian Renaissance chemise. Includes a look at both pleating and gathering.
fee_itemization: $2 for printed handout.  20 printouts will be available

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (Between Ankara & Visby Vale there will be signs))
name: The Dangerous Beauty: Series 1, *Esprimiti*! - CCt
description_book: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. Discussion and practice in how to look and act like an elite historical sex worker. **18+.*
description_web: A series on the Arts of a Courtesan. You - yes, *you* have within you the power to secure a military alliance, curate courtly influence, maybe feel more assurance about attending Court, or just chat with that interesting person you met at fighter practice last week. We will be discussing and practicing how to look and act like an elite sex worker while in persona, based on a combination of both extant European period writings on social behavior with modern framing of deportment, etiquette, and seduction. This section will cover conversation skills, remembering names, wit, charm, walking and talking, flirting, non-verbal languages. There will be handouts available. **Age 18+.**

name: Kids' Block Stamp Printing
description_book: Bring some fabric or a garment and let the kids have fun stamping something to wear! We will learn to use a block print stamp and how to wash it.
description_web: Bring some fabric or a garment and let the kids have fun stamping something they can wear the rest of Pennsic! We will learn to use a block print stamp and how to wash it afterwards!

name: Multiplayer Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: Class Casanova
description_book: Designed to give you the tools necessary to develop the skill set to approach anyone in social settings, i.e., not come off as a creep. **18+**
description_web:
This class is designed to give you the tools necessary to develop the skill set to approach anyone in social settings. How to show the best version of yourself, conversation, pick up body language and how to handle social rejection with grace and still leave you in good standing. 
Along with the class will be a practical class participation to help ease your nervousness and help you find your confidence. 

About the instructor: The Wizard has taught several classes on social dynamics, testing the theory in practice across several countries and cultures. Knowledge is power and the more perspectives you have will only help. **Age limit 18+.**

name: Mistress Lissa Teaches Glass Bead-Making/Research
description_book: An informal workshop where students can drop by to ask questions and learn new skills from an experienced artisan and research librarian.
description_web: This is an open and informal workshop where students can drop by at any time to ask questions and learn new skills. I have been making beads for 10 years. I am a research librarian in the modern world, and I have a lot of A&S competition experience. No question is too large or small as long as it relates to glass beads. If you are not sure what you want to learn next or where to go in your art, I can help you. If you have a question that I can not answer, I will do my best to help you find the answer. I am happy to teach new bead makers as time allows, but will prioritize questions from bead makers who have at least a bit of prior experience. Materials fee applies only to those who use the available torches for practice/learning.
fee_itemization: glass, and fuel for torches if used

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers to address higher level improv skills for creating character and building scenes leading to a performance.
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday 8/5 in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (modern experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission. Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Pork & Artichoke Pies, Meatballs: 1549 *Banchetti*
description_book: Pork with spices, lemon slices and fresh fennel wrapped in pastry; artichokes, butter, sheep cheese in pastry; meatballs, herbs in oil, spices, eggs.

name: An Introduction to Sweets in the Medieval Period
description_book: An overview of candies and sweeteners in cooking and medicinal use. We will look at different cultures and time periods. Recipes included.
fee_itemization: $3 to help cover the cost of copying the handout.

name: Knot That Knot!
description_book: Make sure you know what to do with your rope by learning these essential knots. Keep your tent up or save a life!
description_web: A good knot can keep your tent up in a strong wind, or even save a life when you're performing first aid, working over heights, or near water. But you have to know how to tie it, so make sure you know what to do with your rope by learning these essential knots.

name: Latin Reading
description_book: A daily Latin beginner reading class. We will be using Orberg's *Lingua Latina I* (purchase recommended). Handouts available.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

name: Voice Heralding 101
description_book: Come learn the basics of voice heralding for court and tournaments!
description_web:
From SCA.org: “Voice heralds” are used for “crying out announcements, announcing the fighters entering the list field, as well as acting as the voice of the nobility in court, reading the scrolls that accompany the awards being given out.”

“Book heralds”: helping members of the SCA to research period names and design devices (armory), as well as registering them with the SCA College of Heralds.

“Protocol heralds”: recording the awards and honors that are given in court, drafting period-style ceremonies for use in court, determining the precedence of award holders, as well as other legal niceties in all sorts of situations.

This class deals with Voice Heralds. Learn how to project your voice, what to say, and how to say it!

name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales.

location: E07. Off the Great Eastern Highway. Next to Denys the Decadent/Dennis Greenway. In Timothy of Sherwoods' camp.  (E07 Off The Great Eastern Highway. Next to Denys the Decadent/Dennis Greenway. In Timothy of Sherwoods' camp.)
name: Beginning Period-ish Feather Work for Fletching
description_book: Feather fronts will not peel up even when shot deeply into a target. No expensive modern jigs. Cut profiles you like. Silk thread & 7" dowel used.
description_web: Feather fronts will not peel up even when shot deep into targets. No expensive modern jig needed. Cut profiles you design. Silk thread and a 7" long dowel piece used to learn. Arrows made with this process won a kingdom championship, several tournaments and outscored a grand master bowman. This process allows one to quickly and easily rescue flights and thread from broken arrows saving money and time. Nocks, points, documentation, spine, cresting and straightening are not our focus. Please bring note taking materials.
fee_itemization: Two full length, milled turkey feathers & three, trimmed flights $3.00. A 7" dowel $1.00. Hide glue, tea lights, handout $1.00

location: East Kingdom Royal (E06, corner of Low Road and Berwick Road, a block south of troll.)
name: East Kingdom Royal Set-up
description_book: Setting up the East Kingdom Royal camp. Come meet people from other parts of the kingdom as we create a common space for the entire kingdom.

name: What Was Life Like in the Middle Ages?
description_book: Learn what medieval lords and ladies did every day. Make your own medieval memory box to keep track of the things you do at events.
description_web: We will read a book that describes what medieval lords and ladies would do every day, discuss how that is similar to or different from what we do at events, and then make a medieval memory box out of a tissue box to keep track of the things that kids do when going to events. Kids can take box with them.

name: Youth Block Print Stamping
description_book: **(Ages 9-14)** Bring some fabric or a garment and have fun stamping something to wear! We will learn to use a block print stamp and how to wash it.
description_web: **(Ages 9-14)** Bring some fabric or a garment and let the youth have fun stamping something they can wear the rest of Pennsic! We will learn to use a block print stamp and how to wash it afterwards!

name: *Tafl* Games: *Hnefatafl*
description_book: Tafl games: If you can play one, you can play all *Tafl* games. Come learn to play, then stay to play round-robin competition. Winner receives a set.
description_web: *Tafl* includes *Hnefatafl, Tablut, Tawlbwrdd, Brandubh, Ard Rí*, and *Alea Evangelii*. If you can play one type, you can play all *Tafl* games. Come learn to play. Then, stay to play round-robin competition. Winner receives a game set.
fee_itemization: Alys: In title, used colon, italics.

name: Late Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo you'll see items from Europe to the Middle East from the 11th - 14th centuries! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Sharpening Everything for Woodworking
description_book: How to sharpen all of your stuff that needs sharpening!
description_web: How to sharpen everything! This class is an extension of my woodworking class. Thus, I will focus on sharpening woodworking tools, but the principles are the same for all cutting implements. We will cover several concepts and methods but my focus will be on how I do it... without expensive jigs and other do-hickies. We will review, then sharpen, anything you bring - and all of my tools.

name: Singing and Playing Unbarred Music
description_book: SCA period music was generally written without measure lines. Sing or play (C or F instruments) 1- to 4-part music.
description_web: SCA period music was generally written without measure lines. Fully embrace period music! Come sing (most are vocal pieces) or play (any C or F instruments) in one to four parts with THL Siri. Knowledge of standard notation and rhythmic values necessary. Teen-friendly class!
fee_itemization: Printed copies of handout

name: Challenge Lines
description_book: In this class we will examine measure in general, and in specific how measure affects your opponent.

name: Heraldry for Scribes
description_book: You have an award scroll to illuminate and have no idea what all those Heraldic Words mean?
description_web: This class will help explain the use of Heraldic Language, so you may draw any device or badge correctly. It will also provide titles to heraldic books and web sites that will answer the many questions that arise in regards to Heraldry. Youths and beginning heralds are also welcome.

name: How to Cry Like a Herald
description_book: We will practice techniques of voice production and enunciation to be well understood when making heraldic announcements (court, field, town crier).

name: Teen Block Print Stamping
description_book: (Ages 13-17) Bring some fabric/garment and have fun stamping something you can wear the rest of war! Learn to use a block print stamp and how to wash.
description_web: (Ages 13-17) Bring some fabric or a garment and let the teens have fun stamping something they can wear the rest of Pennsic! We will learn to use a block print stamp and how to wash it afterwards!

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: A Guide to Viking Age Living History
description_book: What it takes to do faithful Viking Age living history/reenactment. Identifying what is accurate and what is not.
description_web: What it takes to do faithful Viking Age living history/reenactment. Identifying what is accurate and what is not. The European festivals are more strict on what's allowed. This class is to help refine what you changes you would like to make. You'll get to learn about some of the misinformation surrounding certain finds. About the instructor: The Wizard has been a living Viking Age historian for the past 10 years. He is a professional bladesmith and jeweler, teaching Viking Age combat as well as making the swords. He has spoken at several museums around the world, including Moesgaard Museum, Solothern Armory, Centrum Slowian i Wikingow, Franklin Institute, and the Metropolitan. His presentations have included period clothing and making jewelry. Other topics included the progression of sword types and techniques of using them.

name: Open Torch
description_book: If you have taken a class at any time on using a torch to make things out of glass, come and practice your art.
fee_itemization: $3.50 per hour for map gas. No cost if you bring your own map gas. Please bring your own glass. If no merchant is selling glass, I will have some at my cost.

name: *Domos Draconum* Level 1: Intro - Old School D & D
description_book: Intro to the 1980 Basic version of D & D using only six-sided dice. Character generation, then an adventure in a sample dungeon. **Ages 11-17**
description_web: Welcome to your Doom! An introduction to the 1980 Basic version of D & D using only six-sided dice. Character generation followed by an adventure in the sample dungeon. **This class is limited to gentles ages 11-17.**

name: German Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 14th -16th centuries in the Dutch German Style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Chinese Heraldry
description_book: A discussion of some common charges in period Chinese banners and how to incorporate these into registerable SCA heraldry.
description_web: This class will show you some common symbols, colors, and arrangements so that you can shoehorn your Chinese persona into the SCA College of Arms. Full color handouts.
fee_itemization: Full color handout.

name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: I host an open 12-Step meeting at 4:00 pm daily in my camp in EO7, Denys the Decadent's Camp.
description_web: This is an open 12-Step meeting open to all who are looking for a 12-Step meeting to attend for on-site support.

name: Pit and Stone Games
description_book: Pit and Stone games are an ancient family of games that includes *mancala*. We will learn several variations, including *Wari*, and play some games.
description_web: Pit and Stone games are an ancient family of games that includes *mancala*. They are played by moving stones (or sowing seeds) into pits with a goal of capturing the most stones (or seeds). These games have been played since at least 1000 BC, and there are hundreds of both traditional and modern versions. We will learn several variations, including *Wari*, and we'll play some games.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Glass Apprentice Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: How to Marshal a Rapier Battle at Pennsic.
description_book: This class is designed to help new or seasoned marshals understand the differences between large rapier battles at Pennsic.
description_web: This class is designed to help new or seasoned marshals understand the differences between the large rapier battles at Pennsic.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be *Around the World in 11 Nights*. Eat your heart out, Phileas Fogg!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be *1001 Arabian Nights*. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Come join us in the Dance Tent for open dancing!

name: Intermediate Archery Class
description_book: Designed to improve your skills beyond basic archery. Class will concentrate on range shoots and war point shooting.
description_web: Archers must bring their own equipment to the range.
fee_itemization: None

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi. Bring your own mat or towel and water! Power up and stretch!
description_web: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi, dancer, fighter, artisan, merchant or royal! Bring your own mat or towel and water, wear easy-to-move-in clothes. Get ready to power up and stretch!

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 1 is more linear; *Étude* 2 adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: optional handout

name: An Approach to Redacting Period Recipes
description_book: Experiment with an approach to redacting period recipes using recipes from the *Curye on Inglysch*.

name: Cloth Buttons
description_book: We will be making cloth buttons and appropriately sized button holes. These buttons are most common seen the 14th century.

name: Robin Hood
description_book: A class on the context and origins of Robin Hood, and maybe some of the early stories.
description_web: A class on the context and origins of Robin Hood, and maybe some of the early stories.

name: Learn to Spin
description_book: Introduction to spinning on a spindle, focusing on the park-and-draft method.
description_web: Focusing on the park-and-draft method, we’ll walk through the basics of how to spin wool into yarn. This is intended for people who have never spun before, or people who need a refresher for that spindle they bought three years ago and never quite figured out. We will focus on basic spinning techniques, not necessarily period techniques. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: Totally Not Authentic Painted "Stained Glass"
description_book: Have you wandered Pennsic at night and seen cool, glowing paintings? You can create those, too.
description_web:
Have you wandered Pennsic at night and seen cool, glowing paintings? You can create those too. There are cheap and not-so-cheap paints available and techniques to create unbreakable, portable "stained glass" for whatever effect you want.

We will briefly discuss actual stained glass from period; actual experts are welcome to contribute knowledge! Then we will go over the easiest way I have found to create this artwork and bring it to Pennsic.

If all the gods smile on us, there will be the opportunity to get hands on and make a suncatcher you can roll up and put in your pocket.
fee_itemization: Due to supply chain issues, I'll have to see what I can get.  My personal supplies are not sufficient for more than 1 class.

name: Have Fun Storming the Castle
description_book: The neighbors are invading! We need to protect ourselves. We will discuss historical (**not SCA-allowed**) ways to both defend and take a castle.
description_web: The neighbors are invading! We need to protect ourselves. We will discuss ways to both defend and take a castle. Note, this is an historical architecture class and these techniques should not be used by our glorious fighters during the battle of La Rochelle (although they would work!).

name: Beginner Knitting
description_book: Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off. Feel free to bring your own needles and yarn.
description_web: Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off. Feel free to bring your own needles and yarn.
fee_itemization:
$3 - needles
$3- yarn

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Beaded Flowers 1: Rose
description_book: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nose pliers/wire cutters, bring them to class.
description_web: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth.
fee_itemization: beads, wire, yarn

name: Safely Foraging Local Mushrooms
description_book: Wild mushroom foraging is sexy these days. Gastrointestinal distress is not. Learn from a Pennsylvania-approved mushroomer how to stay safe! **18+.**
fee_itemization: Alys: In descrip, deleted "Come" to add in age limit.

name: Knitting in the Baltic States: The Latvian Mitten
description_book: We will be knitting Latvian-style mittens to learn period knitting techniques from the Baltic States. Need to be able to knit.
description_web: Learn period Baltic States knitting techniques by producing Latvian-style mittens. This is an intermediate to advanced knitting class.
fee_itemization:
$15.00 kit includes - Knitting needles, yarn, darning needle, stitch holder, printed instructions
$2 for just the printed instuctions

name: Cool/Cold Water Neck Wraps
description_book: We all need relief from the heat and these neck wraps will certainly help.
description_web: We all need relief from the heat and these neck wraps will certainly help. With this kit, you'll be able to make a cool/cold water neck wrap. Backstitch and whipstitch are the two stitches that will be used. There will be plenty of kits available if you'd like more than one.
fee_itemization:
Handout $2.00
Materials $3.00

name: East Kingdom A&S Rubric Training by EKMoAS
description_book: This class sponsored by the East Kingdom Minister of Arts & Sciences provides a deeper understanding of the EK A&S general rubric.
description_web: This class sponsored by the EKMoAS provides a deeper understanding of the EK A&S general rubric used to judge Crown's A&S Championships in the East. It is designed both for judges to promote consistent calibration and for entrants to allow them to better understand what their judges will be looking for. People from all Kingdoms and all levels of experience welcome.
fee_itemization: $1 for handout

name: *Bodhrán*: The Irish Frame Drum
description_book: *Bodhránista* Lady Líadan teaches Jig, reel, slip jig, polka, horn pipe rhythms and etiquette. Bring a drum. (Some loaners available.)
description_web: *Bodhránista* Lady Líadan, a teacher for Irish Arts Academy of Indianapolis, shows you how to choose a drum and tipper, basic Irish rhythms, and how to not get kicked out of a session. Bring a drum if you have one. (Some loaners available.)

name: Care and Maintenance of Sewing Machines
description_book: A sewing machine is designed to last twenty to eighty years. Why they don't, how they can, and figuring out a machine you've never seen before.

name: Medieval Game Make-and-Take
description_book: Learn about some medieval games. Then, create your own fabric game board and pieces to keep.

name: Intro to Woodworking, Part B
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: This class is the second of two half-days, Tuesday and Wednesday mornings; an overview of hand woodwork, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience. *Youths may attend if accompanied by a parent.*

name: A Family Walking Tour of Pennsic
description_book: New to Pennsic? An old veteran, but your kids aren't? Join us for a tour of family-friendly locations. Appx one-mile loop. Meet at playground gate.
description_web: New to Pennsic? An old veteran, but your kids aren't? Join us for a tour of family-friendly locations. Approximately one-mile loop. Meet at playground gate.

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: Tips and Tricks for Making Garb Easier and Better
description_book: Not period, but helpful tricks for making the job of sewing your own garb easier, and the result better. Believe in the bias.
description_web: Not all methods are period, but this class aims to help the novice to intermediate sewer overcome some of the hurdles encountered when making simple garb. Why fabric "bias" is important. Also about understanding what "look" will work for you as you choose your persona.
fee_itemization: Hand-out.

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. **Bring chairs.**
description_web: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class. **Bring chairs.**

name: Decorated Veils
description_book: A visual trip through veil fashion; then pick up needle, thread and beads and decorate your veil.
description_web: Do you get tired of a plain veil? Did you know that veils were decorated? We will start with a visual trip through the history of medieval veils followed by a hands-on workshop where you will learn how to create a rolled hem and then how to add simple beading, or for those interested in a more complicated embellishment, the art of Turkish *Oya*. $20 "material fee" covers 1 yard of 100% linen, beads, sewing needles and thread, cotton crochet thread and embroidery needle. Please bring your own fabric scissors.
fee_itemization: $20: 1 yd Linen 3.8 oz $10; Assorted Seed Beads $4; Sewing Needles and thread $1 and cotton crochet thread and embroidery needles $5

name: Through the Looking Glass: N America in Period
description_book: An archaeological overview of period cultures flourishing in the eastern half of North America: Adena, Hopewell, Mississippian, and Fort Ancient.
description_web: Curious about what cultures were flourishing in period in the eastern half of North America? This 90-minute survey of the Adena, Hopewell, Mississippian, and Fort Ancient cultures will explore their material culture from an archaeological perspective.
fee_itemization: Copies (color and black and white) -$60

name: Powering Medical Devices at Pennsic
description_book: How to power your CPAP machine or other medical device in the middle of camp at Pennsic without an extension cord.
description_web: More and more people are coming to camping events like Pennsic, where using commercial power for things like CPAP machines is difficult or impossible to manage. Based on 20+ years of CPAP usage and 25+ years as an amateur radio operator, I'll show you how to power your machine in the field without an extension cord.

name: How to Plan a Safe and Satisfying Pennsic
description_book: Designed to help newcomers & lifers enjoy a stress-free War. How to pre-cook, plan your War, and what-to-pack essentials. Emphasis on pre-cooking.
description_web: Designed to help newcomers and lifers enjoy a stress-free War. How to pre-cook, plan your War, and what essentials to pack. Emphasis on pre-cooking. Lady Bounti has been cooking and assisting in SCA kitchens for 20+ years. She offers meals for singles, newbies, and stragglers every War. Learn how to plan, cook, and pack for Pennsic on a budget, with less stress and more time to spend with your peers.

name: Áine's Teen D&D Adventure
description_book: Join Lady Áine and her D&D5E home-brew Pennsic 49 campaign! Every year a different adventure. What will it be? Must attend all sessions (age12-17).
description_web: Join Lady Áine and her D&D5E home-brew Pennsic 49 campaign! Every year is a different adventure. What will it be? Must attend all sessions (age12-17). The number of players is limited to seven.

name: Janissary Music Class
description_book: Two to three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice.
description_web: Two to three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice. The songs to be taught are *Ceddin Deden, Genc Osman*, and *Hucum* march. Perfect for those who have marching band experience and want to make a big noise.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: Peace Week Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Ranges will be open depending upon marshal availability.

name: Archery Marshals Meeting
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.
description_web: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.

name: The Arrow's Flight
description_book: How your view of the target and the way the arrow flies affects your aim. How to "tune" your arrows, and what arrows are best for your bow.
description_web: How your view of the target and the way the arrow flies affects your aim. How to "tune" your arrows, and what arrows are best for your bow. Why do they say "buy the bow first"? The terms "spine" and "weight" will be discussed, as well as how the size of fletch affects the arrow's flight.
fee_itemization: Handout.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: Pilgrimage History and Songs
description_book: An overview of the practice of pilgrimage in history and the vocal music that came about to accompany it.
description_web: An overview of the practice of pilgrimage in history and the extant vocal music that came about to accompany it. We will specifically look at the *Llibre Vermell de Montserrat* and the *Cantigas de Santa Maria*, and themes throughout the *Cantigas*.

name: Intro to Combat Archery
description_book: An introducton to the world of SCA Combat Archery taught by the East Kingdom's Deputy Earl Marshal for CA.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to give Combat Archery a try? Are you a Combat Archer who wants to learn as much as you can about our little niche? Are you heavy fighter who wants to learn how to fight with or against Combat Archers? Then this is the class for you. Come see kenarri Hrafn Briedthskeggr, the East Kingdom Deputy Earl Marshal for Combat Archery, discuss rules, equipment at tactics, as well as answer any questions you may have on the subject.

name: Navigating the SCA for LGBTQIA+
description_book: Providing resources and information, and answering questions for newcomers who are part of, or related to, the LGBTQIA+ and transgender community.
description_web: In this class I will share my experiences in my 20+ years in the SCA as a queer person with friends and family all over the rainbow. This is not a comprehensive class but I will provide resources and answer questions in order to ease any concerns or point out pitfalls in this great game of ours. I don't know everything, but should be able to point out resources to answer questions I cannot. We are a big umbrella Society and navigating it can be intimidating. Come join us and know you are not alone.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (Between Ankara & Visby Vale there will be signs))
name: The Dangerous Beauty: Series 2, *La Bella... - CCt
description_book: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. How to look and act like an elite historical sex worker. **Age 18+.**
description_web: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. You - yes, *you* have within you the power to secure a military alliance, curate courtly influence, maybe feel more assurance about attending Court, or just chat with that interesting person you met at fighter practice last week. We will be discussing and practicing how to look and act like an elite sex worker while in persona based on a combination of both extant European period writings on social behavior with modern framing of deportment, etiquette, and seduction. This section will cover attractiveness, confidence, sex appeal, body language, and comportment. There will be handouts available. **Age 18+.**

name: *Adventure Maximus*: An Introductory D&D-style RPG
description_book: *Adventure Maximus* is a D&D-style game for young players, with simple character sheets and a basic dungeon crawl. Limited to no more than 8 players.
description_web: *Adventure Maximus* is a D&D-style game for young players, with simple character sheets and a basic dungeon crawl. Limited to no more than 8 players.

name: Multiplayer Medieval Backgammon
description_book: Learn variations of *Tables* (*Nard*, Backgammon) for 4 or 7 players.
description_web: Learn variations of *Tables* (*Nard*, Backgammon) for 4 or 7 players.

name: *Skomorokh*: Comedic Minstrel Theatre of E. Europe
description_book: An unbroken lineage spanning 600 years, the *skomorokhi* were oft-persecuted minstrels, buffoons, harlequins, puppeteers of medieval Eastern Europe.
description_web: With an unbroken lineage spanning more than six centuries, learn of the *skomorokhi*, the oft-persecuted minstrels, buffoons, harlequins, musicians, and puppeteers of medieval and Renaissance Eastern Europe!

name: Food Safety for SCA Cooks
description_book: Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.
description_web:
Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event. Students will learn the causes of food-borne illness as well as safe food handling practices related to these:
Preventing Cross Contamination
Controlling Time and Temperature
Good Personal Hygiene
Cleaning and Sanitizing
Planning a Successful Food Event

Whether you are a new event cook, or you and your kitchen staff have been doing this for years, it is important to be up-to-date and knowledgeable about food safety.
fee_itemization: $2 for class handout

name: Mughal Women's Clothing of the 16th Century
description_book: An overview of fashion worn by women of the Mughal Empire, from early days of Babur to the heyday of Akbar, as viewed from Akbar's Nama commissions.
description_web: An overview of fashion worn by women of the Mughal Empire, from early days of Babur to the heyday of Akbar, as viewed from Akbar's Nama commissions - the *Baburnama*, the *Humayunama* and the *Akbarnama*. Focus is on extant miniatures found in museums around the world.

name: Single-Color Twist-Twined Tablet Weaving
description_book: Discussion about single-colored tablet woven bands and how to create patterns through the turn of the cards.
description_web:
Discussion about single-colored tablet woven bands and how to create patterns through the turn of the cards.
- How to achieve different patterns through turning and flipping cards.
- Which fibers create better contrast.
- Brief history of period pieces created in a single color.

name: Speaking Forsoothly for Newcomers
description_book: Speaking forsoothly is nothing more and nothing less than speaking in a way that sounds medieval.
description_web: In the collective participatory fantasy which is the Society for Creative Anachronism, there is an expectation to act in a way consistent with having a pre-seventeenth century persona. Part of this is "Speaking Forsoothly". "Speaking Forsoothly" can be defined as speaking in such a way that 21st-century North American English speakers would perceive your manner of speech as being from an earlier time, likely before the seventeenth century.

name: Beginning Inkle Weaving
description_book: Learn to read inkle patterns, loom setup, weaves. Bring loom and shuttle, or borrow both. Yarn, all equipment will be provided.
description_web: Learn to create beautiful trim for your garb. We will cover how to read an inkle pattern, how to set up and weave efficiently on the inkle loom. Bring your own loom and shuttle, or borrow one/both. Supplies provided: #10 cotton crochet thread/equivalent, in two colors; scissors; paper and pencil for notes. If you prefer you may bring your own cotton yarn.
fee_itemization:
handout, 6 pages
thread, 2 colors.  approximately 70 yards total per student.
Use of equipment

name: Music to Pass the Time
description_book: What could be better than to break into song? Here is a collection of songs that are easy and fun to sing. Music will be provided or bring your copy.
description_web: Did you ever find time at an event where there just wasn't anything to do while you waited for the feast to be served or court was running late? What could be better than to break into song? Here is a collection of songs that are easy and fun to sing. Music will be available.
fee_itemization: music copy

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers to address higher level improv skills for creating character and building scenes leading to a performance.
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday 8/5 in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (modern experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission. Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Oil Lamps Made **Easy**
description_book: Learn how period, safe, and easy oil lamps are! This class teaches the tricks to burning an inexpensive, easy to obtain lamp with common cooking oil.
description_web: Learn how period, safe and easy oil lamps are! Obtaining lamps, fuel and wicks are quite inexpensive and easy, but to burn oil lamps requires knowledge of some simple but not obvious tricks. The focus of this class is on the "how to" of being able to light your Pennsic camp with a single bottle of common cooking oil.
fee_itemization: $3 fee covers handout and wick kit (includes float and wire wick holders).

name: Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing down and finishing. I will have basic tools and supplies for students.
description_web: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing down and finishing. I will have basic tools and supplies for students, a handout, and kits available for purchase.
fee_itemization: Handout, tools, and supplies for in class are included. Additional supplies can be bought separately.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Embroidery: Long-Arm Cross Stitch
description_book: This class is hands-on and will only involve learning the long-arm cross stitch.
description_web: Embroidery: Long-arm cross stitch. The earliest evidence of the stitch is from 10th-12th century Egypt and can be found in the Greek Islands, Morocco, Assisi embroidery from Italy, the Elizabethan embroideries of Hardwick Hall, and Icelandic embroideries from the 17th century. It can be used to embellish side seams for fun. If you bring your own needle, floss, Aida, or even-count linen and hoop, you do not need to purchase the materials to play along.
fee_itemization: includes hoop, material, needles and floss

name: Construction in Leather Using Welted Seams
description_book: Create a functional object using soft leather and specific tools that incorporates strong flexible seams. **18+**
description_web: Create a functional object using soft leather and specific tools that incorporates strong flexible seams using welted seam construction. This stitching technique works best on supple soft leather such as that of deer or elk and is used extensively in garments and accessories. Students will learn the stitching technique with a hands-on project: making a leather bag to hold their beginning tools. Project kits will be available for purchase at $20 each. These will include a plate punch, a needle, and a pair of scissors as well as the leather project itself. Handouts are free. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: Material kit includes: 1 pair of scissors, 1 plate punch, 1 6 inch, 12 gauge stitching needle - cost $20.

name: Sunk Cost Support
description_book: A short lecture and discussion of how we may be feeling about changing our SCA involvement after pandemic. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Sunk Cost is an economic idea that can be used to evaluate our SCA experiences. Have you found yourself questioning or wishing to change your level of SCA involvement? You're not alone. Sunk Cost Support is a community of people who are reconsidering how, and to what degree they're involved in our hobby. Please join us if any part of this rings true for you. There is also a Facebook group and quarterly calls where we discuss different facets of what goes into our decisions to change our participation. Contact info for these will be shared during the class. **Age 18+.**

name: Getting to Know Chaucer's General Prologue
description_book: Learn why this description of a bunch of folks on their way to Canterbury is both cutting social satire and pretty darn funny.
description_web:
Learn why this description of a bunch of folks on their way to Canterbury is both cutting social satire and pretty darn funny. We'll discuss cultural contexts and vocational stereotypes of Chaucer's era as a way of getting into the humor and the substance of this opening portion of Chaucer's poem. I'll have copies of the general prologue available, but students should ideally have read it before the beginning of class.  
An electronic copy is available in interlinear translation here:  https://chaucer.fas.harvard.edu/pages/general-prologue-0
A modern language translation by itself is here (downloadable): https://www.poetryintranslation.com/PITBR/English/CanterburyTalesI.php 
A copy in Middle English with helpful annotations and contexts is printable here: http://academic.brooklyn.cuny.edu/webcore/murphy/canterbury/2genpro.pdf

name: Food and Feasting for Newcomers
description_book: New to the SCA? Does “medieval food” sound mysterious and scary? Does a “feast” sound intimidating? Let’s demystify it all and make you feel welcome!
description_web: One of the signature parts of many events is the feast, but newcomers sometimes find the very idea of a feast vaguely uncomfortable. Will you have to eat with your hands? Where will you sit? Will the food be weird and unfamiliar, and will it be way too spicy? This class will give you some ideas about what to expect, how to sign up, what to take with you, and why the feast is an integral part of the medieval experience.

name: Latin Reading
description_book: A daily Latin beginner reading class. We will be using Orberg's *Lingua Latina I* (purchase recommended). Handouts available.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale)))
name: Suck it Up: The History of Cupping - CCt
description_book: This class will teach you about the ancient history of cupping. **Age 18+.**
description_web: This class will teach you about the ancient history of cupping, from its beginnings using animal horns to more sophisticated bamboo and glass cups. Learn how different types of cupping were done and what each was used for. The class will include a brief demonstration of fire cupping. **Age 18+.**

name: Spies and Secret Codes
description_book: Youth class on different period secret codes used in various militaries and how to make your own.
description_web: Youth class on different period secret codes used in various militaries and how to make your own.

name: Making Simple Stuffed Dolls For Youth
description_book: (YouthU: 10-17) Learn a basic running stitch or blanket stitch. Youth will be able to make and take a simple doll or stuffed animal.

name: *Daldos*, The Ship Game
description_book: Learn to play in a competition, round-robin style, to get in the most games and the most wins. Winner gets one of the board sets.
description_web: This game existed all the way to Russia and Scandinavia. A board was found on the Mary Rose shipwreck. Come learn to play. This class will be a competition, round-robin style, to get in the most games and the most wins. Winner gets one of the board sets.

name: Introduction to *Pysanky*
description_book: Learn about the rich history of Ukrainian embellished eggs, and try your hand at this "Queen of Folk Arts". Lecture, discussion, and make-and-take.
description_web: *Pysanky* are highly embellished eggs used for centuries in Easter and Vernal Equinox celebrations in many Slavic nations, including modern Ukraine, Poland, and Romania. Come learn about the history, symbolism, and significance of this "Queen of Folk Arts," and make your own *pysanka* to take with you. All materials and tools will be provided. The dyes are permanent, so wear old garb!
fee_itemization: for the tools and materials to make the pysanky

name: Roman Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 1st to the 5th centuries, from across the Roman Empire! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Yoga for Fighters, Fencers and Folk of the Realm
description_book: A 75-minute moving exploration of the ancient practice of yoga focused on the things we choose to do in the SCA.
description_web: A 75-minute moving exploration of the ancient practice of yoga focused on the things we choose to do in the SCA. Whether you are an artist, a warrior, an archer, a dancer, or a servant of Their Majesties, you will find something in this class to help you build strength and balance, increase flexibility and perhaps even find some peace. Yoga connects your breath and your body to help you focus on what you need most at any given moment. What do you need? Bring a mat or a blanket if you have one and clothes you can comfortably move in. Yoga is for every **body**.

name: Recorder Jam with Siri! Part 1
description_book: For near beginners, a reading enhancement session. Loaner SATB recorders available. New Sop recorders, $4. Try different instruments. Youth welcome!
description_web: Play recorders with others in a group setting and read through Renaissance literature. In a 1.5-hour session, we will focus on beginner/easy sequential drills. Bring a music stand (some loaners available) and your instrument or use a loaner (Soprano, Alto, Tenor or Bass). You might wish to try a different instrument. New (Harmony brand) soprano recorders will be available for $4. Youth welcome!
fee_itemization: Copies of music

name: Loom-Woven Pouch
description_book: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom. Class limited to 10 looms.
description_web: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: loom, string, & instructions

name: Game Piece Inspirations
description_book: Demonstration of examples of flamework glass gaming pieces based on period examples for SCA gaming uses.

name: Pear Pie, Peach Pie, Compote: 1549 *Banchetti*
description_book: Pears, red wine, sugar, cinnamon, cloves, pastry. Peaches, sugar, cinnamon, butter, pastry. Melon rind, grape must, spices, honey, sage, rosemary.

name: The Art and Science of Handspinning
description_book: A discussion and application of hand spinning, spindle, and wheel, as it applies to textiles' general world history covered within SCA period.
description_web:
This is a discussion class covering as much of hand spinning as possible. During the class, the following sub-topics will be covered: fibers, tools, techniques, and why there's an obsession with Z and S twist. These topics will be discussed in relation to each other and the cultures in which specific aspects are prevalent. 

Students are encouraged to bring spinning tools and fiber. However, the focus will be on the impact of spinning on history rather than the practical aspect.

instructor: Rav Daud Ibn Dob Ibn Yusif
name: Speaking in Song: Jewish Liturgical Cantilation
description_book: A beginner course on the singing of Hebrew Scripture.
description_web: A beginner course on the history, variety, and method of public readings of Hebrew scripture using using traditional cantilation.

name: Slaves and Freedpersons in Ancient Rome
description_book: Enslavement was a fact of life in ancient Rome, so what might a Roman persona be expected to know about it?
description_web: Enslavement was a fact of life in ancient Rome, so what might a Roman persona be expected to know about it? Join us as we dispel the myths, face the facts and gain an understanding of how Roman people interacted with this challenging tradition.

name: Reading *Sir Orfeo*, or, Faeries Are Sociopaths
description_book: We'll discuss the Middle English lay *Sir Orfeo*, and how it highlights a very different idea of faeries than we often have today.
description_web:
This class provides an overview and some contexts for the Middle English Breton lay *Sir Orfeo*, a medieval reworking of the Orpheus myth with a happy ending. The poem replaces the classical underworld with a faerie court that is, perhaps, more disturbing. We'll discuss the poem as a whole, paying particular attention to the faeries in the text and contextualizing their representation here with some medieval ideas about them. A free handout will be provided, and there will be time for questions and general discussion.  

I will bring some copies, but students should ideally have read the poem before class.  A free translation can be found at:  https://allpoetry.com/Sir-Orfeo

name: Making Herbal Sachets
description_book: Simple class on creating herbal sachets; even the youngest child can go home with a little pouch of sweet-smelling herbs.
description_web: Simple class on creating herbal sachets; even the youngest child can go home with a little pouch of sweet-smelling herbs.

name: Beginner Celtic Trad. Music Session
description_book: Meet other traditional players at this beginner’s class! Play slower tempo Celtic tunes and meet other players at Pennsic. (Set list on web desc.)
description_web:
Meet other traditional Celtic music players at this beginner’s class! Play some slower tempo Celtic tunes and meet other players at Pennsic. Set list:  
Waltz: {*South Wind; Planxty Irwin*}  Jig Set: {*Black Rogue; Jim Wards; Kesh Jig*} Reel Set: {*Rolling in the Ryegrass*(*Shannon Breeze*); *Earls Chair; Otter’s Holt*} Polka Set: {*Britches Fulla Stitches; John Ryan*} Horn Pipes: {*Humors of Tullycrine; Chief O'Neils; Isle of Man*}  Air: *Parting Glass*

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Sea Navigation in the Middle Ages and Renaissance
description_book: Into to period navigation. Includes techniques of Norsemen, medieval Mediterranean, 15th-16th-C Iberia and Northern Europe. Some hands-on activities.
description_web: Into to navigation in the SCA period. Includes techniques of Norsemen, medieval Mediterranean, 15th-16th-century Iberia and Northern Europe. Some hands-on activities.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to "Gypsy" Persona
description_book: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: Open Tent Place Holder
description_book: Open tent place holder.

name: Germanic Breeches: Make-and-Take
description_book: Make one-piece trousers worn by Celtic and Germanic men, Roman soldiers in Gaul, and early Vikings. Bring 2-2.5 yds wool or linen and hand-sewing kit.
description_web:
Forget drawstrings; try a rolled waist for your fighting garb! We’ll learn to make one-piece breeches based on an extant find from Roman-era Germany. Supportive breeches with a utilitarian cut, worn by Celtic and Germanic men, Roman soldiers in Gaul, and early Vikings.
Bring your own fabric, wool or linen, 2-2.5 yards. Please bring chalk, measuring tape, scissors, and sewing supplies (needles, pins, thimble, thread). We will have a limited amount of supplies on hand.
fee_itemization:
1.25 printed handout
1.75 patterning paper

name: Service Dogs & CAWS: What You Need to Know
description_book: An overview of SD laws and rules (state & federal), and a discussion on the Cannon Advanced Warning System & how to use. **Age 18+.**
description_web: An overview of SD laws and rules (state & federal), and a discussion on the Cannon Advanced Warning System; how to sign up and use the service. This class is not a medically licensed class and the instructor is not a licensed professional. However, the class will discuss service dogs as defined by laws, how to recognize and interact with the animals and their handlers. The class will also discuss CAWS, its origins, how to sign up and use, and why it is critical for those with sound-triggered anxiety, autism, SDs, PTSD, and other conditions affected by the blasts of the war cannons at Pennsic. **Age 18+.**

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri  Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Sumptuously Draped: Dressing Like a Roman - CCt
description_book: An exploration of Roman attire language with "how-to's" along the way. Bring fabric if you'd like draping assistance! **Age 18+.**
description_web: An exploration of Roman attire language with “how-to's" along the way. The final half hour of class will be for help with draping. If you'd like assistance, bring your fabric! **Age 18+.**

name: *Domos Draconum* Level 2: More Old School D & D
description_book: **(Age 11-17)** Continues the dungeon adventure begun during Level 1 class. Pre-generated characters available for those who missed previous session.
description_web: Once more into the dungeon! Continues the dungeon adventure begun during the Level 1 class. Pre-generated characters will be available for those who missed the previous session. **(This class is limited to gentles ages 11-17)**

name: Constellations and Crafts
description_book: Learn the constellations by hearing their legends and recreating their patterns in crafts.
description_web: Learn the constellations by hearing their legends and recreating their patterns in crafts.

name: Italian Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 14th-16th centuries in the Italian style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Painting Your Period Canvas Tent
