description_book: Want to paint your tent? Painted it already and want to commiserate with others? Come talk tent decoration and share your experiences!
description_web:
Want to paint your tent? Painted it already and want to commiserate with others? Come talk tent decoration and share your experiences!
The instructor has suffered through the joy of painting three period tents and will share all her trials and tribulations so you can avoid her mistakes!

name: The Art of Woad
description_book: Painting bodies with woad is an art. Let my decades of experience and knowledge of art history help you tackle the daunting stare of the blank canvas.
description_web:
Have you ever wanted to decorate someone with woad, but didn't know what to paint? Or do you already have experience, but want to level up your design game?
This is the class for you. 
Painting bodies with woad is an art. Over more than twenty years I've woaded countless Celts and courts, battles and bards. I've decorated both grand ceremonies and the glorious everyday.
Let me help you expand your artistic toolbox and demystify the process.
In this class we'll talk about historical designs, particularly the art of the early Britons, looking for ideas and context. We'll talk a little bit about how to visually break down what we're seeing. Then we'll talk about some best practices for placing that artwork upon your subject.
By the end of the class, I hope you'll feel more prepared to face the daunting stare of the blank canvas, feel able to enjoy the alchemy of turning flat reference into 3D art, and—most of all—feel ready to decorate your community with beautiful, celebratory woad.
*********
Limited handouts will be available, but the experience will be better using a device (phone, tablet) with web access.
Respecting others' personal space has always been important, but these days it's paramount; please bring a trusted partner if you'd like to practice on someone else. Otherwise, practicing on your own arm or leg has a long and delightful tradition.

name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: I host an open 12-Step meeting at 4:00 pm daily in my camp in EO7, Denys the Decadent's Camp.
description_web: This is an open 12-Step meeting open to all who are looking for a 12-Step meeting to attend for on-site support.

name: Period Card Games: *Laugh and Lie Down*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this simple late-period card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this simple late-period card game.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Middle Eastern Clothing, Design, and Inspiration
description_book: We'll discuss the design and construction of basic Middle-Eastern garb using primarily Ottoman Turkish sources.
description_web: We'll discuss the design and construction of basic Middle-Eastern garb using primarily Ottoman Turkish sources. We will look at examples from within the SCA time period through the “Tulip Period” of Turkish art, approximately 150 years later. Extensive primary source material will be available for viewing.

name: Glass Apprentice Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be *Around the World in 11 Nights*. Eat your heart out, Phileas Fogg!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be *1001 Arabian Nights*. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Welcome to War T(w)een Mixer
description_book: Join us at Family Point for a chance to meet other teens and 'tweens at Pennsic. Open for ages **12-17**. All curfew and supervision rules apply.
description_web: Join us at Family Point for a chance to meet other teens and 'tweens at Pennsic. We provide lights, power, and snacks; you provide charging cables and conversation. Open for those **12-17 years of age**. All curfew and supervision rules must be followed.

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: The Next Degeneration Party
description_book: Held by the Church of Debauchery hosted by the Wizard and Cadre, W10, where the Church is. With Turkish coffee from Your Inner Vagabond. **18+**
description_web: Its a next generation party held by the Church of Debauchery hosted by the Wizard and Cadre, W10, where the Church is. Come and carry the light forth into the next generation. Make memories and new friends as we welcome you all home. Turkish coffee from Your Inner Vagabond. Non-alcoholic beverages will also be had. **Age 18+.**

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Come join us in the Dance Tent for open dancing!

name: Intermediate Archery Class
description_book: Designed to improve your skills beyond basic archery. Class will concentrate on range shoots and war point shooting.
description_web: Archers must bring their own equipment to the range.
fee_itemization: None

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi. Bring your own mat or towel and water! Power up and stretch!
description_web: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi, dancer, fighter, artisan, merchant or royal! Bring your own mat or towel and water, wear easy-to-move-in clothes. Get ready to power up and stretch!

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 1 is more linear; *Étude* 2 adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Armored Combat: Morning
description_book: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.
description_web: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.

name: Lucet, Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-strand cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-strand cord variations. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (4) colors of floss on bobbins, and handout.

name: How to Write Poetry Like a Well-Mannered Brute!
description_book: A poetry workshop for the aspiring heart! An introduction to various period-specific forms. Come with longing, leave with poems of your own devising!
description_web: A poetry workshop for the aspiring heart! An introduction to various period-specific forms, devices, figurative language, the mysteries of enjambment, and the acrostic! Come with longing, leave with poems of your own devising!

name: Introduction to *The Tale of Genji*
description_book: Brief introduction to *The Tale of Genji*, the first novel in the world, written by Lady Murasaki Shikibu sometime in the 11th century in Japan.
description_web: The *Tale of Genji* (*Genjimonogatari*) is the first novel in the world, written by Lady Murasaki Shikibu sometime in the 11th century in Japan. It is a colorful glimpse into the world of the Heian Imperial Court full of romance, political intrigue, kidnappings, and murders by wandering spirits.

name: Basic Pell Construction
description_book: How to build a pell for rattan combat or fencing, quickly and affordably.
description_web: How to build a pell for rattan combat or fencing, quickly and affordably.

name: The History and Development of the Houppelande
description_book: A discussion of the history and development of the houppelande, the last universal style in Europe for men and women. Pattern discussion included.
description_web: A discussion of the history and development of the houppelande, the last universal style in Europe for men and women. Pattern discussion included.  From pictorial sources, we will look at the way the houppelande developed and where it headed in each region of Europe. We will look at two different pattern ideas and what makes them each work.
fee_itemization: $7 for a full-color thick handout.  15 handouts available.

name: Closing Your Clothes
description_book: Hands-on survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for.
description_web: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for. Includes information on where to purchase these items. I will pass around actual closures and demonstrate their use.
fee_itemization: $4 for handout

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 1
description_book: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag, can be done in the car, or at court!
description_web: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at most craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag, and can be done in the car or at court! Focus is on learning how to make both parts of the double stitch flip every time, forming the double stitch and making a ring of double stitches. If no one teaches tatting in your home area, here's your opportunity to learn. Students from previous years are always welcome to stop by for a refresher.
fee_itemization: I provide prewound shuttles and a handout with directions and projects.

name: Four-Color Flat Lucet Cord
description_book: We will make a flat cord on the lucet that will have up to 4 colors using bobbins.
description_web: Cord from a lucet can be quite flexible in color and structure. We will be making a flat cord with up to four colors. The threads hang below the lucet on bobbins to keep from getting tangled. Bring your own lucet and bobbins which can be made out of cardboard or foam, or we will have kits for $20 containing both a lucet, fiber and four bobbins.
fee_itemization:
Lucet $15
thread and bobbins $5

name: Beginner's Beginning Knitting: Washcloth Edition
description_book: This class discusses the basics of knitting and starts the student knitting a washcloth.
description_web: Learn the basics of knitting from choosing the proper needles to understanding what yarn "weights" mean. The class will then move to casting on for a washcloth and practicing the techniques discussed. We will lay the groundwork for the student to understand the basics, giving them the ability and confidence to continue knitting on their own. Some supplies will be provided, but if the students would like to bring their own, it is recommended for them to bring a single set of needles (size 6, 7, or 8) and a ball of cotton worsted weight yarn. (Sugar & Cream recommended, or any other inexpensive yarn brand.)
fee_itemization: The fee covers the cost of knitting needles and yarn. There may be more sets available, but I am still working on sourcing the materials.

name: How to Make Period Furniture That Packs Flat
description_book: Make medieval-style beds, tables, and chests that pack flat for travel and snap together in minutes. Requires a beginner's skill and simple tools.
description_web: Learn how to make medieval-style beds, tables, and cooler chests that pack flat for travel and snap together in minutes. Requires a beginner's level of skill and simple tools.

name: Sixteen Irish Goddesses
description_book: Sixteen of the major goddesses and demi-goddesses of Irish religion, myth, and literature are discussed, honored and invoked.
description_web: Sure, you know Brigid, but the Irish revered so many other goddesses. Learn their names and hear the stories of fifteen more deities and demi-deities. Come with an open heart. Leave with their names in your hearts and on your lips.

name: Scroll Painting for the Very Young
description_book: We have scroll blanks and water colors! You have a 2- to 7-year-old who wants to paint! Let's combine them, and everyone will win.

name: Waste-Free Garment Cutting
description_book: Twice the clothes from half the fabric...or at least, better clothes from less fabric. Come prepared to take notes.
description_web: Hand-spun, hand-woven, hand-finished...they never wasted a single thread. You don't have to! An overview of some of the thriftiest cutting and sewing tricks used in the SCA's target centuries. We cover only pre-17th century Western European clothing.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip on our mini inkle loom.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip on our mini inkle loom. Classroom loaner looms provided. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: weaving materials, string, & instructions

name: *Iki*: Composing Japanese Scroll Texts
description_book: Learn to compose Japanese-style writs, edicts, and petitions. Based on a 16th-c manual by João Rodrigues with ancient and medieval Japanese exemplars.
description_web: An introduction to Japanese diplomata along with the methods by which they are attested and delivered. The structure of Japanese official documents and correspondence is rather different from the textual style in Society documents, letters, and public announcements. This class introduces Japanese epistolatory style and the structures commonly found in official documents. This class will also introduce a few Japanese words which might appear as the header for an official document as well as several stylistic features of official Japanese writing both in Japanese and in English.
fee_itemization: There will be a multipage handout.

name: Michel de Notredame: Linguistic Traits
description_book: We will look at lexical, morpho-phonological, and syntactic traits in the writings of Renaissance author M. de Notredame, aka Nostradamus.
description_web: We will look at lexical, morpho-phonological, and syntactic traits in the writings of Renaissance author M. de Notredame, aka Nostradamus, in an effort to place his language within the context of Middle French. NB: Knowledge of French (Old, Middle, Modern), though helpful, is not necessary.

name: *De Lapidibus*
description_book: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
description_web: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
fee_itemization: no materials, probably a one page handout. No fee for handout.

name: Beginning Silk Banners
description_book: Learn some history and make a simple banner using permanent dyes.
fee_itemization: For the silk fabric, dyes

name: Open Tent Place Holder
description_book: Open tent place holder.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: Open Knitting Circle
description_book: Stuck on a project? Need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.
description_web: Stuck on a project? Need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: There's a free handout, and a bigger optional "manual" available.

name: Áine's Teen D&D Adventure
description_book: Join Lady Áine and her D&D5E home-brew Pennsic 49 campaign! Every year a different adventure. What will it be? Must attend all sessions (age12-17).
description_web: Join Lady Áine and her D&D5E home-brew Pennsic 49 campaign! Every year is a different adventure. What will it be? Must attend all sessions (age12-17). The number of players is limited to seven.

name: Secret Codes and Hidden Messages
description_book: Have you ever wanted to send a secret message to a friend? Learn about secret codes and hidden messages that played a role in medieval life.
description_web: Children will learn how to code and de-code secret messages using various encryption tools like Caesar's ciphers and scytales (wrapping the message around a rod). Students will make and can keep their own Caesar's cipher tool.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman Janissary Band
description_book: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band of the 14th-17th C for performance at Pennsic.
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The *Mehteran* will learn the historic Ottoman songs, *Ceddin Deden*, *Osman Pasa*, and *Nevâ-Ceng-i Harbî* which are played on *zurna, davul*, horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic Janissary march for performance at Pennsic. Brass horn players, percussionists and singers are welcome and encouraged to participate. Further details on the *Mehteran* Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/

name: Early Bird Tournament 16
description_book: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted.
description_web: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted. The purpose of this tourney isn't to win the most bouts, but to find the most interesting facts about your opponents. **"More talk! Less fighting!"** Who will the MIC give the bird to this year?

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Enchant with Your Dance
description_book: All levels. How to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Breath, movement, stillness, emotion, weight, tension... Write a visual poem in dance!
description_web: For all levels. How to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Exercises in breath, movement, stillness, emotion, weight, tension... Use the moves you already know to best effect. Write a visual poem in dance! This is the class I most often get asked to teach.

name: Peace Week Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Ranges will be open depending upon marshal availability.

name: *Meigaku*: Design and Document Japanese Names
description_book: Learn how to design, document, and register with the College of Arms a Japanese name which is appropriate for a particular time and social role.
description_web: Do you want to design a Japanese personal name which is appropriate for a particular time and social role? Do you want to design a Japanese group name for your war band or theater troupe? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culture-specific naming practices? Would you like to know how rank, title, and office relate to all of this and how to include them in people's names? Would you like to learn how to pronounce Japanese names and summon people into court? Then this class is for you! Learn how the structure of Japanese personal and group names varied by time, period, and social status. Learn to design pre-modern names and attach titles.
fee_itemization: There will be a multi-page handout.

name: Mistress Lissa Teaches Glass Bead-Making/Research
description_book: An informal workshop where students can drop by to ask questions and learn new skills from an experienced artisan and research librarian.
description_web: This is an open and informal workshop where students can drop by at any time to ask questions and learn new skills. I have been making beads for 10 years. I am a research librarian in the modern world, and I have a lot of A&S competition experience. No question is too large or small as long as it relates to glass beads. If you are not sure what you want to learn next or where to go in your art, I can help you. If you have a question that I can not answer, I will do my best to help you find the answer. I am happy to teach new bead makers as time allows, but will prioritize questions from bead makers who have at least a bit of prior experience. Materials fee applies only to those who use the available torches for practice/learning.
fee_itemization: glass, and fuel for torches if used

name: The English Language Is a Mess: What Happened?
description_book: A brief linguistic history of Britain.
fee_itemization: $1/handout to cover the cost of printing.

name: Lark In the Morning: Troubadour Poetry and Lore
description_book: A survey of the history and stories of the troubadour poets, rich in anecdote, and with reference to particular motifs and forms of their art.
description_web: A survey of the history and stories of the troubadour poets, rich in anecdote, and with reference to particular motifs and forms of their art. Special attention will be paid to the sestina form!

name: Tips for Teaching a Better A&S Class
description_book: Helpful tips to make it simpler and more efficient to turn your ideas into classes.
description_web: Whether you are planning your first class or have been teaching for a while, A&S classes can be a lot of work to develop and present. This class aims to provide some helpful tips to make it simpler and more efficient to turn your ideas into classes that are both easy for you to teach and easy for your students to understand.

name: Peerage Basics and Roundtable
description_book: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better?
description_web: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better? During this session, we will talk about the peerages, the highest awards in the SCA, and we will have peers there to talk about what their peerages mean to them and how the peerages have changed their SCA experiences. Given on behalf of the late Liam St Liam.

name: Wire Drawing and Riveted Chain Mail
description_book: Learn to make wedge-riveted European *maille*. Historical background, experimental techniques, tools and making real *maille* will be covered.
description_web: The class will cover the historical development of mail (*maille*), its various forms across history and culture as well as the remaining mysteries of the craft. We will demonstrate *maille*-making from drawing the wire to making the links in class.
fee_itemization: handout

name: Cool/Cold Water Neck Wraps
description_book: We all need relief from the heat and these neck wraps will certainly help.
description_web: We all need relief from the heat and these neck wraps will certainly help. With this kit, you'll be able to make a cool/cold water neck wrap. Backstitch and whipstitch are the two stitches that will be used. There will be plenty of kits available if you'd like more than one.
fee_itemization:
Handout $2.00
Materials $3.00

name: SCA Persona Development
description_book: Whether this is your first event or you remember when there were just two kingdoms, every good gentle can continue to build or develop their persona!
description_web:
Whether this is your first event or you remember when there were just two kingdoms, every good gentle can continue to build or develop their personas! The idea of this class is to consider the ways in which you can become a more authentic version of the medieval you. We will explore ways to improve your representation of material culture, consider how a medieval version of yourself might have viewed the world, and learn ways to validate and authenticate your sources. Additionally, with the expansion of the SCA's allowed regions, resources will be available to consider exploring non-Western personas (and navigate ways in which to do so gracefully). If you happen to have source books for your persona or others, please bring them!
Note: The first half of the class will broadly cover developing your persona, the second half will consist of working through and filling out your persona development worksheet.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (Between Ankara & Visby Vale there will be signs))
name: The Dangerous Beauty: Series 3, *La Tresca*! - CCt
description_book: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. How to look and act like an elite historical sex worker. **Age 18+.**
description_web: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. You - yes, *you* have within you the power to secure a military alliance, curate courtly influence, maybe feel more assurance about attending Court, or just chat with that interesting person you met at Fighter Practice last week. We will be discussing and practicing how to look and act like an elite sex worker while in persona based on a combination of both extant European period writings on social behavior with modern framing of deportment, etiquette, and seduction. This section will cover table manners, eating and drinking, serving and being served, and the fine art of being a host. There will be handouts available. **Age limit 18+.**

name: How Did People Throughout History Tell Time?
description_book: Students will learn about different ways people told time, and make and take their own sundial for use at Pennsic.
description_web: Students will learn about different ways people told time, and make and take their own sundial for use at Pennsic.

name: Chess on Different Boards
description_book: Chess had several variations during its history, including round and rectangular boards.
description_web: Chess had several variations during its history, including round and rectangular boards. We'll discuss Byzantine chess (circular board), oblong chess (16x4 board), and courier chess (12x8 with extra pieces).

name: A Manuscript of a Different Color
description_book: An historical overview of illuminated manuscripts on dyed vellum.

name: Pennsic Homes, The Tour
description_book: A tour of just a few of the different types of Pennsic homes and other mobile structures. **Lots** of walking.
description_web: A tour of just a few of the different types of Wagon homes. There are many different ways to make your life easier, such as adapting a Pennsic storage trailer to be a shower/bath trailer. (Reduces set-up and take-down time!) Purpose is to show ideas, and introduce you to homeowners so you know what people to ask questions. A range of expense levels, as well as Pennsic Homes vs. take-it-to-events wagons. **Lots** of walking.

name: Concerning Mohammed and the Well-Guided Caliphs
description_book: A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a later Muslim.
description_web: Concerning Our Lord the Prophet Mohammed (Blessings upon Him, his Kindred and his Companion Train) and the Well-Guided Caliphs. A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a 12th-century North African Muslim.

name: The Pilgrimage Project
description_book: Learn the songs of our Pennsic Pilgrimage! Open to all! Take up your staff and join us. Music provided.
description_web: For lo, these many years at Pennsic we have gone on Pilgrimage one afternoon of War Week, singing songs from the *Llibre Vermell de Montserrat* and the *Cantigas de Santa Maria*. Come learn the songs and consider joining us this year! All are welcome! Music provided. Pilgrimage will happen on the Tuesday afternoon of War Week, meeting at University Point, time TBD.

name: Open Tent Place Holder
description_book: Open tent place holder.

name: The Viborg Shirt Seams (11th-C Danish *Skyrta*)
description_book: This class will review the cut and construction seams used to recreate the linen shirt found near Viborg Søndersø, Denmark.
description_web: The Viborg shirt is the only linen shirt from the Viking age (~11th C) found in Scandinavia or Europe in such good condition. The shirt has 10 pattern pieces and uses 8 different seam types. This class will discuss the find, examine a recreation and work through samples of the 8 different seam types. This is a combination show-and-tell with some hands-on sewing of samples.
fee_itemization: Printed handout, linen, thread, needle.

name: Fun 15th-Century English Dances
description_book: Different versions of the fun 15th-C English dances *Oringe* & *Grene Gynger*. All footwork taught; suited for all levels!
description_web: Different versions of the fun 15th-century English dances *Oringe* & *Grene Gynger*. All footwork taught; suited for all levels!

name: Introduction to Roman Cooking and Eating
description_book: Hands-on class featuring recipes from Apicius. Students will make the food, then recline and dine while learning about Roman dining customs.
description_web: Introductory level, hands-on class featuring recipes from Apicius. Students will participate in making a number of dishes to then be enjoyed while reclining on a triclinium, or three-sided Roman dining couch. While eating, we will discuss Roman dining customs and practices. **Allergy Alert: Some of the recipes featured will contain nuts.**
fee_itemization: hand-outs are free, food materials used/consumed in class total $5

name: Bellydance: Building Blocks
description_book: Learn the building blocks of bellydance, including basic footwork, combos, and isolations. Warm-up, stretch, and drills, followed by dancing!
description_web: Learn the building blocks of bellydance in a safe, non-judgemental environment. This class is for anyone who would like a refresher and true beginners who want to learn how to make their hips do the thing and what muscles are actually involved in snake arms anyway? We will begin with a full body stretch and warm-up followed by learning common ubiquitous dance moves from a foundational beginning. Afterwards, a short choreography and some partner and group dancing. No partner required, open to all ages.

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers to address higher level improv skills for creating character and building scenes leading to a performance.
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday 8/5 in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (modern experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission. Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Heraldry for Scribes
description_book: You have an award scroll to illuminate and have no idea what all those Heraldic Words mean?
description_web: This class will help explain the use of Heraldic Language, so you may draw any device or badge correctly. It will also provide titles to heraldic books and web sites that will answer the many questions that arise in regards to Heraldry. Youths and beginning heralds are also welcome.

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (Fibula)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/fibula from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools will be available. Bring yours, if possible.
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or fibula from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along.
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: Favors and Tokens
description_book: A discussion on the meaning of favors and tokens and their uses within the SCA.
description_web: A discussion on the meaning of favors and tokens and their uses within the SCA.

name: Making Embroidery Easy
description_book: Tips and tricks for getting through an embroidery project quickly and with less frustration. Students encouraged to bring projects.
description_web: Tips and tricks for getting through an embroidery project quickly and with less frustration. Students encouraged to bring projects. Some stitches will be taught based on student's requests/desires.

name: Stick to Sword: Rattan Weaponmaking 101
description_book: This class is designed to turn a rattan stick into a list-legal rattan weapon in under an hour. Show up with a stick, leave with a weapon!
description_web: This class is designed to turn a rattan stick into a list-legal rattan weapon in under an hour. Show up with a stick, leave with a weapon!

name: Danish Bog Shirt: Make-and-Take
description_book: Create an early women’s shirt from extant finds in Denmark. Bring 1-1.5 yards wool or linen and sewing supplies (needles, pins, scissors, thread).
description_web:
We’ll make a very early period women’s shirt, based on extant finds from Denmark. One piece, four seams. This is a great project to have in your skill set to use up fabric remnants and practice hand sewing!
We’ll learn some easy no-sew outfits that you can put together right here at Pennsic, over your new shirt!
Bring your own fabric; undyed wool or linen is best. 1 yard for sizes S-L, 1.5 yards for all sizes XL and up. Please bring chalk, measuring tape, scissors, and sewing supplies (needles, pins, thimble, thread). We will have a limited amount of supplies on hand.
fee_itemization:
Printed handout- 1.25 ea
Pattern paper - 1.75 ea

name: *Xia*: The Chinese Knight-Errant
description_book: An examination of the history and motivations of Chinese *youxia*.  **Age 18+.**
description_web: A discussion of how chivalry was practiced in China in the Middle Ages. This class will cover how *Xia* is different from Western chivalry, how it is the same, and ways to incorporate these into your persona. **Age 18+.**

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: Latin Reading
description_book: A daily Latin beginner reading class. We will be using Orberg's *Lingua Latina I* (purchase recommended). Handouts available.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales.

name: Illumination for Youth and Teens
description_book: Learn about the medieval art of illumination. We will learn about methods and materials, then paint our own illumination (ages 10-17).

name: *Senat*
description_book: Egyptian gaming, learn to roll sticks. Come learn to play. Then, stay to play round-robin competition. Winner receives a game set.
description_web: Egyptian gaming, learn to roll sticks. Come learn to play. Then, stay to play round-robin competition. Winner receives a game set.

name: Beyond the Cloth: Persona Glassware, Early Period
description_book: Discussion of glassware from ancient times through the Middle Ages, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
description_web: Have you ever walked around an event with a glass in your hand? People will notice it long before they even think about looking at your shoes. Make a statement by having the right kind of glass vessel for your persona! Discussion of glassware from ancient times through the Middle Ages, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. A list of reference books will be available. Join us again at 3:00 pm for a live, narrated demonstration of the making of an Early Period drinking vessel by Master Ali (Arab Boy)!

name: Recorder Jam with Siri! Part 2
description_book: Read through Renaissance 4-part recorder literature. Loaner SATB recorders available. Soprano recorders available for purchase, $4.
description_web: Play recorders with others in a group setting and read through Renaissance literature in four parts. Bring a music stand (some loaners available) and your instrument or use a loaner (Soprano, Alto, Tenor or Bass). You might wish to try a different instrument. New (Harmony brand) Soprano recorders will be available for $4.
fee_itemization: Copies of music

name: Sprang Basics
description_book: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch.
description_web: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch.
fee_itemization: loom, accessories, string, & instructions

name: Welsh Poetic Harmony
description_book: An intro to *cynghanedd* (literally “harmony”): Welsh poetic alliteration ranging from arrangements of consonant sounds to forms of stress and rhyme.
description_web: *Cynghanedd* (literally “harmony”) is the name for the forms of Welsh poetic alliteration. At its simplest, it is just the arrangements of consonant sounds, but more elegant forms depend on stress and rhyme as well. This class will discuss the four main forms of *cynghanedd*, with examples in Welsh and English.

name: Lampworked Bead Shaping
description_book: Make several period bead shapes: donut, round, barrel, and melon.
description_web: For those who have taken the beginner/safety lampworking class or equivalent, and would like to go a little further. In this class we will practice using heat control, gravity, and basic shaping tools to make bead shapes common in period, and to clean up the hole ends and eliminate spikes of glass on the mandrel. We'll focus on taking the time to do things right, but hope to cover donut, round, barrel, and melon shapes. Materials are limited but auditors are welcome as space permits.
fee_itemization: fuel and glass

name: Making It Real
description_book: Have you ever had a “Magic Moment” at an event? This class is intended to be a lively discussion of how to foster those moments at events.
description_web: Have you ever had a “Magic Moment” at an event? They are rare, but precious. The instructor, a longtime participant, will lead a discussion of how event design, planning, and activities can help give more people the Magic Moments that keep many of us coming back.

name: Introduction to German Brick Stitch Embroidery
description_book: Come learn about the history and somewhat muddled origins of German Brick Stitch, a style of embroidery in Europe during the 13th-15th centuries.
description_web: Come learn about the history and...somewhat muddled...origins of German Brick Stitch! This survey of Brick Stitch will explore early examples of brick stitch embroidery in Europe, both as a stand-alone stitch and the embroidery style called German Brick Stitch. Thought to have originated in Westphalia and Lower Saxony, this style of embroidery was used during the 13th-15th centuries for decoration on items both secular and ecclesiastical.
fee_itemization: Handout printing fee - $2

name: Bring Out Your Looms!
description_book: Group discussion about tablet weaving problems, solutions, tools, and hacks. Bring your project with questions and help others.
description_web:
Group discussion about tablet weaving problems, solutions, tools, and hacks. Bring your project with questions and help others.

How do you keep cat hair out of your woven silk band?
Why are your edges bumpy?
Are you afraid to weave with wool?
Silk can be expensive, what should you know ahead of time?

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Adult Rehearsal
description_book: Join a low-stress theatre experience by KWP Readers' Theatre, creating a staged reading of the script *The Ecclesiazusae; or Female Parliament.*
description_web: Known World Players Readers' Theatre provides a low-stress opportunity and theater experience by creating a staged reading of the script *The Ecclesiazusae; or Female Parliament.* A staged reading is a performance where the actors perform with the script in their hand and there are no props, costumes, scenery, or special lighting. No audition is necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed on Friday 8/2 in the Performing Arts Tent at 7 pm. Sponsored by Known World Players.

name: Helm Padding and Strapping 101
description_book: This class covers basic helmet safety for heavy combat. How to pad and strap a helmet for rattan fighting.
description_web: This class covers basic helmet safety for heavy combat. How to pad and strap a helmet for rattan fighting.

name: Pooh, Pooh, Pooh! I See You!
description_book: The Evil Eye is Everywhere. A look at the evil eye focusing on medieval Judaic view of superstition, amulets, talismans, and incantations.

name: *Origami* Lotuses
description_book: Come fold paper lotuses from the secret lands of *Khandroling*.
description_web: We will fold *origami* lotuses. This class is suitable for **all** ages.
fee_itemization: All materials provided to make 2 origami lotuses

name: Where's Lord Waldo?
description_book: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.
description_web: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: The History of Prostitution - CCt
description_book: History of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. Topics include brothels, daily life, garb, and courtesan culture. **Age 18+.**
description_web: A survey of the history of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. We will be covering such topics as the formation of red light districts, brothel management, contraception, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period. **Age 18+.**

name: Beginner Dance: *English Country*
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple *English Country Dances*.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple English Country Dances.

name: Learn About Equestrian Games
description_book: Join us on our wooden "steeds" and try your hand at the different types of games our horses and humans participate in!

name: Teen Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: Learn the art of Viking wire weaving. Hands-on class (Ages 13-17).

name: Youth Armored Combat: Afternoon
description_book: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.
description_web: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.

name: Arabic Hip Movements
description_book: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental dance perspective. A beginning knowledge of ME Dance is appreciated.
description_web: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental dance perspective, taught by Baroness Simone. A beginning knowledge of Middle Eastern dance is appreciated.

name: Make Beautiful Scrolls Using Micography
description_book: Learn about micography and how it was used in manuscripts. We'll work on plotting out designs, and practice what we have learned.
description_web: First we will learn about micography and how it was used in manuscripts. Then we will work on plotting out designs and practice what we have learned to create some art. Will not have handouts available past 10 gentles, but the handout is also online. (If you have lightboards, pencils, and dip pens with a crow nib (or C-6), bringing them would be appreciated, but not necessary. Instructor will have some, but may not be able to cover all participants.)
fee_itemization: $1 - for handout.

name: *The Island Princess* and English Colonial Fantasy
description_book: We’ll talk about how Fletcher's play imagines “India” as well as historical and cultural contexts for shifting English attitudes about the world.
description_web:
John Fletcher’s *The Island Princess* (c. 1619-21) draws from reports of European traders in the East Indies, playing fast and loose with historical details to create a colonialist fantasy adventure with heroes, cowards, pagan gods, a tyrant, a prison break, a beautiful and exotic princess, and (of course) her last minute conversion to Christianity.  The play saw immense popularity during the seventeenth and early eighteenth century, and has seen renewed interest in the 21st century, particularly in the ways it speaks to English ideas about “exotic” climes and peoples.  
We’ll talk about the play’s treatment of “India” and the titular Island Princess, Armusia, as well as some historical and cultural contexts for shifting English ideas about English people and values in relation to the rest of the world. 

You can find free online versions of the play at A Digital Anthology of Early Modern English Drama Info. 
- Page for the play at EMED: https://emed.folger.edu/ip
- HTML version: https://emed.folger.edu/sites/default/files/folger_encodings/html/EMED-IP-3.html
- PDF version: https://emed.folger.edu/sites/default/files/folger_encodings/pdf/EMED-IP-reg-3.pdf

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Bookbinding
description_book: Basic binding of books, history, hands-on, practical application. Learn different stitches and page attachment; leave with a small bound book.
description_web: Basic binding of books, a bit of history, hands-on, and practical application. Participants will learn different types of stitching and page attachment, plus covers, and will leave with a small bound book and/or a girdlebook cover.
fee_itemization: Paper, leather, wax, thread, cloth

name: Traditions in the SCA: A Roundtable Discussion
description_book: Discussion of how traditions in the SCA can vary between different kingdoms and regions. Great for newcomers and the very experienced in the SCA.
description_web: Discussion of how traditions in the SCA can vary between different kingdoms and regions. Come and share how things are done in your kingdom and learn about how other kingdoms do things. We will be discussing a variety of topics including, but not limited to, typical events, court, peerage ceremonies, regalia, food, and whatever else the participants want to talk about. Also, feel free to just sit and listen if that is what you prefer. This class is a great opportunity for newcomers to the SCA to learn more about our Society's traditions and get answers to those questions you might not have dared to ask.

name: Sources for Islamic Persona: A Discussion
description_book: Anyone who has suggestions for sources for developing such a persona is welcome to join in.
description_web: Anyone with such a persona, interested in developing one, or with suggestions of how to develop one, is welcome to join in.

name: Pillbox Hat Patterning and Sewing Class
description_book: *Tarboosh, fez*, sugarloaf, pillbox: pattern and sew this simple, broadly-attested hat to fit your head and persona. Kits $20. Novice sewer friendly.
description_web: *Tarboosh, fez*, sugarloaf, pillbox: pattern and sew this simple, broadly-attested hat to fit your head and persona. Hat kits include instruction sheets, aluminum foil and painter’s tape for patterning, two pieces of contrasting fabric, three needles, pins, a small spool of thread, a pair of shears, and a piece of soap or a pencil stub for fabric marking. Novice sewer friendly.
fee_itemization: aluminum foil and painter’s tape for patterning, two pieces of contrasting fabric, three needles, pins, a small spool of thread, a pair of shears, and a piece of soap or a pencil stub for fabric marking.

name: *Domos Draconum* Level 1: Intro - Old School D & D
description_book: Intro to the 1980 Basic version of D & D using only six-sided dice. Character generation, then an adventure in a sample dungeon. **Ages 11-17**
description_web: Welcome to your Doom! An introduction to the 1980 Basic version of D & D using only six-sided dice. Character generation followed by an adventure in the sample dungeon. **This class is limited to gentles ages 11-17.**

name: Early Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 5th -11th centuries from Europe and the Middle East! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Open Torch
description_book: If you have taken a class at any time on using a torch to make things out of glass, come and practice your art.
fee_itemization: $3.50 per hour for map gas. No cost if you bring your own map gas. Please bring your own glass. If no merchant is selling glass, I will have some at my cost.

name: Bardic Coaching
description_book: Students bring in three to five minutes of performance and receive individual work and feedback.
description_web: Participants will perform 3 to 5 minutes of any material and receive personalized feedback and work on the piece.

name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: I host an open 12-Step meeting at 4:00 pm daily in my camp in EO7, Denys the Decadent's Camp.
description_web: This is an open 12-Step meeting open to all who are looking for a 12-Step meeting to attend for on-site support.

name: Game of the Goose
description_book: Period game in the style of "Chutes and Ladders". Suitable for children, but also a popular tavern game for adults.
description_web: Period game in the style of "Chutes and Ladders". The game is purely deterministic dice-based so it is suitable for children. It was also known from its tavern version which required gambling and/or drinking. We will review the rules and then play through a game.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: *Alquerques*
description_book: A checkers-style period game from the Middle East. We will review the rules and then play through some games to learn the basic strategies.
description_web: A checkers-style period game from the Middle East. We will review the rules and then play through some games to learn the basic strategies.

name: Night Sky Over Pennsic
description_book: Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Telescope, binoculars, chair, blanket if desired. Small telescope will be set up for viewing.
description_web: Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Bring a camp chair or blanket if desired. A small telescope will be set up for viewing. As the battlefield is parking during the first week, the open area in front of Pennsic University Point will be used which also blocks light pollution from spotlights in the parking lot. As this basically a star party, other telescopes and binoculars are quite welcome. Do not use hand sanitizer on eyepieces or lenses. Sunset is around 8:30PM.
fee_itemization: handouts will be free. I may bring copies of Sky and Telescope and Ad Astra to give away. I will use copies of Sky and Telescopes star maps with my class handouts and they have no problem with my doing this from my online superscription per phone conversation.

name: *i Verdi Confusi*: Peace Week Follies
description_book: The first week needs entertainment too! Join us for *Commedia dell'Arte* follies at the Amphitheatre!
description_web: The first week needs entertainment too! Join us for *Commedia dell'Arte* follies at the Amphitheatre!

name: Glass Apprentice Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be *Around the World in 11 Nights*. Eat your heart out, Phileas Fogg!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be *1001 Arabian Nights*. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Compare 16th-C Persian & Ottoman Turkish Clothing
description_book: 16th-C Persian and Ottoman garments can be confusing. We look at similarities and differences as well as potential garment patterns.
description_web: Persian? Turkish? Perkish? 16th-century Safavid Persian and Ottoman Turkish garments can be confusing. Additionally we may be puzzled by fabric options. We look at clothing and textiles from both cultures to see similarities and differences. Included are hints for selecting modern fabrics and potential garment patterns. I concentrate on the 16th century because I have found almost no information about earlier Ottoman clothing.

name: *Seishin-ryū Mushin-an Chaseki*: Tea Ceremony
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear comfortable clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a small fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a small fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room. This is a participatory recreation of a sixteenth-century *wabi*-style tea gathering.
fee_itemization: Cost of tea and sweets - 10 per sitting.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Raunch and Romance - CCt
description_book: Take turns reading period & Scadian romantic & erotic poetry. We will provide some options to pick from, or feel free to bring your own! **18+ only.**
description_web: Take turns reading period and Scadian romantic and erotic poetry. Bring your sauciest stanzas, your lustiest limericks, and your amorous alliteration! We will provide some options to pick from, or feel free to bring your own! **18+ only.**

name: T(ween) Game Night and Character Building
description_book: Bring your favorite board or card game to share! Play others' favorites. Interested in an RPG tomorrow? Build your character tonight! **Age 12-17.**
description_web: Have your favorite board or card game to share? Bring them along, teach, or learn how to play! For those interested, Lady Cecily is planning an RPG adventure (think D&D but different mechanics). Use this time to think through the character sheet and prepare yourself. **Ages 12-17.**

name: Wedding for Daru Bleudwydd and Sir Corvus Corvinus
description_book: A small get-together and ceremony at the castle gates on the 4th of August.
description_web: A small get-together and ceremony at the castle gates on the 4th from 7:30 pm until 9:00 pm. It is open to anyone who would like to come witness Lady Daru and Sir Corvus exchange vows and share in the ceremony.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Come join us in the Dance Tent for open dancing!

name: 4th Annual Pennsic Flight Shoot
description_book: 4th Annual Pennsic Flight Shoot. Flight shoot for distance. Categories: period handbow, modern handbow, crossbow.
description_web:
The 3rd Annual Flight Shoot has Period Handbow, Modern Handbow, and Crossbow categories. All shooters at the Flight Shoot will have their distance measured, and there will be prizes for each category. 

In addition, the Period Handbows and Period Crossbows will get points for the Period Bow Shoot, which takes place Sunday morning of War Week. For Period bows, the distance in yards will be divided by 10, so 300 yards equals 30 points, 200 yards = 20 points, and those scores will be added to the points they score at the Period Bow Shoot.

Period Bow means **NO** plastic arrow nocks; all arrows must be shot off the hand with no fixed arrow-shelf of any kind, no pistol grips. *Period bow score requires garb to match.*

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi. Bring your own mat or towel and water! Power up and stretch!
description_web: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi, dancer, fighter, artisan, merchant or royal! Bring your own mat or towel and water, wear easy-to-move-in clothes. Get ready to power up and stretch!

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 1 is more linear; *Étude* 2 adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Armored Combat: Morning
description_book: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.
description_web: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.

name: Russian Gold Work Embroidery
description_book: Learn the basics of how to apply pearls, beads, padding and "waste of time" (cording). Kits will contain all the materials to finish a bag.
description_web:
This is a **4-hour** workshop to get you started on your project. We will be learning the basics of how to apply pearls, beads, padding and "waste of time" (cording). Kits will contain all the materials to finish a large 9" x 15" bag. These techniques can be applied to a variety of projects. Kits include hoop, handout, "waste of time" (cording), pearls, seed beads, padding, cotton cording, needles, fabric, linen or cotton for backing, bees wax, threads. Please bring scissors. 
**We will take a break for lunch after 2 hours.**
fee_itemization: Material fee includes hand out, "waste of time" (cording), pearls, seed beads, padding, cotton cording, needles, brocade, linen or cotton for backing, bees wax, threads

name: Embroidery: How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. Sample fabric, needle and thread provided. Please bring scissors and a small embroidery hoop if you have them. Strict limit of 10 students! Handouts will be given to everyone but kits and hands-on teaching will be limited to 10.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery floss
Needles
Hoops
Sample fabric

name: The 6th-Century Plague
description_book: Exploring the Justinian Plague, the 6th-century iteration of the Bubonic Plague, and how pandemics affect the cultures they touch.
description_web: “The Plague of Justinian”, the first appearance of the Bubonic Plague, arrived in Alexandria in 541 CE, reaching Constantinople the next year and killing an estimated 90% of its occupants. It spread across the entire Mediterranean world, hitting ports first, and then moving inland. *Yersinia Pestis* changed the history of Europe, returning in waves, until it disappeared around 750 CE. Many are familiar with the "Black Death" of the 14th century, but the 5th-century plague may be more fascinating.

name: Cryptography in the Middle Ages
description_book: An overview of period pre-1600s cryptography. Handouts are limited but digital copies are available.
description_web: This course is a survey of cryptography up to around 1600. We will review the history and evolution of cryptography in general and look at several cryptographic systems in-depth to provide a working understanding of how these ciphers are employed. Handouts are limited but digital copies are available.

name: A Feast Fit For Bees (And Other Pollinators!)
description_book: Planting a garden for pollinators is easy, fun and quite period. We will discuss history, plants, plantings and what may stop by for a snack.
description_web: Planting a garden for pollinators is easy, fun and quite period. We will discuss the needs and plant preferences of honeybees and other critters who will stop by for a snack. Historic designs as well as modern garden adaptation will also be explored. The second hour, you have the option of walking Cooper’s Lake Campground with me to take a look at flower shapes, plants and pollinators.

name: Rattan Weapon Making: Part 2
description_book: A step up from beginner rattan sword making; teaches skills like grip shaving plus attaching mace, pole arm, and axe heads to a haft.
description_web: This class is a step up from beginner rattan sword making, and teaches skills like grip shaving plus attaching mace, pole arm, and axe heads to a haft.  In short, how to go from making a basic rattan sword to making a rattan weapon that fits you best, be it a sword, axe, mace, pole arm or spear.

name: Deeper Look at Textiles & Trim of Viking Age Dress
description_book: By investigating extant textiles, this class will aid in making informed choices for selecting fabrics and adding details to Viking Age garments.
description_web: By looking deeper at both the textiles and the details from extant items, this class aims to help individuals make informed choices for crafting their garments. Textile examples will clarify the weaves and weights of period fabrics and there will also be discussion of possible modern substitutions. Additionally, practical details for finishing or embellishing garments will be explored and their history investigated. The goal of this class is to help the individual understand how daily life during the Viking Age could affect how textiles were crafted and worn.
fee_itemization: A link will be provided for download for free.  Hardcopy in color will be $20 (60-page document that is mostly in color that is bound with indexed tabs).

name: Keyhole Neckline Facing for a Simple Tunic
description_book: Adding a keyhole neckline facing can make nice finished edge and decorative accent to a simple tunic. Make and take a simple pattern for the facing.

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 2
description_book: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag. Do it in the car or at court!
description_web: Part 2 will review the double stitch. You'll learn how to use the picot as decorative element and as a way to join rings. Time and energy permitting, we'll advance on to making chains between rings. Attendees from previous years are always welcome to come and refresh their memory.
fee_itemization: I provide a prewound shuttle, a handout with directions & projects.

name: Leather Dyes of Medieval Europe
description_book: Principles and practical methods for recreating leather dyes as noted in medieval manuscripts.
description_web: The objective of this class is to understand the basic principles of reproducing European medieval leather dyes as recorded in medieval manuscripts, and to review and demonstrate the reproduction of eight manuscript recipes for making leather dyes in red, black, blue, green, yellow, purple, grey and brown.
fee_itemization: Instruction booklet

name: Carry All Your Crap on Your Head
description_book: Learn the proper walk to help you balance loads of gear and goods on your noggin like a bellydancer!
description_web: The problem: You have only two hands, and a lot of stuff to transport. The solution is right on your shoulders! We will cover the proper walk technique to help you balance loads on your head, talk about how to bundle goods to carry, what baskets work well, and practice putting things on your head with grace and aplomb. Not dancer-specific, but for anyone who needs an extra hand while traversing the world. Information applicable to multiple cultures. Kindly bring a coil-built basket if you have one, and a lightweight cotton veil or scarf. (This class is inspired by all the fine folk who have stopped me at previous Pennsics and asked how I'm carrying my loads hands-free)

name: A Guide to Retaining
description_book: "A Guide to Retaining" will cover appropriate protocol and behavior when retaining for SCA Royalty in various kingdoms.
description_web: "A Guide to Retaining" is a newcomer-appropriate and beginner-level class focused on the basics of retaining behavior and royal protocol. This class will go in-depth to cover different protocols of different kingdoms in order to provide a comfortable foundation for newcomers and beginners in order to start retaining. This class is best suited for people who have never retained before or newcomers to the SCA looking to get involved and know more people. All experience and age levels are welcome and this class will be taught with a discussion-based lecture.

name: Rob Peter to Feed Paul: More Feast for Less $
description_book: Twice the feast, both in servings and in historical accuracy, for half the money **and** less work. Includes sourcing,  prep, and presentation.
description_web: How to plan and produce a fabulous, reasonably historic feast on the cheap. A king's dinner on village headman's budget is not only possible, it's fun! Learn how to waste less and serve more without going crazy. Come prepared to take notes. Note: A description of butchering will be included.

name: Beginning Irish Language
description_book: Learn pronunciation, basic grammar, how to meet and greet, ask a few questions and reply, count, and be polite in the Irish language.
description_web: Ever been stymied by an Irish or Scottish name, phrase, or lyric? Come learn pronunciation, basic grammar, how to meet and greet, ask a few questions and reply, count, and be polite in the Irish language in a fun and relaxed setting.
fee_itemization: Paper handouts of class materials

name: Make a Pouch!
description_book: Learn to sew and create something useful for the rest of Pennsic! Create a pouch to carry your things.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Sticks, string, & instructions

name: Shakespeare Monologues – for Fun and Auditions
description_book: An easy, no-pressure way to start – or brush up. Need a speech to audition for Pennsic 50 Romeo and Juliet? We have dozens. Free. And coaches.
description_web: An easy, no-pressure way to start – or brush up. Need a speech to audition for Pennsic 50 Romeo and Juliet? We have dozens - all taken from that play. Free copies for the asking. And coaches. Our handouts include "translations" to demystify Shakespeare's weird words and phrasing. We'll have experienced actors on hand to help you, answer questions, and let you have fun with the, frankly, completely bonkers Romeo and Juliet plot points.

name: Macramé
description_book: The history of macramé, how to tie the basic knots and combine them into patterns.
description_web: Come learn about the history of macramé long before the tacky plant hangers of the 1970s. This class will teach you the two basic macramé knots and how to put them together to form a multitude of patterns. You will leave with a macramé coaster to take home with you.

name: Night's Black Agents: Elizabethan Espionage
description_book: A survey of Elizabeth's intelligence service, spymasters, codes, operations and agents, as well as the litany of conspiracies and plots they faced!

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Jewelry-Making, or How to Float a Pearl
description_book: Basics on design/recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, scalloping, extra adornments, fixing broken items.
description_web: Basics on design or recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, achieving scalloping, adding extra adornments, fixing a broken item, making a floating bead necklace, dropping a knot where you want it.
fee_itemization: Kit with wire, string, beads, trinkets, closures

name: Open Tent Place Holder
description_book: Open tent place holder.

name: Overview: The Bara Method from *The Modern Maker*
description_book: The Bara notation is a way of expressing sewing patterns using physical math with proportional measurements. It's mind blowing.
description_web:
The Bara notation shows up on Alcega and a couple of other period tailoring manuals. Matthew Gnagy dug into the topic in his books *The Modern Maker*, Vols. 1 and 2.
The Bara notation is a way of expressing pattern in a simple way where the measurements on the pattern are represented as a proportion of a measurement of the person who will eventually wear the garment. It's mind blowing.

We will review *The Modern Maker* books and discuss why they are appropriate to an SCA setting. Then we’ll delve into the Bara method as laid out in these books: what it is, how to use it, how it was probably used historically. Then we'll walk through drafting the bodice of a woman's kirtle which would be appropriate to the late-15th to early-16th century England, France, Spain, Brittany, and Flanders.

name: Henna History
description_book: Learn the history of henna across centuries and cultures.
description_web: We'll discuss the multicultural history of henna as used for hair, cloth dye, and for body art.
fee_itemization: a copy of my current research and bibliography

name: *Seishin-ryū Chadō Okeiko*: Tea Ceremony Workshop
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 
*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 
If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan. Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.
There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like. There is some controversy over just how old they are. Today, men use slightly larger *fukusa* than women do. Further, men always use purple *fukusa* and women typically only use purple *fukusa* after they have become senior instructors. Regardless, here are purchase options. (1) You can always try ebay. (2) You can order online from any of several tea supply stores in Japan through rakuten.co.jp. (3) You can order one from a fellow in Portland http://www.teadogu.com/fukusa.html. (Yes, they really are that expensive.) I will try to pick up a couple of loaners (I currently have one) between now and Pennsic. Regardless, the fan is the symbol of the guest, and the *fukusa* is the symbol of the host in the world of tea.
fee_itemization: This class will include a multi-page printed handout.

name: Áine's Teen D&D Adventure
description_book: Join Lady Áine and her D&D5E home-brew Pennsic 49 campaign! Every year a different adventure. What will it be? Must attend all sessions (age12-17).
description_web: Join Lady Áine and her D&D5E home-brew Pennsic 49 campaign! Every year is a different adventure. What will it be? Must attend all sessions (age12-17). The number of players is limited to seven.

name: Youth Introduction to Japanese Calligraphy
description_book: Learn the first basic strokes of Japanese Calligraphy. Count to three and write tree. (Recommended for those under 12.)

name: Introduction to Central Asian Archery/Thumb Ring
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol, Turk, etc. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw. **Age limit 18+.**
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Naran Numuchi, Noyon of Ponte Alto, Order of the Laurel for Mongol and Turkish Archery, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), has been shooting thumb ring since 1998 and, since then, has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows. Naran Noyon will have some thumb rings to try, but you must bring your own bows and arrows, preferably with no shelf or pistol grip, and arrows should be sufficiently long to accommodate the 2-4" extra of thumb draw. **Age limit 18+.**

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman Janissary Band
description_book: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band of the 14th-17th C for performance at Pennsic.
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century.
