The *Mehteran* will learn the historic Ottoman songs, *Ceddin Deden*, *Osman Pasa*, and *Nevâ-Ceng-i Harbî* which are played on *zurna, davul*, horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic Janissary march for performance at Pennsic. Brass horn players, percussionists and singers are welcome and encouraged to participate. Further details on the *Mehteran* Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Adult Rehearsal
description_book: Join a low-stress theatre experience by KWP Readers' Theatre, creating a staged reading of the script *The Ecclesiazusae; or Female Parliament.*
description_web: Known World Players Readers' Theatre provides a low-stress opportunity and theater experience by creating a staged reading of the script *The Ecclesiazusae; or Female Parliament.* A staged reading is a performance where the actors perform with the script in their hand and there are no props, costumes, scenery, or special lighting. No audition is necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed on Friday 8/2 in the Performing Arts Tent at 7 pm. Sponsored by Known World Players.

name: Toddler Playgroup (Under 4)
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.
description_web: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.

name: 10th Annual Rapier Poker Tournament
description_book: Heavy rapier tournament. Bear-pit style. Earn playing cards to make the best poker hand. Will run twice if weather allows.
description_web: This is a bear-pit style format where the loser of the bout stays to fight the next fencer. Fencers stay until they have won or have 3 deaths. Double kills count towards the number of deaths. Fencers leaving the field, whether they won or lost, shall receive a poker card and shall keep up to 7 cards. The winner of the tournament shall be determined by the best poker hand of 5 cards. This format will be run twice to determine two winners. There will also be a volunteer winner chosen at random from the marshals that help assist in running the tournament. You could win by playing or by volunteering!

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Cooking with Crockery on a Campfire
description_book: Practice and discuss cooking over fire using period crockery pots and skillets.
description_web: A practicum on cooking over fire using period crockery pots and skillets. We'll provide the fire, some food, and a limited supply of crockery, and advice. You'll actually heat the crockery and cook, getting a feel for how to use these tools. Feel free to bring your own pots or pipkins if you want to take them for a run with support.

name: Youth Axe-Throwing Instruction
description_book: Teaching youth 5-12 to throw axes. Focus on range rules and technique. Parent must accompany child per Pennsic rules. Tournament later in the week.
description_web: Teach youth, ages 5-12, to throw axes. This class will focus on Pennsic range rules, range etiquette and technique. There will be time for the children to throw and there will be loaner equipment available from the instructor. Parent must accompany the child per Pennsic rules. There will be a youth tournament later in the week.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Enchant with Your Dance
description_book: All levels. How to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Breath, movement, stillness, emotion, weight, tension... Write a visual poem in dance!
description_web: For all levels. How to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Exercises in breath, movement, stillness, emotion, weight, tension... Use the moves you already know to best effect. Write a visual poem in dance! This is the class I most often get asked to teach.

name: Peace Week Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Ranges will be open depending upon marshal availability.

name: Mistress Lissa Teaches Glass Bead-Making/Research
description_book: An informal workshop where students can drop by to ask questions and learn new skills from an experienced artisan and research librarian.
description_web: This is an open and informal workshop where students can drop by at any time to ask questions and learn new skills. I have been making beads for 10 years. I am a research librarian in the modern world, and I have a lot of A&S competition experience. No question is too large or small as long as it relates to glass beads. If you are not sure what you want to learn next or where to go in your art, I can help you. If you have a question that I can not answer, I will do my best to help you find the answer. I am happy to teach new bead makers as time allows, but will prioritize questions from bead makers who have at least a bit of prior experience. Materials fee applies only to those who use the available torches for practice/learning.
fee_itemization: glass, and fuel for torches if used

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: The Carolingian "Renaissance"?
description_book: Charlemagne sought to unify the disparate peoples of western Europe. How successful was he?
description_web: Charlemagne sought to unify the disparate peoples of western Europe and resurrect the Roman Empire through more efficient administration and by fostering the development of the arts and literacy. How successful was he?

name: So You Want to Be an Apothecary in the SCA
description_book: How to develop an apothecary character, including accoutrements, A&S project ideas, and other suggestions.

name: The New Bard's Road Map
description_book: A how-to primer for new/aspiring bards. Developing repertoire, finding performance opportunities, seeking mentors and patrons, joining the community.
description_web: A how-to primer for new or aspiring bards. Developing a repertoire, finding performance opportunities, seeking mentors and patrons, gaining visibility, becoming part of the bardic community.

name: Neurodiversity in the SCA
description_book: Join me in a discussion on how the Society has been built in a way to provide a safe port in a storm of non-acceptance, and how it continues to do so.
description_web: Join me in a discussion on how the Society has been built in a way to provide a safe port in a storm of non-acceptance, and how it provides help and growth by the way it functions.

name: 14th-Century Armor: Its Development Across Europe
description_book: A review of the development of armor across the century and how it differed based on regional styles.
description_web: We'll review the development of armor across the century and how it differed based on regional styles. Examples will be used to illustrate variation vs region as well as time. Both primary effigy, brass, and artwork examples will be covered alongside extant examples.

name: Intro to Tablet (Card) Weaving
description_book: Join us for a beginner tablet weaving lesson. We will cover the basic process and begin a weaving project. All materials provided.
fee_itemization:
$2 for 12 tablets
$4 for string

name: WTF? Watching The Fight: Understanding SCA Combat
description_book: Is watching SCA combat confusing? Wonder why that Duke just lost to an unbelt? Learn how to watch a fight! (Covers armored, rapier, and C&T.)
description_web:
Following a fight can be hard, even for experienced fighters. Whether it's for armored combat, rapier, or cut-and-thrust, this class will help you to be better able to understand why some blows are good and others aren't. We will discuss what counts as a "telling blow", what armor a combatant is assumed to be wearing, and why that Duke is lying on the ground "dead" when all you saw was that unbelt twitch her spear. Come for the information, stay for the anecdotes and handout.
While this class will be most beneficial to those who watch fighting with no combat experience themselves, all are welcome to attend!

name: Frame Drumming 101
description_book: *Tar, bendir, lag-na, Patayani thappu* . . . Frame drums are built and played every where/when we study. A hands-on introduction to hand drumming.
description_web: *Tar, bendir, lag-na, Patayani thappu* . . . Frame drums are built and played every where/when we study. We'll introduce some of the more common varieties of hand drums as well as their fundamental techniques. Some discussion of stick-played drums is included, but this is not the emphasis. *Bodhrans* are allowed but not recommended. A limited number of loaner drums will be available.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (Between Ankara & Visby Vale there will be signs))
name: The Dangerous Beauty: Series 4, *Allora!* - CCt
description_book: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. How to look and act like an elite historical sex worker. **18+**
description_web: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. You - yes *you*! have within you the power to secure a military alliance, curate courtly influence, maybe feel more assurance about attending Court, or just chat with that interesting person you met at Fighter Practice last week. We will be discussing and practicing how to look and act like an elite sex worker while in persona based on a combination of both extant European period writings on social behavior with modern framing of deportment, etiquette, and seduction. This section will cover games, period arts and pursuits, research subjects, SCA skills, and consort arts. Handouts will be available. **Age 18+.**

name: Easy 16th-Century Dances from Caroso
description_book: 16th-century Italian dances are fun once you get to know them! Let me introduce you to *Alta Regina, Candida Luna*, and *Fedelta*.
description_web: Everyone can learn 16th-century Italian dances, and they're worth the effort! We'll review a few of my favorites. The Italian steps will all be taught -- both the fancy way and the easy way to do them.

name: Beginner Sewing: Dragon Stuffies
description_book: Learn sewing basics and create a small felt dragon stuffy to keep.

name: Youth Introduction to Japanese Calligraphy
description_book: Learn a bit about Japanese calligraphy, including a bit of history and some basic brush strokes. (**Age 12-17**.)

name: Period Card Games: *Tarot*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card deck.
description_web: Want to learn what they did with *Tarot* cards in period? Come learn to play *Tarot*, a trick taking card game using a 78-card deck.

name: So You Want to Be an Assassin in the SCA
description_book: An introduction to having a persona that is nefarious and doesn't get into trouble; includes accoutrements, A&S ideas, and other suggestions.

name: Asian Persona Meetup
description_book: General meet-and-greet for people with Asian personas, including Byzantium and Russia.
description_web: General meet-and-greet for people with Asian personas, including Byzantium and Russia. If you have SCA business cards or a Dot, please bring those so we can network. Topics will include navigating appropriation, advances in research and documentation, anticipating modern cultural concerns, and general support.

name: Pennsic Tips and Tricks Things I Wish I'd Known
description_book: Fifty tips and tricks I wish I'd known the first time I came to Pennsic, from joining an encampment to navigating with Google Maps on my phone.
description_web: Fifty tips and tricks I wish I'd known the first time I came to Pennsic. For example, single camping is great, but next time, join an encampment. Use Google Maps on your phone to navigate the streets of Pennsic. Wrap your flashlight in glow-tape so you can find it in the dark. And there's nothing like a RAV charger to keep your phone and the kids' electronic games charged through all of Pennsic.

name: A Fun Threesome: *Belfiore*
description_book: Come learn a sassy 15th-century threesome, *Belfiore*, a popular, highly entertaining dance! All levels welcome!
description_web: Come learn a sassy 15th-century threesome, *Belfiore*, a popular, highly entertaining dance! All levels welcome!

name: Beginning Inkle Weaving
description_book: Learn to read inkle patterns, loom setup, weaves. Bring loom and shuttle, or borrow both. Yarn, all equipment will be provided.
description_web: Learn to create beautiful trim for your garb. We will cover how to read an inkle pattern, how to set up and weave efficiently on the inkle loom. Bring your own loom and shuttle, or borrow one/both. Supplies provided: #10 cotton crochet thread/equivalent, in two colors; scissors; paper and pencil for notes. If you prefer you may bring your own cotton yarn.
fee_itemization:
handout, 6 pages
thread, 2 colors.  approximately 70 yards total per student.
Use of equipment

name: String Theory
description_book: How do vibrating string instruments really work? For players (and aspiring players) of plucked, strummed, and bowed string instruments.
description_web:
How do vibrating string instruments really work? For players (and aspiring players) of plucked, strummed, and bowed string instruments, an understanding of the “what’s really going on physically” can be very enlightening. Practical tips for technique and practice will also be shared.

Class will also include a discussion of the medieval understanding of what was going on in the context of Aristotelian (as opposed to modern Newtonian) physics. Mathematical and scientific concepts limited to length, mass, tension, and simple fractions.
Instructor has been playing guitar since the 1970s and teaching (and performing in the SCA) since the '80s, when he was an engineering student.

name: *Shūji*: Japanese Calligraphy Workshop
description_book: A hands-on introduction to Japanese calligraphy for official documents. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes and ink stones if you have them.
description_web: A hands-on introduction to designing and executing Japanese official documents. This class will introduce the role of the scribe in imperial and military governments. Epistolatory style and the structure of official documents will be introduced. Participants will learn about the evolution of character styles and how documents were attested. We will also discuss paper and signature seals. The bulk of the class will consist of a hands-on calligraphy class similar to those held in Tokyo. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes, ink stones, paper weights, and *hanshi*-size felt mats if you have them. There will be limited loaner supplies of all of these available at class. Paper and ink is included in the class materials fee.
fee_itemization:
Covers production cost of the handout. I have been advised to include a handout for this class.
Cost of paper and ink both of which are specialized and imported directly from Japan.

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers to address higher level improv skills for creating character and building scenes leading to a performance.
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday 8/5 in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (modern experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission. Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (Fibula)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/fibula from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools will be available. Bring yours, if possible.
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or fibula from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along.
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: *Cuirboulli*: Water-Hardened Leather Armor
description_book: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.
description_web: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.

name: Middle Eastern Menswear 101
description_book: An introductory look at what men wore in medieval Middle East, North Africa, and al-Andalus. Also compare Arabic clothing with Persian and Ottoman.
description_web: An introductory look at what men wore in the medieval Middle East, North Africa, and al-Andalus. Clothing changed in nearly every culture after the Islamic conquest. Basic garments in the Arabic vestimentary system compared with the Central Asian-influenced vestimentary system of the Persians, Mamluks, and Ottomans. After class I will post a handout on-line.

name: Text to Telling
description_book: How do you go from source text to a powerful presentation with six months to prepare? What if you have only three days?
description_web:
I discuss a simple (if time-intensive) process for taking source material and turning it into a powerful performance, using as case studies two of my pieces.  
One, "Gawain and the Green Knight" (which I have performed - in full kit - for the Brit Lit classes at the college where I work), was worked up over a period of six months. It's a 30-minute prose rendition of the famous tale of knightly virtues, attempted seduction, and sorcery. Here's the first part: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mG4MnMZwtM
The second, "The Death of The Cid," was cooked up *literally overnight*, but resulted in me being named as Queen's Champion the next weekend. I performed it at Pennsic, where a Crown Prince sought me out afterward to thank me.

name: Construction in Leather Using Welted Seams
description_book: Create a functional object using soft leather and specific tools that incorporates strong flexible seams. **18+**
description_web: Create a functional object using soft leather and specific tools that incorporates strong flexible seams using welted seam construction. This stitching technique works best on supple soft leather such as that of deer or elk and is used extensively in garments and accessories. Students will learn the stitching technique with a hands-on project: making a leather bag to hold their beginning tools. Project kits will be available for purchase at $20 each. These will include a plate punch, a needle, and a pair of scissors as well as the leather project itself. Handouts are free. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: Material kit includes: 1 pair of scissors, 1 plate punch, 1 6 inch, 12 gauge stitching needle - cost $20.

name: Making a "Glastonbury Lite" Chair
description_book: Learn some tips and techniques to make a Glastonbury chair that folds flat, looks period, and holds at least 300 pounds.
description_web: Tired of cheap folding chairs? Learn some tips and techniques to make a Glastonbury chair that folds flat, looks period, doesn't require pins or pegs, and holds at least 300 pounds.

name: The Innocence of Guenevere
description_book: An examination of the Arthurian legend discussing the innocence of the queen.
description_web: An examination of the Arthurian legend discussing the innocence of the queen.

name: History and Symbolism of the Unicorn Tapestries
description_book: An examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries (the green ones).
description_web: An examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best examples of tapestries of the age. Why does the unicorn lack ears in one tapestry? What happened to the pieces of the fifth tapestry? Where are they now? All these and more will be answered. Handout includes full color handouts including line drawings and plant keys for each tapestry.
fee_itemization: Full color, line drawing and plant key copies of all the tapestries with corresponding plants highlighted.

name: Knitting in the 16th Century: An Overview
description_book: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen.
description_web: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen. Interested in Eleanora of Toledo's stockings? I was the first to publish the pattern!
fee_itemization: I have a handout with extensive bibliography.

name: Welcome to the SCA: Now What?
description_book: A class to help newcomers learn about the Society and ask questions of a 30-year veteran of the SCA in a judgment-free zone.

name: Latin Reading
description_book: A daily Latin beginner reading class. We will be using Orberg's *Lingua Latina I* (purchase recommended). Handouts available.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale)))
name: Risqué Pompeii: Art Under the Volcano - CCt
description_book: Come have a look at the artwork that caused such an uproar that it was hidden away for nearly two centuries. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Upon the discovery of Pompeii, and its neighbor Herculaneum, Victorian explorers were both surprised and horrified by what they found. The sexually explicit artwork they uncovered would forever change their view of Ancient Rome and eventually lead to our modern concept of pornography. Come have a look at the artwork that caused such an uproar that it was hidden away for nearly two centuries. **Age 18+.**

name: *Gracca Amorosa* for Beginners
description_book: Come learn *Gracca Amorosa*, one of the most popular 16th-C *cascarde*. Dancers of all ages welcome. Prior dance experience helpful but not required.

name: Heraldic Field Games
description_book: Herald Says! Heraldic Twister! Run around and learn your heraldic colors, commands, and shapes.

name: Teen Chainmaille Necklaces
description_book: Learn how to create chainmaille and make a necklace in the box or Byzantine style. (Ages 14-17)

name: *Ludus duodecim scriptorum* or *XII Scripta*
description_book: A Roman game as important as chess is today. Learn to play the game, then stay to play round-robin competition. Winner takes home a game set.
description_web: A Roman game as important as chess is today. Come learn to play the game, then stay to play round-robin competition. Winner takes home a game set.

name: Beyond the Cloth: Persona Glassware, Late Period
description_book: Discussion of glassware from the Late Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
description_web:
Have you ever walked around an event with a glass in your hand? People will notice it long before they even think about looking at your shoes. Make a statement by having the right kind of vessel for your persona! Discussion of glassware from the Late Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. A list of reference books will be available.
Join us again at 3:00 pm for a live, narrated demonstration of the making of a Late Period drinking vessel by Master Ali (Arab Boy)!

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Yoga for Fighters, Fencers and Folk of the Realm
description_book: A 75-minute moving exploration of the ancient practice of yoga focused on the things we choose to do in the SCA.
description_web: A 75-minute moving exploration of the ancient practice of yoga focused on the things we choose to do in the SCA. Whether you are an artist, a warrior, an archer, a dancer, or a servant of Their Majesties, you will find something in this class to help you build strength and balance, increase flexibility and perhaps even find some peace. Yoga connects your breath and your body to help you focus on what you need most at any given moment. What do you need? Bring a mat or a blanket if you have one and clothes you can comfortably move in. Yoga is for every **body**.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Lucet, string, and instructions provided as part of the class fee.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Lucet, string, and instructions provided as part of the class fee.
fee_itemization: Lucet, string & instructions

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Advanced Beginner Dumbek
description_book: Lady Zakiyyah (a.k.a. Kazuki) will help you get comfortable with that drum and have fun. All ages.
description_web: Lady Zakiyyah (a.k.a. Kazuki) will help you get comfortable with that drum and have fun. Play Middle-and-Near-Eastern rhythms; stay flexible! Open to all ages.

name: Open Torch
description_book: If you have taken a class at any time on using a torch to make things out of glass, come and practice your art.
fee_itemization: $3.50 per hour for map gas. No cost if you bring your own map gas. Please bring your own glass. If no merchant is selling glass, I will have some at my cost.

name: The Way of Saint James: Pilgrims to Santiago
description_book: We examine the legends, history, battles, miracles, and lore of Spain's *Camino de Santiago*, in period and today, taught by former pilgrims.
description_web: We will examine the legends, history, and lore of the *Camino de Santiago*, with special emphasis on the nature of medieval pilgrimage, sites of special historic, religious, and cultural importance along the route, plus advice for planning and completing the pilgrimage today. Taught by former pilgrims. *¡Buen camino!*

name: An Introduction to the Scythians
description_book: Come learn and chat about the Scythians, a cultural spectrum of steppe "barbarian" nomads of the Bronze and Iron Age.
description_web: Come learn and chat about the Scythians, a cultural spectrum of steppe "barbarian" nomads of the Bronze and Iron Age who were famed for their horsemanship and archery. While we know something of their customs via Herodotus and from the material artifacts of many burials, there are many unanswered questions of potential interest to the SCAdian about how to effect a more complete and authentic Scythian persona. Let's discuss how we might do so!

name: Advanced Viking Knitting
description_book: This class will be for students interested in going beyond the techniques taught in the basic classes. Please bring your own tools and wire.

name: Safely Foraging Local Mushrooms
description_book: Wild mushroom foraging is sexy these days. Gastrointestinal distress is not. Learn from a Pennsylvania-approved mushroomer how to stay safe! **18+.**
fee_itemization: Alys: In descrip, deleted "Come" to add in age limit.

name: Make Your Mark: The Basics of Creating Heraldry
description_book: Heraldry is the "logo" system used to identify people in the SCA. Learn the basic ruleset, and take a stab at designing your own.
description_web: Heraldry first developed as a means to identify friends versus foes on the battlefield, and evolved into a language all its own. SCA heraldry carries its own (evolving) set of rules that govern how we design and use these symbols. Come gain a grasp of the basics, and then learn about the resources that can help make it officially yours.

name: Beginner Dance: Inns of Court
description_book: The Inns of Court repertoire features pleasant, easy dances such as *Black Alman, the Lorayne Alman*, and the *Queen's Alman. Come learn them with us!
description_web: The Inns of Court, where lawyers trained, required their students to learn social graces such as a specific set of dances. Come learn some of the highlights from that set. Very easy; these were intended for law students - but pleasant, relaxing dances, often with lovely music, and excellent for talking to your partner. We will teach *Black Alman, the Lorayne Alman*, and the *Queen's Alman*.

name: Create a Heraldic Device
description_book: Learn the basics of heraldry and create your own coat of arms. (Kids' class; no conflict checking or registration of arms planned.)

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Join other players of louds. Each session features a different style of music. Bring chair/stand/clothespins.
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments gather just for fun to play different styles of music at each session such as *intradas* and other instrumental processionals as well as polychoral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen. Due to Covid concerns, instruments will **not** be available to share, but this is not a class for beginners. A reading knowledge of music is necessary. Bring a chair, music stand, and clothespins.

name: Preschooler Playgroup (Over 3)
description_book: Let our preschoolers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.
description_web: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.

name: Master Magnus Mystery Tournament
description_book: What will this tournament entail? Show up and find out! For advanced throwers only!
description_web: What will this tournament entail? Show up and find out! For advanced throwers only!

name: Youth Armored Combat: Afternoon
description_book: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.
description_web: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.

name: *i Sebastiani*  Closed Rehearsal
description_book: Rehearsal: Traditional 16th-century Italian *commedia dell'arte*.
description_web: Rehearsal: Traditional 16th-century Italian *commedia dell'arte*.

name: Archery Marshals Meeting
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.
description_web: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Music as Service in the SCA
description_book: Class focuses on ways that vocal and instrumental music can enhance the period atmosphere at SCA events.
description_web: This roundtable discussion will focus on ways that vocal and instrumental music can enhance the period atmosphere at SCA events. Ways to include music in SCA events, the pros and cons of performing solo, how to start an instrumental or vocal ensemble and other considerations will be discussed. Class is open to musicians and nonmusicians.
fee_itemization: No charge for handout.

name: The History of Clan Blue Feather
description_book: Come learn the 30+ year history of the SCA's LGBT+ research and social group, and find out what we're doing today.
description_web: Clan Blue Feather is the research, social, networking, and support group for the SCA's lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, asexual, non-binary, and related gender and sexual minority communities and their allies. Started in 1988, the Clan has since become a vibrant and important part of the SCA throughout the entire Society, from local groups to Pennsic and more. Come learn about what's been happening over the past 30+ years, what we're doing today, and what the future may hold.

name: *Petits Vriens*: Two Different Ways!
description_book: Come try two different versions of *Petits Vriens*, one for three people and the other for three couples! All levels welcome and catered to!
description_web: Come try two different versions of *Petits Vriens*, one for three people and the other for three couples! All levels welcome and catered to!

name: *Domos Draconum* Level 2: More Old School D & D
description_book: **(Age 11-17)** Continues the dungeon adventure begun during Level 1 class. Pre-generated characters available for those who missed previous session.
description_web: Once more into the dungeon! Continues the dungeon adventure begun during the Level 1 class. Pre-generated characters will be available for those who missed the previous session. **(This class is limited to gentles ages 11-17)**

name: German Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 14th -16th centuries in the Dutch German Style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Sharp Shimmy and the Whole Shebang!
description_book: Ready to sharpen your shimmy skills?! Try a variety of shimmies in your hips, shoulders, and more! Explore soft, fiery, and thunderous articulations!
description_web: Ready to sharpen your shimmy skills?! Try a variety of shimmies in your hips, shoulders, and more! Explore soft, fiery, and thunderous articulations!

name: Period Drinking Songs
description_book: Sing a variety of period songs about drinking from across Europe. Songs include easy unison and rounds, as well as harmony with up to four parts.
description_web: Learn to sing a variety of period songs about consuming alcoholic beverages from across Europe. The songs vary in difficulty from easy unison and rounds to harmony with up to four parts, so anyone can participate. Music will be available to take with you. If you have heard of the Pennsic Drinking and Singing Walk or the *Hymni Bacchi*, this is the music we sing. This class might take place in a tent without chairs, so please consider bringing your own.

name: The Best of The Knowne Worlde Rapier Tourney
description_book: Come one, come all! Come watch the best of the best fight! Open to only those with a Grant-level Rapier award, MoD, Knights, and Masters of Arms.

name: Archery Marshal Meeting
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.
description_web: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.

name: Feeding Your Fighting Demons
description_book: How's your head game? Struggling? Discuss some possible mental hurdles to fighting and ways to think about addressing them. All disciplines. **18+**
description_web: How's your head game? Struggling? Discussion of some possible mental hurdles to fighting and ways to think about addressing them. Open to all disciplines (yes, even combat archery). **Age 18+.**

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: My Hair Is So Extra and So Am I - CCt
description_book: Be a little more extra in your SCA look! We'll be demonstrating the making and wearing of false braids/hairpieces using modern materials. **18+.**
description_web:
Let's be even more fabulous! We will be learning how to make and wear false braids and hair pieces to accessorize our garb in period-appropriate styles using modern materials. This class is a demonstration but will have time for hands-on learning and/or assistance with constructing braid extensions to those who bring their own materials. Materials required are one bag of *kanekelon* jumbo braid hair in a color matching your own (can be found online); a few hair ties; strong thread in the color of the hair; needle; and wide tooth comb. **No materials will be provided. 
Age 18+.**

name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: I host an open 12-Step meeting at 4:00 pm daily in my camp in EO7, Denys the Decadent's Camp.
description_web: This is an open 12-Step meeting open to all who are looking for a 12-Step meeting to attend for on-site support.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to rules and play of the Japanese/Chinese game of *go/weiqi*.
description_web: Will teach the rules of the Japanese game *go* (also known as *weiqi* in China), and offer a chance to play afterwards.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Master Cariadoc
description_book: Poems and stories presented in persona, as a period performer presenting to a period audience.
description_web: Poems and stories presented in persona, as a period performer presenting to a period audience.

name: Glass Apprentice Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Comedy Show
description_book: Enjoy our montage-style improv comedy show.
description_web: It’s the Pennsic "mightier than the sword" montage-style improv comedy show and anything can happen! Enjoy a fun night of long-form improvised comedy based on your suggestions and stories presented by the Pennsic Mightier Workshop cast!

name: Period Card Games: *Karnoffel*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference).
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference).

name: Elaisse de Garrigues: Songs for the SCA
description_book: Musical tales of battle and bloodshed, love and loss, along with some lighthearted laughs from a former bardic champion of Calontir and the Outlands.
description_web: Come welcome this former Windhover Bard of the Outlands and bardic champion of Calontir in her Pennsic debut as she weaves musical tales of battle and bloodshed, love and loss, along with some lighthearted laughs.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be *Around the World in 11 Nights*. Eat your heart out, Phileas Fogg!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be *1001 Arabian Nights*. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: T(w)een Night: The Great Pennsic RPG Adventure
description_book: Proudly presenting The Great Pennsic RPG Adventure! Simplified TTRPG Rules. Participate or watch as we explore Pennsic's magical mysteries. Ages 12-17
description_web: Lady Cecily is proud to present The Great Pennsic RPG Adventure! We will use simplified TTRPG rules to make both character building and play accessible to all players. Join us (either by participating or watching) as we explore Pennsic and the magical mysteries it holds. **Ages 12-17.**

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: *Ecclesiazusae*
description_book: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater presents staged reading of  *Ecclesiazusae*  by Aristophanes.
description_web: This is a staged reading of the script in the *Ecclesiazusae*. Aristophanes proposed a unique solution: turn the running of the government over to the women of the city. As in his play *Lysistrata*, the central character of the play is a strong-willed woman: Praxagora. Together with other wives, who are disguised as men, she presents her ideas at the Assembly of Athens and convinces the men to relinquish control of the government. As the newly appointed commander, Praxagora quickly enacts a series of radical changes: community property, communal dwellings and meals, and no brothels. Reluctantly, many of the men quickly adapt to the new order of things.

name: Period Jewelry: A Slide Show
description_book: Slides of jewels from museums, ranging from migration period through Renaissance.
description_web: Slides of jewels from museums, ranging from migration period through Renaissance.

name: Gnome Pete Memorial Glow Stick Tournament
description_book: This fun evening tournament includes throwing at glow sticks; 8:30 pm or dusk until complete. **Age 18+.**
description_web: This fun evening tournament includes throwing at glow sticks; 8:30 pm or dusk until complete. Competition slots; first-come, first-served. **Age 18+.**

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Come join us in the Dance Tent for open dancing!

name: Ruaidhri's Stories
description_book: Ollaimh Ruaidhri an Cu will take the stage without a set list!
description_web: Stories, songs, and verse delivered with a thick brogue and no plan. I will spin tales to your fancy and songs to your whim.

name: Efenwealt Wystle and Company
description_book: Efenwealt Wystle and family are in the house!
description_web: Music that spans the SCA: historic, bardic, instrumental, vocal, comedy tragedy and everything in between. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

location: Chirugeons' Point start (Brewer's Road &  St. Lawrence Way)
name: 10th Annual Unofficial Pennsic Half-Marathon
description_book: An approximate half-marathon distance run around the Pennsic campground.
description_web: The estimated 13-mile course (it is medievally inexact!) will consist of three loops around the entire Pennsic campground, plus one smaller loop around the Serengeti. Runners will meet in front of Chirurgeons' Point at 7 am. Water is available from the chirurgeons, but runners are encouraged to supply their own water/sports drink/snack needs. We will pass the Chirurgeons' Point three times, at roughly 4.5-mile intervals. Note: This is a group run, not a race. No times will be kept, though there will be some participant awards. The goal is fitness as part of the SCAdian lifestyle. All are welcome, and participants may join for as much or as little distance as desired. Wearing medieval-style tunics and presenting as medieval an appearance as is practicable is encouraged.

name: Recovery for All
description_book: Support and fellowship for all people in recovery.
description_web: 12-step meetings for those  who "trudge the Road of Happy Destiny" within any program.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi. Bring your own mat or towel and water! Power up and stretch!
description_web: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi, dancer, fighter, artisan, merchant or royal! Bring your own mat or towel and water, wear easy-to-move-in clothes. Get ready to power up and stretch!

name: Youth Armored Combat: Morning
description_book: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.
description_web: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.

name: 8th Pennsic Period Bow Shoot
description_book: The 8th Pennsic Period Bow Shoot is open to archers with period gear and garb, shooting at historical targets for prizes.
description_web: The 8th Pennsic Period Bow Shoot is open to archers with period gear and garb, shooting at historical targets for prizes. Come shoot wands, wreaths, *quabak, tunken, putta*, Mongol triangle, clout, a Period Royal Round, and more! Fabulous prizes for the best shooters in multiple divisions. "Period Equipment" is defined by the IKAC rules and is found here: https://www.scores-sca.org/public/scores_rules.php?R=10&Shoot=468 . Most importantly, bows may not have cut-in arrow rests, and arrows must not have plastic nocks. Additionally, archers' garb should broadly match their archery tackle's common historical geographical location and time period - no Vikings with *yumi*, no Romans with claplock crossbows, and so forth - and be largely anachronism-free (no sunglasses, modern footwear, etc., please, unless needed for medical reasons, on your honor).  After the shoot is over, all participants are invited to remain after the awarding of prizes for a fabulous period dayboard lunch, show-and-tell time, and fellowship.

name: Applique in the Style of the Tristan Wall Hanging
description_book: Make a small item using techniques found in the 14th-century Tristan Hanging. Leather cording used.
description_web: We will learn the techniques and materials used in the making of the 14th-century Tristan Wall Hanging currently at the V&A in London. We will discuss the materials: the wools, the silks, the gold, and the leather. We will also discuss the style of embroidery. The kit will include materials to make a small item such as a pouch or a needlebook.
fee_itemization: All supplies needed to make a small wool appliqued item, including 100% wool felted cloth, silk thread, leather strips, linen thread, basic sewing supplies.

name: Glass Animal Beadmaking
description_book: Intermediate lampworking; making glass animals. Observers welcome.
description_web: Intermediate lampworking; making glass animals. Observers welcome.
fee_itemization: gas and glass

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (Fibula)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/fibula from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools will be available. Bring yours, if possible.
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or fibula from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along.
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: Viking Wire Weave Basics
description_book: Viking wire weave is a period-correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. I will show you how to get started.
description_web: Viking wire weave is a period-correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. Also known as trichinopoly or Viking Knitting, there is archaeological evidence for wire chains constructed using “circular plaiting” in Viking burials and treasure hoards dating as early as the 8th century to as late as the 12th century. Come learn with the Mistress of Wire herself! You will learn how to make a *sextapus* to hold your chain in place, a basic 6-loop pattern, draw plate techniques, and how to finish the ends to add a clasp.
fee_itemization: Copper "sextapus" $.50, wooden dowel $.50, draw plate $1, craft wire $2, end cones $2.50, clasp $1.50

name: Running or Winning Siege Cooking Contests
description_book: How to run, enter and win "siege cooking" contests, from picking the foods, to handouts, to adding theater to your entry. Bring paper/pen.
description_web: "Siege cooking" contests pit contestants, provided with identical raw ingredients, against each other or a pre-announced standard. A popular feature of weekend events, such contests can spice up a household dinner or provide the entire feast. The instructor has run the Maison Rive siege cooking contest at Pennsic for more than twenty years now; learn what worked and what didn't from both sides of the judging table. Come prepared to take notes.

name: Three 9th- and 10th-Century Arabic Chicken Salads
description_book: Cold chicken salads from ibn Sayyar al-Warraq's 9th- and 10th-century Baghdadi cookbook, with lots of fresh herbs, for when it's too hot to cook.
description_web: Three cold chicken dishes from ibn Sayyar al-Warraq's Baghdadi compendium of 9th- and 10th-century recipes. Made with relatively common spices, lots of fresh herbs, and Persian cucumbers for when it's too hot to cook. Can use supermarket rotisserie chicken for even less cooking.
fee_itemization: Fee covers chickens, herbs, spices, sour grape juice, cucumbers, etc.

name: Designing and Carving Blocks for Fabric Printing
description_book: Learn how to plan and create blocks for printmaking on fabric recreating brocade and other patterns.
description_web: We will discuss historical designs and patterns, how to design your own based on these, and then learn how to carve blocks. Techniques will include historical methods as well as modern materials which can be substituted. Directions on printing will be touched on, but we will not be printing in class.
fee_itemization: different materials for blocks

name: Finding Your Niche: Getting Started in A&S
description_book: How to find your direction or apply your mundane expertise when entering into A&S studies.
description_web:
Do you feel lost when thinking about A&S topics in the SCA? Do you have a specialty you are good at, but are worried it is not "medieval enough"? 
This class is open discussion on how to focus what you know and what you already do well and apply it toward a more concrete A&S presentation or class. We'll use some examples and do some brainstorming in your particular interests.

name: Africans in Tudor England
description_book: This class is about the history of people of African descent in Tudor England.
description_web: Often we don’t picture people of African descent in Renaissance England, but they were there. This class will cover the ways that people of African descent arrived in England, their roles and occupations once there, and how they were treated by a society that was entering the slave trade. We’ll also look at period representations of Africans in art and literature.
fee_itemization: $1 covers the cost of photocopying the handout.

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Medieval Combat Video Review
description_book: How do you use special tools on a phone, tablet or computer to do detailed video analysis of medieval combat footage? Gather around and find out.

name: *Or Nué*: Colored Goldwork Embroidery
description_book: Learn the basics of *Or Nué* embroidery by creating a small piece. Beginners welcome. Kits provided.
description_web: Learn the basics of *Or Nué* embroidery by creating a small piece. *Or Nué* (shaded gold) embroidery was done in Europe, particularly in Belgium, France, Netherlands, and to high levels in Italy and Flanders from roughly 1400 – 1550s. The technique uses different colored silk threads to couch gold or silver threads strategically placed to form patterns, designs, figures or narrative scenes. This class is for beginners and kits will be provided.
fee_itemization: gold thread, silk thread, linen, wax, embroidery hoop, needles, handout (inc. in material fee)

name: Knitting in the Baltic States: The Latvian Mitten
description_book: We will be knitting Latvian-style mittens to learn period knitting techniques from the Baltic States. Need to be able to knit.
description_web: Learn period Baltic States knitting techniques by producing Latvian-style mittens. This is an intermediate to advanced knitting class.
fee_itemization:
$15.00 kit includes - Knitting needles, yarn, darning needle, stitch holder, printed instructions
$2 for just the printed instuctions

name: Rapier Battle of La Rochelle
description_book: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée.
description_web: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée. Attackers will have unlimited resurrections, defenders will have limited resurrections. RBG cannon are welcome. No archery, please. Pennsic standard rules for rapier apply. Don't have a heavy rapier? Bring a dagger or two. Bring a friend or 20. The more the merrier. Don't like to fight melée? Come and get close to the action and help marshal the battle. Please muster **at the Fort**  half an hour before the start time, especially if you want to fight with a particular group.

name: Intro to Woodworking, Part A
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: This class is two half-days, Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand woodwork, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience. *Youths may attend if accompanied by a parent.*

instructor: Thl Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Pennsic Instrumental Youth Consort
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all pitched and percussion instruments played by musicians ages 12-19.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all pitched and percussion instruments played by musicians ages 12-19. All levels of playing are welcome, though a basic understanding of how to read music for your instrument is required. We will learn between three and five pieces from within SCA period. The Consort will be led by THL Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes, who is also a music teacher in modern life. We will begin rehearsals on Saturday of War Week, though PDFs of the music for performance can be obtained beginning in July by contacting THL Cynthia.

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo* is cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided.
description_web: *Kumihimo* is cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Disk, bobbins, string, & instructions

name: Beginner Middle Eastern Hand Drumming
description_book: This is a beginner's class for dumbek and frame drums.  Learn to hold and hit the drum and play basic rhythms. **You must bring your own drum. **
description_web: This is a beginner's class for dumbek and frame drums.  Learn to hold and hit the drum.  Popular rhythms will be explained, then played together. This is the perfect class for first timers of all ages.  **You must bring your own drum.**

name: Parchment Making
description_book: Learn the basics of making parchment in one day.
description_web:
Learn the basics of making parchment for bookbinding and award scrolls in one day. This 6-hour workshop will cover all of the steps, tools, equipment, and some variations on the process from fresh hides to finished sheets. The first part of the class shares techniques with leather and rawhide preparation; the last half is specific to parchment. Be as hands-on or hands-off as you want. We will provide gloves and aprons; you must bring boots or shoes that can be easily washed. Wear mucky clothes. Students who would like to continue working on the project and gain more experience may attend preparation hours on the days before and after class is held.
Sadb Ingen Chonchobair will be the instructor on site.
Abigail Kelhoge's YouTube playlist can be found here: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wy2EeL-1N7I&list=PL55KgesG1cOgCcX85d0bMULiO5v-BxzC4

name: Shakespearean Original Pronunciation
description_book: How did Shakespeare's plays sound when he wrote them? Demo, background, and practice notes on Shakespearean OP.
description_web: Shakespeare’s actors did NOT speak like Sir Ian McKellen. But what did they sound like, and how do we know? The class will include a demonstration of the reconstructed Shakespearean Original Pronunciation (OP), details of how it was unearthed and how it’s being performed today, and practice notes for learning to speak it.

name: Medieval Drama
description_book: A brief introduction to formal medieval drama, including mystery, morality, and miracle plays. Focus is on English and European plays.
description_web: A brief introduction to formal medieval drama, including mystery, morality, and miracle plays. Focus is on English and European plays.
fee_itemization: Handout

name: Henna for Skin Mixology and Application
description_book: Learn how to find, mix, and apply henna for skin from a professional henna artist.
description_web: Learn how to find good henna and get a proven and flexible recipe you can tailor to suit your needs. Then we'll practice applying it, with tips and guidance from a veteran artist. We will mix some henna in class, which for me was the hardest part to learn. Everyone gets a cone of paste to use and take with them.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own henna. The handout is for my research paper on history, traditions, and mixology.

name: Children's Garb Roundtable
description_book: How to make inexpensive garb that can be modified as your child grows, including teen years. Share your tips, ideas and questions.
description_web: Join a discussion on how to make inexpensive garb for your child as they grow and that will grow with them. Share your tips, ideas and questions. Bring samples of your favorite go-to garb for your child. The handout will include ideas, websites, pictures that have been gleaned over the years. Includes a Teen Edition.
fee_itemization: 1 for paper/color ink

name: History and Importance of Bast Fibers
description_book: Bast fibers are among the most versatile. They have affected the language of fiber arts as well as far-flung fields like fighting, fashion, & fishing.
description_web: Enter the fun world of bast fibers. Come learn how rotting and heckling can be good things, how an annoying plant changed the "scale" of fishing, how a weed helped develop period world-wide warfare, and how blond hair can be related to sexy underwear.

name: Guild of Saint Barbara Annual Meeting
description_book: Annual meeting will cover safety, new items, and also go over the firing schedule. As always, please bring questions.
description_web:
The Guild of Saint Barbara will having its annual meeting on Middle Saturday at 10 am. The meeting will cover safety, new items, and also go over the firing schedule for Pennsic 48. Please join us for this informative session and feel free to bring questions. 
There will be a break between the meeting and training. Please **DO NOT** bring powder to Pennsic!

name: Pennsic Without a Cooler
description_book: How to feed yourself period food at long camping events without the use of a cooler.

name: Dances for One Couple
description_book: Dances for two people. What to dance when you don't have a lot of people? Might cover *Black Alman, Ly Bens, Rostiboli*, or *Green Ginger*.
description_web: Dances for two people (one couple). What to dance when you don't have a lot of people? We might cover *Black Alman, Ly Bens, Rostiboli*, or *Green Ginger*.

name: Illuminated Origami Star Baskets for Youth
description_book: Create a tea-lighted origami basket! Drop-in craft; feel free to come at any point in the block. (Ages 8-14)
description_web: Create a tea-lighted origami basket! Drop-in craft; feel free to come at any point in the block. (Ages 8-14)

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman Janissary Band
description_book: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band of the 14th-17th C for performance at Pennsic.
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The *Mehteran* will learn the historic Ottoman songs, *Ceddin Deden*, *Osman Pasa*, and *Nevâ-Ceng-i Harbî* which are played on *zurna, davul*, horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic Janissary march for performance at Pennsic. Brass horn players, percussionists and singers are welcome and encouraged to participate. Further details on the *Mehteran* Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/

name: Random Tournament
description_book: Participants will draw a random distance (long or short) and weapon (axe, knife or spear) for each round of competition.
description_web: Bring your axe, knife, and spear and let luck of the draw determine your fate as you compete to be the best. Participants will draw a random distance (long or short) and weapon (axe, knife or spear) for each round of competition.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

instructor: Baroness Aranwen verch Rhys ap Gwalter
name: Lampwork Glass Bead Making: Safety and Basic Beads
description_book: Setting up a basic lampwork studio, safety practices, what tools can be used and creating basic beads. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Before jumping into the fire: what you need for a basis work area and safety measures will be discussed  to keep yourself and your work area safe.  Basic shapes will be demonstrated and you will have time to practice them. There are many types of tools that can be used to  shape or rake hot glass. Various household items will be used as well as graphite molds and paddles. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: Cost of Mapp gas, bead release and glass.

name: *Ars Dictaminis*: Art of Medieval Letter Writing
description_book: Learn letter writing, medieval style! Using period sources, we'll look at how and what letters were used for, plus how to write your own!
description_web: Letter writing was the primary form of communication in period, but is a neglected art today. Rediscover the beauty and fun of letter-writing from period sources. We'll look at the art of writing a proper letter, famous correspondence, and examples of everyday letters sent by people all across society. Plus, plenty of tips for writing your own letters!

name: 12th-Century Women's Clothing
description_book: An overview of 12th-century women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut.
description_web: An overview of 12th-century women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut. This class examines period sources outside of the Chartres Portal Sculpture box to explore how women's clothing was made in the 12th century.

name: Have Fun Storming the Castle
description_book: The neighbors are invading! We need to protect ourselves. We will discuss historical (**not SCA-allowed**) ways to both defend and take a castle.
description_web: The neighbors are invading! We need to protect ourselves. We will discuss ways to both defend and take a castle. Note, this is an historical architecture class and these techniques should not be used by our glorious fighters during the battle of La Rochelle (although they would work!).

name: Neurodiversity in the Modern Middle Ages
description_book: Join us for a panel discussion on neurodivergence with the challenges and rewards that neurodiversity offers the Society.
description_web:
In the SCA and out of it, we all interact with people whose neurotypes (brain architecture and operating system) are different from our own. In the last several years, neurodivergent people--including many on the autism spectrum and with ADHD--have been increasingly embracing our identities, forging communities, and challenging the "impairment" models imposed on us by a culture centered on the neurotypical majority.

Join us for a thoughtful, compassionate, and engaging panel discussion around the challenges, rewards, and gifts that arise when different minds and perspectives navigate the culture of our shared Society. This panel will be led by neurodiversity advocates, to examine and re-examine our assumptions about the "right" way to be, speak, and act as Scadians.

name: Slavic Rus Headwear 10-13th Century
description_book: Creation of Slavic Rus headwear -- two examples: copper diadem and silk on birchbark. Will discuss research and construction techniques.
description_web:
Creation of Slavic Rus headwear -- two examples: copper diadem and silk on birchbark. Will discuss research and construction techniques as well as lessons learned. 
Also discussion on Tournament of Arts and A&S participation, scoring, and future projects.

name: Field Guide to Identifying Royalty and Others
description_book: Learn about the regalia that helps identify royalty and other significant players in our Society.
description_web: When wandering about Pennsic or any other large events, you'll see a lot of the finest the SCA has to offer, especially shiny headwear. Who are these people, what does their regalia mean, and how should you address them? This class will provide a brief overview, and helpful guidelines.

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 6, through and including Thursday, Aug. 11, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 6, through and including Thursday, Aug. 11, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Courtesan Persona 101 - CCt
description_book: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA. **Age 18+.**
description_web: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA. People of all ages **over 18** and all genders welcome. We will be discussing how to speak and act like an elite sex worker and how to handle a number of situations you might find yourself in while in persona at events. For a list of content warnings or any further information, please contact Ginevra at ginevrafiammettadisilvestri@gmail.com.

name: Galliards with Gregory
description_book: The galliard is an aerobic 16th-century, pan-European dance. We will learn a different basic step and intermediate step each day.

name: Build Your Own Catapult and Target
description_book: Use various materials to construct your own model catapult and target, and test how well your model will launch cotton balls.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to build your own catapult? Observe and discuss the function of different models of catapults, then use various materials (straws, spoons, Popsicle sticks, rubber bands, tape, cups, etc.) to construct your own catapult and target, and finally test the distance your catapult will launch cotton balls. You can keep your catapult and target!

name: Period Card Games: *Laugh and Lie Down*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this simple late-period card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this simple late-period card game.

name: Very Basic Belly Dancing
description_book: We will be working on the very basics of belly dancing, no previous experience needed.

name: Seven Rhythms of Pennsic Apocalypse
description_book: Beginner rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 3-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
This is a beginner drumming class. Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 3-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*

name: *Tengwar* 1: Writing English with Elvish Letters
description_book: An introduction to writing English using the phonetic English mode of the *Tengwar* writing system developed by JRR Tolkien.
description_web:
Learn to write English using the phonetic English mode of the *Tengwar* writing system developed by JRR Tolkien. While the *Tengwar* have their origins in 20th-century fiction, learning to read and write in a new way can help a modern literate scribe connect with a medieval scholar's experience learning their letters as an adult, and struggling to fit a Latin alphabet to their native tongue. In addition, Tolkien's influence has played an important part in the history of the Society.

Come back for *Tengwar* 2 to practice, discuss your experience, and check your homework.

name: Stage Combat for Theater (Slaps Punches and Falls)
description_book: A class for those in theater and *Commedia* to learn how to safely use slaps, punches, and falls on the stage and make them look real.
description_web: A class for those in theater and *Commedia* to learn how to safely use slaps, punches, and falls on the stage and make them look real to the audience. it is suggested that you wear clothing that it is ok to get dirty in. We would prefer that attendees be 16 or older, or be accompanied by an adult.

name: Peace Week Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Ranges will be open depending upon marshal availability.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to "Gypsy" Persona
description_book: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: Late Period Rounds
description_book: Come help sing through (or listen to) some late period rounds.

name: Bling Out Your Veils
description_book: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. All supplies and veil will be supplied.
description_web: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. Ten kits available. Other students may watch the class; there will be extra handouts. If you would like to attend, you can bring your own veil and beads, and take the class.
fee_itemization:
fabric for veil
beads
beading needle
thread

name: Navigating the SCA for LGBTQIA+
description_book: Providing resources and information, and answering questions for newcomers who are part of, or related to, the LGBTQIA+ and transgender community.
description_web: In this class I will share my experiences in my 20+ years in the SCA as a queer person with friends and family all over the rainbow. This is not a comprehensive class but I will provide resources and answer questions in order to ease any concerns or point out pitfalls in this great game of ours. I don't know everything, but should be able to point out resources to answer questions I cannot. We are a big umbrella Society and navigating it can be intimidating. Come join us and know you are not alone.

name: A Silly Skirmish for Five: *Verceppe*
description_book: Learn this fun dance, an original danced battle between the sexes from the 15th century. For intermediate/advanced dancers, or adventuresome ones.
description_web: Come learn this fun dance, an original danced battle between the sexes from the 15th century. For intermediate/advanced dancers, or adventuresome ones.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert, Thursday, War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella* with Deonna von Aachen. We will rehearse 2-3 pm Sunday, August 7, through Wednesday, August 10. The performance will be part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Bellydance: Building Blocks
description_book: Learn the building blocks of bellydance, including basic footwork, combos, and isolations. Warm-up, stretch, and drills, followed by dancing!
description_web: Learn the building blocks of bellydance in a safe, non-judgemental environment. This class is for anyone who would like a refresher and true beginners who want to learn how to make their hips do the thing and what muscles are actually involved in snake arms anyway? We will begin with a full body stretch and warm-up followed by learning common ubiquitous dance moves from a foundational beginning. Afterwards, a short choreography and some partner and group dancing. No partner required, open to all ages.

name: Copying a Period Calligraphic Hand
description_book: You can use any manuscript as your calligraphic source! Come learn the techniques for mimicking any period hand.
description_web: Working from a *ductus* is totally fine, but you can also use any manuscript as your calligraphic source! Come learn the techniques for mimicking any period hand.

name: *Kyōgen*: Small Troupe Comic Improv Theatre
description_book: Try out medieval Japanese comic theatre. Stock characters with few sets or props. Short plays with burlesque, farce, satire, and slapstick.
description_web:
Try out small troupe medieval Japanese improvisational comic theatre. If you like over-the-top comic acting, then *kyōgen* is for you! Ridicule the powerful. Expose human foibles and social problems. Stock characters with minimal sets and props perform burlesque, farce, satire, and slapstick comedy. Learn about stock characters, theatrical devices, common themes, rhythmic structure, comic theory, and more!
*Kyōgen* is an accessible and easy-to-stage genre of Japanese theatre. *Kyōgen* dates to at least the fourteenth century and is a living theatre today. *Kyōgen* frequently lampooned the powerful people who sat in the audience. Learn about stage geography, scripting, types of plays, types of characters, acting conventions, and more. Discover *kyōgen* with as few as two speaking roles, and plays lasting from ten minutes to an hour.
fee_itemization: The multi-page handout contains synopsis of period plays, character descriptions, stage drawing, and more.

name: Tarl's Little Polearm Tourney 15
description_book: This is a heavy weapons tournament open to all authorized fighters. Polearms only, which must meet Pennsic specifications. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Welcome to year 15! Once again those who love The One True Weapons Form will meet in joyful violence! The Tourney will be fought in a bear-pit format, with two 45-minute sessions with a short break in between. The Tourney is open to all authorized adult fighters of any skill level, using any polearm allowed by Pennsic rules. So bring your polearm, or polearms, your sense of fun and adventure and come and play with us once again. Tourney will start at 1 pm. **Age 18+.**

name: Iron Age Birch Bark hats
description_book: Learn about conical Iron Age hats from central Europe. Try your hand at stitching and stamping a scrap of birch bark.
description_web: What early period Celt doesn't need a shade hat? This class presents information about conical birch bark hats from central Europe dating from the Late Hallstatt to Early La Tène periods. Learn about the extant finds and how to recreate them. Try your hand at stitching and stamping a scrap of birch bark.

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
