description_book: Covers the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: Holy Cows and Flaming Monks
description_book: True to form, the SCA has produced its own folk saints, and what may start as an inside joke ends up looking like a real saint's cult.
description_web: Like the Middle Ages itself, the SCA has produced its own folk saints, and what may start as an inside joke ends up looking like a real saint's cult. We'll explore some of the weirder saints to come out of the SCA, and look at the cult of St. Bunstable as a case study.

name: Patching Holes in Deerskin Leather Projects
description_book: Create a functional and decorative patch over a hole in a piece of deer or elk leather. Work with the holes, not against them! **18+**
description_web: Create a functional and decorative patch over a hole in a piece of deer or elk leather. Work with the holes, not against them! Kits will be available to patch different holes in pieces of deer leather and will include scissors, a pen, and a needle. Kits will be $20 each; handouts are free. **Age18+.**
fee_itemization: Kit includes at least 2 pieces of leather, leather lace. Scissors, needles and punches will be provided to share amongst students.

name: Justice by Blood and Iron
description_book: Why would anyone resolve a legal dispute by having two people brutalize each other? Come find out the history and legal process of trial by combat!
description_web: For centuries various European societies resolved some of their greatest legal disputes through a procedure where two people tried to slaughter each other. This class aims to address a single question: Why? Why in the name of all that is just, and at least slightly sensible, would people, cultures, and entire kingdoms agree to this? In the process of answering this question we'll look at various techniques and legal practices that marked these trials, specific cases which were resolved by combat, and the lasting legacy of trial by combat on our own system of justice.

name: Babies at Pennsic: A Discussion
description_book: How to deal with babies and small children at Pennsic: a discussion by and for those who have done it, are doing it, or will do it.

name: Consent in A&S: Giving & Taking Helpful Feedback
description_book: Discuss ways to make A&S feedback culture more useful and less stressful for all parties involved. For artisans, judges, Laurels and novices alike.
description_web: In an ideal Society, artisans create work for the joy that it brings them, and Laurels give feedback to fulfill the mission of their peerage to help encourage and teach others. However, if feedback is not given or received properly, hurt feelings can (and do!) occur. Artisans can be discouraged from pursuing their ideas, with Laurels being branded as being mean and unhelpful. Both of these outcomes are hurtful to the fabric of our society. So, let's examine the issue and figure out if we can help change the culture of how feedback is given and received in the SCA so that everyone can work together to create a better more supportive Arts and Sciences Community.

name: Latin Reading
description_book: A daily Latin beginner reading class. We will be using Orberg's *Lingua Latina I* (purchase recommended). Handouts available.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Intro to The Knowne World Courtesans - CCt
description_book: Are you interested in having a courtesan persona? How about being a patron? What's a Tullian? What do the Knowne World Courtesans **do? Age 18+.**
description_web: Are you interested in having a courtesan persona? How about being a patron? What's a Tullian? What do the Knowne World Courtesans **do?** Join us for a discussion of these things and more! **Age 18+.**

name: Basics of Calligraphy
description_book: Calligraphy is like a cross between writing and drafting. Learn how to construct artful letters.
description_web: Calligraphy is like a cross between writing and drafting. Learn how to construct artful letters using reusable building blocks (like Legos!). Tips and tricks will be taught to help make your calligraphy look good right from the start.

name: *Kamikaze* Battle
description_book: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting.
description_web: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to rules and play of the Japanese/Chinese game of *go/weiqi*.
description_web: Will teach the rules of the Japanese game *go* (also known as *weiqi* in China), and offer a chance to play afterwards.

location: Guild of St. Barbara Gunners Fly atop Mt Eislinn (Meeting at N17 Household of the White Rose Artillery Camp at corner of Battle Rd and Fosse Way to move equipment to theTop of Mt Eislin under the Gunners Red Fly. Bring chairs and water)
name: Guild of Saint Barbara Black Powder Training
description_book: Black powder safety and hands-on training. Bring pre-1600 firearms and cannon with you to be inspected. ***DO NOT BRING YOUR OWN POWDER! Age 18+***
description_web:
Muster at the Artillery Camp Household of the White Rose, corner of Battle Road and Fosse Way. Artillery Park is on the front lawn. We muster here so we can get pieces to the artillery point atop of Mt. Eislinn. The Guild of Saint Barbara will holding its hands-on training and safety inspection on the middle Saturday at 1 pm. The hands-on black powder training session is for new gentles who wish to learn and join us on the line, or as a refresher for those who would desire. 
Hands-on training will be from 1 pm to 4 pm. Please join us for this informative session and feel free to bring questions. And, if you have pre-1600 firearms, bring them with you to be inspected. Please **DO NOT** bring powder to Pennsic! Powder will be provided. **Age 18+**

name: Roman Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 1st to the 5th centuries, from across the Roman Empire! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

location: Pennsic Fiber Arts Pavilion (Atlantian Royal encampment)
name: Nalbinders' Gathering
description_book: Come join your fellow Nalbinders to show off your projects, share tips and tricks, get help, and explore nalbound artifacts from around the world.
description_web: Come join your fellow Nalbinders to show off your projects in nalbinding, share tips and tricks, get help, and explore nalbound artifacts from around the world. There is no formal agenda, just time to socialize and nalbind with fellow enthusiasts.

name: *i Verdi Confusi*: Closed Dress Rehearsal
description_book: Closed dress rehearsal for *i Verdi Confusi*'s performance in the PA Tent.

name: Card Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a small strap or trim piece on our mini-card loom.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a small strap or trim piece on our mini-card loom. Classroom loaner looms provided. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: cards, string, & instructions

name: The Battle of Tortuga (Rapier)
description_book: Two ships meet at sea and battle for survival and glory! Pirates vs merchants! Bring your RBGs as this event is set for gun and blade duels.
description_web: Two ships meet at sea and battle for survival and glory! Pirates vs merchants vs unexpected complications! Bring your RBGs as this event is set for gun and blade duels. Non-War Point nautical-themed fun! Three rounds (sometimes four) of stab 'em and shoot 'em goodness.

name: Thrown Weapons Bear Pit
description_book: This is a test of stamina and a series of head-to-head tournaments.
description_web: This is a test of stamina and a series of head-to-head tournaments. You will receive a point for every match you take part in, and another point for each that you win. The rest of the rules will be read at the range.

name: The Walking Dum: Post-Apocalypse
description_book: Begintermediate and pre-advanced rhythms to get beyond the basic rhythms. Different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
This is a begintermediate/pre-advanced  drumming class. Learn rhythms beyond the usual that you hear all the time. Class alternates between odd and even count rhythms. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Samai* (10/8), *Chaka* (6/8), *Curcuna (Jurjuna)* (6/8), others as time permits.
Day 2- *Karsilama* (9/8), *Laz* (7/8), reverse-*Laz* (7/8), others as time permits.
Day 3- *Samai* (10/8), *Chaka* (6/8), *Curcuna (Jurjuna)* (6/8), others as time permits.
Day 4- *Karsilama* (9/8), *Laz (7/8)*, reverse-*Laz* (7/8), others as time permits.

name: The English Reformation
description_book: Basics of the English Reformation: timeline, politics, major players, and what differentiates it from the continent.
fee_itemization: Paper, ink

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: A History of the Goths
description_book: An outline of Gothic history before, during, and after period.

name: Did the Vikings Have Printed Textiles?
description_book: Examine extant finds and contemporaneous accounts to draw conclusions on whether the Vikings made or had printed textiles.
description_web: The art of block printing is sweeping across the reenactor and living history world, with two extant designs that are often cited as "Viking" being put all over Norse clothing... but were those designs actually "Viking"? Are there extant block printed textiles or garments attributed to the Vikings, Kievan Rus, and/or Varangians? Is there **any** evidence that the Vikings encountered printed textiles? This lecture will walk you through extant finds and contemporaneous accounts to help you conclude whether the Vikings made or had access to printed textiles.

name: Alternative Documentation Formats for A&S Display
description_book: Presentation/Discussion: Ways that artisans can achieve the goal of documenting their A&S projects other than by writing a traditional "paper."
description_web: Does the word “documentation” fill you with joy or with dread? Feelings among artisans are strong and varied about this aspect of the Arts and Sciences, sometimes (ok, probably often) leaning towards the negative. But documentation does not have to be something to fear. The goal of this class is to try to make those feelings more positive. While documentation does take work, it doesn’t have to be super painful, and there are a wide variety of ways that artisans can achieve the goal of documenting their A&S projects. Conversation notes from a panel discussion on the topic held in the East Kingdom will be presented, and attendees will be invited to discuss the topic as well.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country
description_book: Suitable for beginners, we will learn 3-4 awesome English Country Dances. Choices dependent on number of participants.
description_web: Suitable for beginners, we will learn 3-4 awesome English Country Dances. We will start with basic steps and then my first favorite dance, *Rufty Tufty*.  Additional dance choices will be dependent on the number of participants.

name: Teens Cook: Decorating the Table With Carved Fruit
description_book: Students learn knife skills and hands-on technique to turn fruit into table art. Projects will be consumed. Ages 12-17 (Suggested donation $5.)
description_web: In this class, students will participate in individual and group projects that turn common fruits into decorations for the table. A brief history of fruit carving will be presented. Most of the class will be hands-on technique and practice. Knife skills will be taught and sharpened. Projects will be consumed. Class designed for ages 12 to 17. Suggested donation $5 to cover food.

name: Youth Block Printing
description_book: We will make blocks for printing and print them. We will use several easy techniques. You can bring fabric to print on, but fabric will be available.
description_web: A class where we will make some blocks for printing and then print them. We will use several easy block-making techniques.  If you have some fabric you want to print (shirt, bag, etc.), bring it along, but fabric will also be available.

name: Cut-and-Thrust Long Sword Tournament
description_book: A HEMA-style Long Sword fencing tournament where fencers will get multiple passes with each opponent, and awarded points depending on their outcome.
description_web:
A HEMA-style Long Sword fencing tournament where fencers will get multiple passes with each opponent, and awarded points depending on their outcome.

Fencers must have a two-handed sword, rigid elbow/knee pads, and sturdy hand protection (gauntlets, hockey gloves, or HEMA gloves). Padded jackets and shin/forearm guards are encouraged. Fencers may also have a belt dagger (including rubber daggers!) and may grapple if both fencers are grappling-authorized and agree ahead of each bout. No other weapons or parrying devices will be permitted.

name: Youth Armored Combat: Afternoon
description_book: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.
description_web: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.

name: Arabic Hip Movements
description_book: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental dance perspective. A beginning knowledge of ME Dance is appreciated.
description_web: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental dance perspective, taught by Baroness Simone. A beginning knowledge of Middle Eastern dance is appreciated.

name: *Nålbinding*: Dalby and Telemark Stitches
description_book: From beginner to advanced students, all welcome. Students encouraged to bring wool yarn and tapestry/*nålbinding* needle.

name: Beginning Netting
description_book: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. Learn how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot.
description_web: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. I'll teach how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot. Netting can be scaled down to make hairnets of silk, or scaled up to make fish nets or tote bags using a sheet bend knot.
fee_itemization: The material fee covers the cost of the prewound netting shuttle, the gauge stick, and the base rod.

name: Miraculous, Mysterious, Medieval Theatre
description_book: A look at the death and rebirth of theatre in the Middle Ages, from religious condemnation to church-sponsored epic pageants and passion plays.

name: Introduction to Pattern Darning
description_book: A counted technique in which the design is “woven” into the ground fabric with beautiful results! Class includes history, kit, and "how to".
description_web:
Pattern darning is a counted technique in which the design is “woven” into the ground fabric with beautiful results! A few minutes to learn and a lifetime to master, this technique can create works of exquisite simplicity or stunning complexity. It dates back to the 12th century (or possibly further) and can be found in diverse places within our period.

The class will discuss the history of the technique in more detail, and cover the “how to”. The kit will provide all the materials needed to make an approximately 10x10-inch kerchief, documentable to Mumlak-period Egypt. Please bring a hoop (some will be available for purchase at the class) and scissors.
fee_itemization:
Handout is approx 9 pages, including diagrams and color pictures.

Materials include $2 for embroidery thread and $3 for ground fabric.

name: Period Islamic Cooking
description_book: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.
description_web: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.

name: Photographers' Roundtable
description_book: Want to take better SCA photos? Want to talk shop with other photographers? Come hang out for a chat. No topic too big, no camera too small.

name: Pillbox Hat Patterning and Sewing Class
description_book: *Tarboosh, fez*, sugarloaf, pillbox: pattern and sew this simple, broadly-attested hat to fit your head and persona. Kits $20. Novice sewer friendly.
description_web: *Tarboosh, fez*, sugarloaf, pillbox: pattern and sew this simple, broadly-attested hat to fit your head and persona. Hat kits include instruction sheets, aluminum foil and painter’s tape for patterning, two pieces of contrasting fabric, three needles, pins, a small spool of thread, a pair of shears, and a piece of soap or a pencil stub for fabric marking. Novice sewer friendly.
fee_itemization: aluminum foil and painter’s tape for patterning, two pieces of contrasting fabric, three needles, pins, a small spool of thread, a pair of shears, and a piece of soap or a pencil stub for fabric marking.

name: Known World Armored Novice Tourney
description_book: Test your skills against the warriors of the Known World of the same experience level. Fighters must be within 2 years of their primary authorization.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: 16th-Century Western Erotica - CCt
description_book: An exploration of the *I Modi* and other erotic works of the 16th century. **Age 18+.**
description_web: *I Modi* (*The Ways*), also known as *The Sixteen Pleasures*, is a famous erotic book of the Italian Renaissance in which a series of sexual positions were explicitly depicted in engravings. We will examine images from this work and others that explore sexual art for its own sake. There are handouts available. Because of the nature of the class, **age 18+ only.**

name: Beginner Dance: *Branles*
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun *branles* from 16th-century France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun *branles* from 16th-century France.

location: E07. Off the Great Eastern Highway. Next to Denys the Decadent/Dennis Greenway. In Timothy of Sherwoods' camp.  (E07 Off The Great Eastern Highway. Next to Denys the Decadent/Dennis Greenway. In Timothy of Sherwoods' camp.)
name: Beginning Period-ish Feather Work for Fletching
description_book: Feather fronts will not peel up even when shot deeply into a target. No expensive modern jigs. Cut profiles you like. Silk thread & 7" dowel used.
description_web: Feather fronts will not peel up even when shot deep into targets. No expensive modern jig needed. Cut profiles you design. Silk thread and a 7" long dowel piece used to learn. Arrows made with this process won a kingdom championship, several tournaments and outscored a grand master bowman. This process allows one to quickly and easily rescue flights and thread from broken arrows saving money and time. Nocks, points, documentation, spine, cresting and straightening are not our focus. Please bring note taking materials.
fee_itemization: Two full length, milled turkey feathers & three, trimmed flights $3.00. A 7" dowel $1.00. Hide glue, tea lights, handout $1.00

name: *Domos Draconum* Level 1: Intro - Old School D & D
description_book: Intro to the 1980 Basic version of D & D using only six-sided dice. Character generation, then an adventure in a sample dungeon. **Ages 11-17**
description_web: Welcome to your Doom! An introduction to the 1980 Basic version of D & D using only six-sided dice. Character generation followed by an adventure in the sample dungeon. **This class is limited to gentles ages 11-17.**

name: Morris Games
description_book: Come learn to play a classic! *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe) will be taught.
description_web: Come learn to play a classic! *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe) will be taught.

location: Gunnery Point on Mt Eislinn (Top of Mt Eislinn)
name: Period Black Powder Firearms: Safety and Handling
description_book: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Powder and match supplied by teacher. **Ages 18+.**
description_web: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Owners of period arms are requested/encouraged to bring them and help with coaching newer shooters. Powder and match are supplied by instructor. **Ages 18+.** Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info. Under 18 may watch, but cannot handle arms or powder.

name: Late Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo you'll see items from Europe to the Middle East from the 11th - 14th centuries! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Build a Rapier Tower IKEA style
description_book: Learn to build a sturdy structure for rapier fighting that flat packs.
description_web: Tired of using hay bales for the corners of walls and having "That Talk" with your opponent because the shot breached the air above the hay bale? Have you been a marshal with a staff trying to be the corner and praying "Not the Face!"  Well, in this class you will learn how easy it is to build a flat pack rapier tower that will be sturdy enough to lean up against, easy to take down and easy on your storage space. Class handouts will include cutting diagrams, part lists and tips on construction for hand tool and power tool users.

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.
description_web: Focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.

name: Eight Essential Knots for the SCA Camper
description_book: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.
description_web: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus* Rehearsals
description_book: *Chorulus Pennsicus*: Audition-only choir. Rehearsals are held at Camp Lochmere on the Serengeti. Auditions for Pennsic 50 are scheduled in THING.
description_web: Rehearsals for *Chorulus Pennsicus* Pennsic 49. Audition-only select choir. Previous choral experience required. Rehearsals are in Camp Lochmere, N-18. Auditions for Pennsic 50 CP are scheduled. Check THING for further details.

name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: I host an open 12-Step meeting at 4:00 pm daily in my camp in EO7, Denys the Decadent's Camp.
description_web: This is an open 12-Step meeting open to all who are looking for a 12-Step meeting to attend for on-site support.

name: Multiplayer Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: SCA Ukulele
description_book: Explore the ways ukuleles may be used for period and filk material. Learn basic chords and a few songs. Bring your ukulele. Handouts provided.
description_web: Explore the ways ukuleles may be used for period and filk material. Learn basic chords and a few songs. Bring your ukulele. Handouts provided.

name: KW Thrown Weapons Marshals: Opening Meeting
description_book: This meeting is open to all Known World Thrown Weapons Marshals. Please attend to hear this year's range procedures.
description_web: This meeting is open to all Known World Thrown Weapons Marshals. Please attend to hear this year's range procedures.

name: A Brief Intro to Medieval Middle Eastern Dance
description_book: The focus of this class is to briefly discuss the history of dance in the Middle East and how all of this relates to M.E./belly dance within the SCA.
description_web: The focus of this class is to briefly discuss the history of dance in the Middle East, the different eras and areas that are involved, cultural and societal views of dance and dancers (both professional and non-professional), and how all of this relates to Middle Eastern dance within the SCA. *Please bring your own seating if possible.* Handout available for free online or $10 for a paper copy (to cover printing costs - it's long with a lot of high-resolution images). Here's the virtual handout: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OqWLGMmhwzWS7f5VF2OCxs2Ug42RUIDUkEEW-yfY1zM/edit?usp=sharing .
fee_itemization: Here's the virtual handout: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OqWLGMmhwzWS7f5VF2OCxs2Ug42RUIDUkEEW-yfY1zM/edit?usp=sharing

name: Lampworking: Stringers and Twisties
description_book: Learn to create fine stringers and colorful twisties to decorate your lampworked beads.
description_web: For those who have the basics of safety and bead forming in hand, come learn how to make and apply glass stringers and twisted rods with two or more colors. These were used in period to embellish beads in a variety of ways. Auditors welcome, space permitting.
fee_itemization: Fuel and glass

name: *Janissary* Band Performance at Opening Ceremonies
description_book: Not a class. The *Janissary* Band will gather to perform their repertoire in Opening Ceremonies.
description_web: The *Janissary* Band will gather to perform their repertoire.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

name: Surreptitious Whiskey: Our First Pennsic Concert
description_book: Join Tonis Van Driele, Lucia Elena Braganza, Dai Gerdwr and Líadan Liathán for an hour of rolicking harmonies and singalongs in several languages.
description_web: Tonis Van Driele, Lucia Elena Braganza, Dai Gerdwr and Líadan Liathán sing and play for an hour of rolicking harmonies and singalongs in several languages.

name: How to Marshal a Rapier Battle at Pennsic.
description_book: This class is designed to help new or seasoned marshals understand the differences between large rapier battles at Pennsic.
description_web: This class is designed to help new or seasoned marshals understand the differences between the large rapier battles at Pennsic.

name: Night Sky Over Pennsic
description_book: Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Telescope, binoculars, chair, blanket if desired. Small telescope will be set up for viewing.
description_web: Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Bring a camp chair or blanket if desired. A small telescope will be set up for viewing. As the battlefield is parking during the first week, the open area in front of Pennsic University Point will be used which also blocks light pollution from spotlights in the parking lot. As this basically a star party, other telescopes and binoculars are quite welcome. Do not use hand sanitizer on eyepieces or lenses. Sunset is around 8:30PM.
fee_itemization: handouts will be free. I may bring copies of Sky and Telescope and Ad Astra to give away. I will use copies of Sky and Telescopes star maps with my class handouts and they have no problem with my doing this from my online superscription per phone conversation.

name: Family Point Movie Night
description_book: Join us in the Great Hall for a double feature! Disney's Robin Hood for the younger set, followed by Princess Bride! Bring blankets/chairs. All ages.
description_web: Join us in the Great Hall for a double feature! Disney's *Robin Hood* for the younger set, followed by *Princess Bride*! Bring blankets/chairs. All ages welcome, with appropriate supervision.

name: Glass Apprentice Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be *Around the World in 11 Nights*. Eat your heart out, Phileas Fogg!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be *1001 Arabian Nights*. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Duke Moonwulf's Annual Pennsic Concert
description_book: Come to listen, sing along, laugh and cry with the songs and stories of Duke Moonwulf (aka Michael Longcor). Join a Pennsic Tradition!
description_web: Come to listen, sing along, laugh and cry with the songs, stories and shenanigans of Duke Moonwulf (aka Michael Longcor), in a concert that has become a Pennsic Tradition.
fee_itemization: Not applicable

name: The Irish Frau and Friends
description_book: Aibhilin and friends perform bardic and period music.
description_web: Join Aibhilin inghean Daibhidh, known as the Irish Frau, and her friends as they perform a mix of period and bardic music for instruments and voice. We sing, we laugh, you laugh (hopefully with us) and enjoy war songs, humorous poems, period madrigals, harp, and more!

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Come join us in the Dance Tent for open dancing!

name: *i Verdi Confusi*: Players' Patchwork Theatre Co
description_book:
Back for more *Commedia dell'Arte all'Improvviso* hilarity! Of course! It All Makes Sense Now!
Show Contains Adult Themed Content.
description_web:
Back for more *Commedia dell'Arte all'Improvviso* hilarity! Of course! It All Makes Sense Now!
Show Contains Adult Themed Content.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi. Bring your own mat or towel and water! Power up and stretch!
description_web: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi, dancer, fighter, artisan, merchant or royal! Bring your own mat or towel and water, wear easy-to-move-in clothes. Get ready to power up and stretch!

name: Known World Players Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Players: Performing Arts Pavilion.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Players Pennsic 49 production of *Wyrd Sisters* by Terry Pratchett and Stephen Briggs.

name: Youth Armored Combat: Morning
description_book: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.
description_web: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: Pennsic Photo Safari
description_book: Shooting at War! Discussion: What's appropriate to photograph, and the importance of photography to the Society. Wear comfy shoes. Maximum 15.
description_web: An approximately 2-hour walkabout, photographing Cool Stuffs at Pennsic, with discussion on what is appropriate as a Society photographer, and the importance of photography to the Society. We will start at the classroom, but not return there. Wear comfortable shoes, bring water (or a tankard), and bring a camera, of course (your phone is fine). Maximum 15.

name: Russian Gold Work Embroidery
description_book: Learn the basics of how to apply pearls, beads, padding and "waste of time" (cording). Kits will contain all the materials to finish a bag.
description_web:
This is a **4-hour** workshop to get you started on your project. We will be learning the basics of how to apply pearls, beads, padding and "waste of time" (cording). Kits will contain all the materials to finish a large 9" x 15" bag. These techniques can be applied to a variety of projects. Kits include hoop, handout, "waste of time" (cording), pearls, seed beads, padding, cotton cording, needles, fabric, linen or cotton for backing, bees wax, threads. Please bring scissors. 
**We will take a break for lunch after 2 hours.**
fee_itemization: Material fee includes hand out, "waste of time" (cording), pearls, seed beads, padding, cotton cording, needles, brocade, linen or cotton for backing, bees wax, threads

name: Glass Apprentice Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Medieval Sigillography: Wax Seals
description_book: This class delves into the nuances of how and why wax seals were used (and misused) in legal documents during the Middle Ages.
description_web: Who were the bastards of Armagnac? Why did St. Peter send missionaries to Europe in 47 AD? And how did the monks of Montier-en-Der protect themselves? This class delves into the nuances of how wax seals were used (and misused) in legal documents during the Middle Ages. Class will be a lecture format and include topics of methods for doing wax sealing with modern and period materials. Handouts provided.

name: The Carolingian "Renaissance"?
description_book: Charlemagne sought to unify the disparate peoples of western Europe. How successful was he?
description_web: Charlemagne sought to unify the disparate peoples of western Europe and resurrect the Roman Empire through more efficient administration and by fostering the development of the arts and literacy. How successful was he?

name: Bidding the Bedes: Introduction to Paternosters
description_book: The history and development of western European Christian prayer beads as well as information on making your own replica.
description_web: In the 13th-16th centuries in western Europe, prayer beads were a ubiquitous accessory. This class discusses the history and development of the paternoster, as well as information on making your own replica. Kits will be available to make a glass paternoster.
fee_itemization: Beads, silk thread, needle, bead tip

name: Food & Sex in Middle Ages & Renaissance Medicine
description_book: A look at the documented interrelationship of nutrition and sexual health in pre-1600 Europe. **18+.**
description_web: There is an interrelationship between nutrition and sexual health that is documented magnificently in Western European archives of the 11th through 16th centuries. We will briefly look at it while handling a sampling of some of these popular prepared medicines. **18+.**
fee_itemization: At-will donation

name: SCAbominations
description_book: What the SCA taught you about the Middle Ages that just isn't true.
description_web: The things the SCA taught you about the Dark Ages, Middle Ages, and Renaissance that just aren't true, from names to populations. Includes a brief discussion of prostitution; suitable for any minor who already knows about that. Bring materials for taking notes if desired. (!)

name: Modern Gaming: War Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Conversational Russian
description_book: Covers the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, plus words and phrases more related to the SCA.
description_web: Covers the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, responses and questions. After that, we will go over words and phrases more related to the SCA which can be used to flavor one’s persona. There will be time reserved at the end of the class for questions.

name: Sex and Gender in the German Reformation
description_book: Adult-only. Social roles/options based on gender and status, charges of impotence, brothels, cross dressing, and other taboo subjects. **Age 18+.**
description_web: What's the difference between a whore and a prostitute? What was the view on homosexuality? Is divorce a thing? Could a woman lead/fight in the army? What were the views on gender roles? Class will take on social roles and options based on gender and status, charges of impotence, the brothels, cross-dressing, and other more taboo subjects of the German Reformation. **Adult topics; 18 and above or 16-17 with adult.**

name: *Bodhrán*: The Irish Frame Drum
description_book: *Bodhránista* Lady Líadan teaches Jig, reel, slip jig, polka, horn pipe rhythms and etiquette. Bring a drum. (Some loaners available.)
description_web: *Bodhránista* Lady Líadan, a teacher for Irish Arts Academy of Indianapolis, shows you how to choose a drum and tipper, basic Irish rhythms, and how to not get kicked out of a session. Bring a drum if you have one. (Some loaners available.)

name: Beginning Hand-Sewing for Tweens and Teens
description_book: Learn basic hand-sewing stitches and make a pouch to take home with you!
description_web: Learn basic hand-sewing stitches and make a pouch to take home with you!

location: Midlands, of the Middle Kingdom (N 21 at the gate with the Yellow Dragon in the Red Circle.  )
name: Repoussé, Making Metal Move
description_book: All things repoussé: we will start the morning making pitch. Students will then use this pitch to do a repoussé project.  Bring your lunch.
description_web: All things repoussé: we will start the morning making pitch. Students will then use this pitch to do a repoussé project.  I will loan what we need to use, but If you have your own supplies, please bring them. The fee was set at $20.00  but I really think it will be less. This will include a tin of the pitch we make which you may take, metal for one project, use of tools and gas for the torches. Eventually you will need a heavier pot for pitch. Please bring your lunch.
fee_itemization: The fee will be 20 or less. This will include metal and pitch that we make. If you have your own supplies, then the metal will be 3.00.

instructor: Thl Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Pennsic Instrumental Youth Consort
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all pitched and percussion instruments played by musicians ages 12-19.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all pitched and percussion instruments played by musicians ages 12-19. All levels of playing are welcome, though a basic understanding of how to read music for your instrument is required. We will learn between three and five pieces from within SCA period. The Consort will be led by THL Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes, who is also a music teacher in modern life. We will begin rehearsals on Saturday of War Week, though PDFs of the music for performance can be obtained beginning in July by contacting THL Cynthia.

name: Family *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: Family-oriented *kumihimo*: braiding round cord on a disk. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented *kumihimo*: braiding round cord on a disk. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Make a basic round cord which can be used for everything from shoestrings to medallion cords. Disk and string provided.
fee_itemization: disk, bobbins, string, & instructions

name: A Family Walking Tour of Pennsic
description_book: New to Pennsic? An old veteran, but your kids aren't? Join us for a tour of family-friendly locations. Appx one-mile loop. Meet at playground gate.
description_web: New to Pennsic? An old veteran, but your kids aren't? Join us for a tour of family-friendly locations. Approximately one-mile loop. Meet at playground gate.

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: All youth between 6 and 17 are welcome to participate in the daily activities. Instruction and games will vary by day.

name: Thrown Weapons MIT: Part 1
description_book: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.
description_web: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.

name: East Kingdom Day: Origami
description_book: Learn to fold paper and make beautiful creations!
description_web: Learn to fold paper and make beautiful creations!

name: Beginner Middle Eastern Hand Drumming
description_book: This is a beginner's class for dumbek and frame drums.  Learn to hold and hit the drum and play basic rhythms. **You must bring your own drum. **
description_web: This is a beginner's class for dumbek and frame drums.  Learn to hold and hit the drum.  Popular rhythms will be explained, then played together. This is the perfect class for first timers of all ages.  **You must bring your own drum.**

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre
description_book: Kids ages 5-12, join us in creating & performing, from story book to stage, your very own play! Creative minds + theatrical tools = a fun time!
description_web: For kids ages 5-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: How to Write Praise Poetry
description_book: Turn your friends into legends. Come and learn how to plan, begin, and deliver a praise poem. We will adapt to serve writers at all levels.
description_web: Praiseworthy deeds happen all the time in the SCA. What can you do if you notice someone being awesome? Write a praise poem and tell the world! This class offers a straightforward process for writers at any level to plan and deliver a praise poem, and resources for continuing to improve on your own. Novice, journeyman, or laureate, you are welcome.

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (Fibula)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/fibula from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools will be available. Bring yours, if possible.
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or fibula from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along.
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: Stitching *Temari*, Japanese Embroidery Balls
description_book: Learn a traditional Japanese embroidery art that's centuries old, but perfect for a modern crafter. We'll start one ball that you finish on your own.
description_web: *Temari* is a terrific craft for the modern stitcher, but it can be documented back to around 600 CE. In this class, we will start with a premade and marked ball, and use wrapping and stitching techniques to create a piece that is impressive far out of proportion with the effort involved.
fee_itemization: materials to stitch one ball, plus enough to begin several more

name: Thread-Wrapped Buttons
description_book: A practical class on how to make thread-wrapped buttons for late period garb. I will bring kits for at least 15 people to make their own buttons.
description_web: A practical class on how to make thread-wrapped buttons for late period garb. I will bring kits for at least 15 people to make their own buttons. If you are unable to attend the class at the time it is offered and want to learn, please feel free to come visit me in the Drachenwald Royal camp on Brewer's Road, block N13, and I will be glad to teach you at a time that works for us both.

name: Blockprinting on Fabric and Paper For Beginners
description_book: European-style blockprinting on fabric and paper. This hands-on class will include period and modern methods for block carving and printing.
description_web: European-style blockprinting on fabric and paper using blocks of various materials. Printed fabric was used for clothing, wall hangings, tablecloths, etc. This hands-on class will start with a discussion of historical techniques and block carving: printing with both period and modern materials. The main focus of the class will be on printing with provided blocks.
fee_itemization: ink, disposable brayers and palette paper, paper and fabric

name: Alchemy in Europe
description_book: How alchemy was viewed in medieval Europe.
description_web: How transmutational and medicinal alchemy was viewed in medieval Europe. This course surveys what alchemy was and wasn't in European history, who its adherents were, and what their practices were in the medieval period and into the late Renaissance.

name: *Hōnen*: Engendering Faith in Japanese Buddhism
description_book: An introduction to premodern Japanese Buddhism, focusing on women in Buddhist cosmology and community from continental roots to Japanese innovations.
fee_itemization: Cost of producing the handouts.

name: Unbelted Champions Battle
description_book: 30 per side. 1 pass. Full field. Crowns may not fight. Unbelted Heirs may. No Allies.
description_web: 30 per side. 1 pass. Full field. Crowns may not fight. Unbelted Heirs may. No Allies.

name: *Canary* with Training Wheels
description_book: The *Canary* is a 16th-century dance with swagger and foot-stamping. I will teach a simplified pattern that will let you start having fun with it.
description_web: The *Canary* is a 16th-century dance with swagger and foot-stamping. I will teach a simplified pattern that will let you start having fun with it. Feel free to wear stompy boots!

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.

name: Fundamentals of Performance
description_book: A welcoming session for all levels of performer on issues of physical and vocal health, stage fright, engaging with content, feedback and more.
description_web:
How do we bring ourselves to get up in front of others and *perform*? Who can do it, and what do you need to be able to do? **How** do you even start?

This class seeks to dispel some myths, offer a reassuring stepping stone into being a confident and competent performer, and explore how to engage with material in a way that brings both you and it to life. Appropriate for all performers from the brand new and aspiring, to the experienced and curious.

name: Toddler Playgroup (Under 4)
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.
description_web: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.

name: Tic Tac Toe (Youth Shoot)
description_book: Archers will shoot one arrow at the target. Archer with the closest arrow to the center will go first. Archers will take turns shooting at the target.
description_web: Archers will shoot one arrow at the target. The archer with the closest arrow to the center will go first. Archers will take turns shooting at the target, playing tic tac toe with their arrows. If an arrow hits the line (tape), it doesn’t count (optional). If a player hits a square that another player already has shot, the arrow doesn’t count. The first player to get three squares in a row wins (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally).

name: Kinetic Tournament
description_book: A motion-based throwing competition. You walk towards the target while throwing. Limited to 12 participants, expert level only.
description_web: A motion-based throwing competition. You walk towards the target while throwing. Limited to 12 participants, expert level only.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: East Kingdom Day: *Kumihimo*
description_book: Learn this Japanese art of braiding!
description_web: Learn this Japanese art of braiding!

name: Fixing the Problems in Scala's *Scenarios*
description_book: We look at the comic *Commedia dell'Arte* scenarios in Flaminio Scala's 1611 collection and enumerate and fix the types of recurring problems.
description_web: We look at the comic *Commedia dell'Arte* scenarios in Flaminio Scala's 1611 collection and enumerate and fix the types of recurring problems for reading and performance. This includes actions that modern audiences reject, wrong and missing entrances, ambiguous pronoun antecedents, missing scenes, jokes lost in time, motive indications, backstories not matching the play, making it active voice, and adding names to the unnamed.

name: Archery Populace War Points
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for War Points.
description_web: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for War Points.

name: The Care and Feeding of Canvas Tentage
description_book: Learn how to keep your remote home worthy of your investment.
description_web: So you finally splurged on a tent, and want to know how to keep it... Or maybe you have or inherited one, and it has been through the wringer and you want to fix it up? Maybe you are interested in how to fix them? Learn how to keep your remote home worthy of your investment.

name: Bardic Circles 101
description_book: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, the etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate.
description_web: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, the etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate. We won't actually be performing, but we will play a game to give you an idea of how to join in a bardic circle. If you'd like to try it for real, there's the Runestone Bardic Circle (Pennsic's Least Intimidating!) at 2 pm at Runestone Hill, so you can put your new knowledge and skills to use! For masks and distancing, we will be following the Pennsic CovidSafe guidance.

name: Knowne World Chatelains' Meeting
description_book: Join Chatelains from around the Knowne World as we share ideas on newcomer recruitment and retention!
description_web: Join chatelains from around the Knowne World as we share ideas on newcomer recruitment and retention! This meeting is open to all local, regional, and kingdom chatelains, as well as anyone interested in learning what's involved in becoming a chatelain in the SCA.

name: Belted Champions Battle
description_book: 1 pass. Full field. Crowns may not fight. Heirs may. No Allies.
description_web: 1 pass. Full field. Crowns may not fight. Heirs may. No Allies.

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 6, through and including Thursday, Aug. 11, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 6, through and including Thursday, Aug. 11, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Navigating the SCA for LGBTQIA+ - CCt
description_book: Resources and information, plus answering questions for those who are part of, or related to, the LGBTQIA+ and transgender community. **18+ only.**
description_web: In this class I will share my experiences in my 20+ years in the SCA as a queer person with friends and family all over the rainbow. This is not a comprehensive class but I will provide resources and answer questions in order to ease any concerns or point out pitfalls in this great game of ours. I don't know everything, but should be able to point out resources to answer questions I cannot. We are a big umbrella Society and navigating it can be intimidating. Come join us and know you are not alone. **Age 18+ only.**

name: Arbeau's *Branles*
description_book: These *branles* are often taught to beginners, but how well do we really know them? Let’s have another look at them, as reconstructed by the teacher.
description_web: These *branles* are often taught to beginners, but how well do we really know them? Let’s have another look at them, as reconstructed by the teacher.

name: Very Old Games: *Mancala*
description_book: *Mancala* has been played since at least 1000 BC and in 100s of traditional and modern variations. Learn some history and stay to play a few versions.
description_web: *Mancala* refers to a huge, ancient family of games that involve moving or "sowing" stones or "seeds" into pits with a goal of capturing the most stones. *Mancala* games have been played at least since 1000 BC, and there are hundreds of both traditional and modern versions. Learn some history and stay to play a few versions.

name: Youth Friend or Foe Shoot
description_book: The target is to kill the foe and save the friend. The points are based on where you shoot on the foe. Certain areas have more points.
description_web: The target is to kill the foe and save the friend. The points are based on where you shoot on the foe. Certain areas have more points.

name: How to Teach Youth to Throw
description_book: Discussion of legal requirements for youth throwing in the SCA as well as talk about teaching techniques that have been successful with minors.
description_web: Recommended for Marshals in Training. This class will go into more detail than the marshaling class about legal requirements for youth throwing in the SCA, as well as talking about teaching techniques that have been successful with minors.

name: Seven Rhythms of Pennsic Apocalypse
description_book: Beginner rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 3-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
This is a beginner drumming class. Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 3-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*

name: Alternates/Allies/Anyone (Exhibition)
description_book: For Fun, **No Point**.
description_web: Belts and unbelts to fight a one pass 30 v 30. For Fun, **No Point**.

name: Turkish Line Dancing
description_book: Learn a Turkish line dance or two, or three. Ne experience necessary. All ages. All genders!
description_web: Learn a Turkish line dance or two, or three. Ne experience necessary. All ages. All genders!

name: Scribal Things I Know Now That I Wish I Knew Then
description_book: Simple new scribal tips and tricks I know now that I wish I knew when I started.

name: Storytelling 101: Dressing the Bones
description_book: Many people think that all they have to do is open their mouths and out will pour a great story. Not so. Learn the basics of telling a good story.
description_web: Many people think that all they have to do is open their mouths and out will pour a great story. This is rarely the case. To become a good storyteller we need to start at the beginning by working with the bones or, in other words, the basic elements of what makes a good story. In this class, we will work with the basic bones of the story and learn how to dress.

name: *La Convivencia* in Food: Look at Spanish Cooking
description_book: A look at cooking in Spain with an emphasis on regional and religious variations.
description_web: A look at cooking in Spain with an emphasis on regional and religious variations from the 13th to 15th centuries.  Examine the differences and commonality of foods across Spain.

name: *Sakutei*: Elements of Japanese Garden Design
description_book: A practical introduction to artificial landscapes, from the villas of ancient Japanese princes to the *roji* attached to late medieval tea huts.
fee_itemization: Cost of producing multi-page handouts.

name: Allied Champions Battle
description_book: Single battle, 1 hour combat time, restricted resurrection.
description_web:
Combatants
o 100 combatants per side.
o Allies only; no combatants from East or Midrealm.
o “Soccer” substitutions (once you leave, you may not re-enter). Those waiting to sub in must remain in the substitute box. Combatants must move to the sidelines when they leave the field.
 Resurrection
o As combatants die, they move to the resurrection box.
o Every 3 minutes, the resurrection boxes are simultaneously released.
o Dead who are not yet inside the resurrection box at release must wait until the next release.
Scoring
o Score one point when both flags are together at your tower.
o When a point is scored, call hold, reset flags and combatants to starting positions, and reset resurrection clocks.
o Flags must be held in an otherwise-empty gauntleted hand.
o Flagbearers have 360-degree engagement.
o If a flagbearer is killed, the flag must be immediately dropped (not thrown or handed off).
o Only the enemy may move your flag from its initial position (but you may directly return it).
o Total score at the end of the hour wins the War Point.

name: Hope Springs Eternal: *Spero*
description_book: A delightful 15th-century dance for three, full of fun musical changes and flirtatious exchanges. Intermediate/Advanced.
description_web: A delightful 15th-century dance for three, full of fun musical changes and flirtatious exchanges. Intermediate/Advanced.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert, Thursday, War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella* with Deonna von Aachen. We will rehearse 2-3 pm Sunday, August 7, through Wednesday, August 10. The performance will be part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Shakespeare Monologues – for Fun and Auditions
description_book: An easy, no-pressure way to start – or brush up. Need a speech to audition for Pennsic 50 Romeo and Juliet? We have dozens. Free. And coaches.
description_web: An easy, no-pressure way to start – or brush up. Need a speech to audition for Pennsic 50 Romeo and Juliet? We have dozens - all taken from that play. Free copies for the asking. And coaches. Our handouts include "translations" to demystify Shakespeare's weird words and phrasing. We'll have experienced actors on hand to help you, answer questions, and let you have fun with the, frankly, completely bonkers Romeo and Juliet plot points.

name: Youth Carnival Shoot
description_book: Ages 12 and younger. Three shoots that consist of 3 shoots: Ferris wheel target, saddle shoot and balloon pop. Player with the most points win.
description_web: Ages 12 and younger. Three shoots that consist of 3 shoots: Ferris wheel target, saddle shoot and balloon pop. Player with the most points win.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus* Open Auditions for Pennsic 50
description_book: Open auditions for the select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus* at Pennsic 50. Prepare a short piece to sing; you will also sight read.
description_web: Open auditions for anyone interested in auditioning for the select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus* at Pennsic 50, directed by Mistress Arianna Morgan. Previous choral singing experience is expected. Those who audition will need to sing a short piece that demonstrates their vocal abilities, and perform a short sight-reading exercise.

name: Calligraphy Basics
description_book: Calligraphy basics: hand movement, strong and accurate strokes, basic terms and exercises for beginners.
description_web: Calligraphy basics: hand movement, strong and accurate strokes, basic terms and exercises for beginners.

name: Classical Cryptology: Codes and Ciphers
description_book: Codes and ciphers from antiquity to the Renaissance. Hands-on class will allow students to learn about the ancient and medieval forms of encryption.
description_web: Codes and ciphers from antiquity to the Renaissance. Hands-on class will allow students to learn about the ancient and medieval forms of encryption. Please bring writing instrument.

name: Beginning Hand-Stitching
description_book: Learn 5 basic hand stitch methods for a truly period look in garb.
description_web: Sewing is an ancient skill. While we have electric-powered sewing machines, there are some of us who want to experience the methods used by past sewers in the making of our garb. There are five basic stitches that, when used, will make a period gown shine above the rest.
fee_itemization: Fabric, needles, thread, bees wax, chalk pencil, $1.00 each

name: Pooh, Pooh, Pooh! I See You!
description_book: The Evil Eye is Everywhere. A look at the evil eye focusing on medieval Judaic view of superstition, amulets, talismans, and incantations.

name: The Art and Science of Handspinning
description_book: A discussion and application of hand spinning, spindle, and wheel, as it applies to textiles' general world history covered within SCA period.
description_web:
This is a discussion class covering as much of hand spinning as possible. During the class, the following sub-topics will be covered: fibers, tools, techniques, and why there's an obsession with Z and S twist. These topics will be discussed in relation to each other and the cultures in which specific aspects are prevalent. 

Students are encouraged to bring spinning tools and fiber. However, the focus will be on the impact of spinning on history rather than the practical aspect.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Goddesses, Giantesses, and Norns in Norse Myth
description_book: From Valkyries to *Völvas*, giantesses to goddesses, we’ll talk about the deeds, magic, and derring-do of the women in Norse myth.
description_web: You’ve heard about Thor and Odin, but what about the women! From Valkyries to *Völvas*, giantesses to goddesses, we’ll talk about the deeds, magic, and derring-do of the women in Norse myth.

name: Beaded Flowers 5: Water Lily
description_book: Make a water lily in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class.
description_web: Make a miniature water lily in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth. Take the Rose class first; this is a more advanced technique.
fee_itemization: beads, wire, yarn

name: Penn U Study Hall Through Body Doubling
description_book: Take an hour away from camp to double down on your learnings.
description_web: Do you come to Pennsic University, learn something awesome, mean to pursue it, only to wind up in your noisy camp where the idea flies from your mind? Come sit with us for an hour; hone your crafts, write your notes, collect your thoughts.

name: Recreating Early Period Breads
description_book: Learn about breads prior to 1066 and how to make them with focus on Europe, the Middle-East, and North Africa.
description_web: Lecture and discussion on making breads from cultures before the medieval period. Learn about the history, techniques, and breads of pre-1066 cultures including the Roman Empire and its provinces, Scandanavia, and Anglo-Saxon England. Free hand-out with recipes and bibliography.

name: Newcomers' Social
description_book: Newcomers are encouraged to come and meet other Newcomers & Chatelains from around the Knowne World, ask questions, & learn about the SCA and Pennsic.
description_web: For the seventh year, the Knowne World Chatelains will be hosting the Newcomers’ Social from 1:00pm – 2:00pm on Sunday, August 7th, in the Newcomers’ Tent (A&S 20). Newcomers are encouraged to come and meet other Newcomers as well as Chatelains from around the Knowne World, ask questions, and learn about the SCA and Pennsic.

name: Latin Reading
description_book: A daily Latin beginner reading class. We will be using Orberg's *Lingua Latina I* (purchase recommended). Handouts available.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: 1st Century Roman Jewelry Crafting Marathon - CCt
description_book: Hr. 1: beaded chain necklaces. 2nd: earrings, rings, bangle bracelets. Come for all or part! Tools & basic (or full w/mat. fee) kits provided. **18+**
description_web: Craft like it's 79 CE before partying like it's 79 CE. For the first hour, we will be making beaded chain necklaces. For the second, an assortment of earrings, rings, and bangle bracelets. Feel free to come for all or part of the class. Full project kits will be available at a $5-10 materials fee, depending on the materials. I have tools for about 12 people. Bringing your own pliers or beads is welcome (just please keep track of them)! Details: The basic "learn the techniques" kit of some bits of copper wire and glass beads is free. Optional project kits (bags of beads and wire) will be available for $5-10, depending on the cost of materials involved. Materials: copper wire, red brass wire, bronze wire, glass beads, freshwater pearl beads, semi-precious stone beads. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: The basic "learn the techniques" kit of some bits of copper wire and glass beads is free. Optional project kits (bags of beads and wire) will be available for $5-10, depending on the cost of materials involved. Materials: copper wire, red brass wire, bronze wire, glass beads, freshwater pearl beads, semi-precious stone beads.

name: *Contentezza D'Amore*
description_book: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, a beautiful 16th-century *ballo* from *Nobiltà*! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.
description_web: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, one of the most beautiful of the 16th-century *balli*! I will be teaching the version from *Nobiltà di Dame*, Signor Caroso's second book, wherein he corrects all the errors of his first; if you think you already know it, be warned! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: East Kingdom Day: Candlemaking
description_book: Learn how to make your own candle!
description_web: Learn how to make your own candle!

name: *Shatranj* (Early Chess) Tournament
description_book: We will be hosting a tournament for *Shatranj* (Arabic and early-period chess). Come and go whenever during the time slot.
description_web:
We will be hosting a tournament for *Shatranj* (Arabic and early-period chess), optionally using dice to speed play. You don't need to be present for the entire time; join late, leave early, or both. If you don't know the rules, we'll gladly teach them. No prior experience needed, but skill at chess does help.
Prizes for the winner!

name: Known World Baronial Archery Champions' Tourney
description_book: Calling all baronial archery champions to join us for our Seventh Annual Known World Baronial Archery Champions' Shoot-Off.
description_web: Calling all baronial archery champions to join us for our Seventh Annual Known World Baronial Archery Champions' Shoot-Off. This is a friendly competition among all current baronial archery champions (youth and adult) as well as for Shire, Canton, Riding, and Marche champions. Barons/Baronesses (or group Seneschal if not a barony) are requested to come join, as well. No pre-registration is required.

name: Pennsic 49 A&S Display
description_book: The Arts & Sciences Display will be held on Sunday, August 7, in the Great Hall across from the European Dance Tent.
description_web:
The Arts & Sciences Display will be held on Sunday, August 7, in the Great Hall across from the European Dance Tent. 
11:30 am: Artisans may set up their entries. 1 pm – 5 pm: the Display is open to the public; 5 – 5:30 pm: break down displays. 
• All objects / displays need to be removed by 5:30.  
• Please assist with the take down of tables to return the Great Hall to its empty state. 
• Any display items left behind will be taken to Lost & Found.

name: Early Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 5th -11th centuries from Europe and the Middle East! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Greek Line Dancing
description_book: Learn a fun Greek line dance, or two, or three. No experience required.  All ages. All genders!
description_web: Learn a fun Greek line dance, or two, or three. No experience required. All ages. All genders!

name: How to Sing, Plus How to Sing This New Piece
description_book: Join Lord Geoffrey of Exeter, former Queen's Bardic Champion of the East, for two classes in one! Singing technique, then learn a new piece.
description_web: Join Lord Geoffrey of Exeter, former Queen's Bardic Champion of the Kingdom of the East, for two classes in one! First, we will learn some pointers about good group singing technique, focused on vocal projection, tuning, blend, breathing and dynamics. Second, we will learn a piece written by Lord Geoffrey for multiple vocal parts, written with SCA use in mind and using a period text. To get a sense of previous works by Lord Geoffrey (mka David Yardley) in advance of the class, you can find samples of his professionally-recorded albums of compositions online, "New Carols and Songs for Chaucer's Pilgrims" and "The Lost Codex of Avalon".
fee_itemization: N/A

name: Peg Loom Basics
description_book: The tabletop peg loom is a step up from stick weaving.
description_web: The tabletop peg loom, also known as a rake loom, is a step up from stick weaving. The base allows you to do a wider piece. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: loom, yarn & instructions

name: Care and Feeding of Thrown Weapons
description_book: Discussion of weapon selection and maintenance. Recommended for MITs and new throwers.
description_web: Discussion of weapon selection and maintenance. Recommended for MITs and new throwers.

name: The Walking Dum: Post-Apocalypse
description_book: Begintermediate and pre-advanced rhythms to get beyond the basic rhythms. Different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
This is a begintermediate/pre-advanced  drumming class. Learn rhythms beyond the usual that you hear all the time. Class alternates between odd and even count rhythms. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Samai* (10/8), *Chaka* (6/8), *Curcuna (Jurjuna)* (6/8), others as time permits.
Day 2- *Karsilama* (9/8), *Laz* (7/8), reverse-*Laz* (7/8), others as time permits.
Day 3- *Samai* (10/8), *Chaka* (6/8), *Curcuna (Jurjuna)* (6/8), others as time permits.
Day 4- *Karsilama* (9/8), *Laz (7/8)*, reverse-*Laz* (7/8), others as time permits.

name: Heroic Champions (Armored and Rapier)
description_book: 12 total armored fights (9 belted, 3 unbelted). 20 rapier fights (a minimum of 5 non–MOD fighters).
description_web:
Armored – (1 Point)
 Principal Crowns may not fight. Non-principal Royal Cousins are able to fight.
 If an overall tie occurs in wins due to draws, the tie will be decided between tiebreaker champions of the East and Middle. Tiebreaker champions must be declared at or before the traditional Meeting of the Crowns following Opening Ceremonies. (This is the only case in which a fighter may be called on to fight more than once in the Armored Champions tournament.)
 Format is one-on-one; weapons need not be matched.
 Armored: 12 total fights (9 belted, 3 unbelted).
 Double kills to be refought once only. If a double kill results, no points are awarded.
 Alternate who chooses first. Whichever is ahead, chooses first fighter. If tied, the winner of a coin flip decides choice of electing the first armored or rapier. The other will choose the first from the other discipline. (Rapier traditionally pre-arranges this.)
Rapier – (1 Point)
● 20 fighters from each side to participate in single combat.
● At least 3 bouts are Cut-and-Thrust.
● A minimum of 5 non–MOD fighters will be chosen to fight per side.
● No sitting Crowns from Principal Kingdoms may fight.
● Draws will be re-fought once. If a draw occurs twice, neither fighter wins.
● 1 point for the side that has won the most fights.
● If an overall tie occurs due to draws, a tie will be decided between tiebreaker champions of the East and Middle. Tiebreaker champions must be declared at or before the traditional Meeting of the Crowns following Opening Ceremonies. (This is the only case in which a fighter may be called on to fight more than once in the Rapier Champions tournament.)

name: Characters of *Commedia* Workshop
description_book: Come gather with other enthusiasts and beginners to learn more about the characters of *commedia dell’arte*, and learn how to portray them on stage.
description_web: Come gather with other *Commedia* enthusiasts and beginners to learn more about the characters of *commedia dell’arte*! We will be working with personal motivations, movement styles and attitudes to help actors better portray their favorites, or find a new character to enjoy!

name: Rise of the Mongolian Empire and Europe in 13th C
description_book: Rise of Mongolian Empire and its direct and indirect impacts on the political and military situation in Europe in 13th C. Class 1 of 3.
