description_web: Remember how much fun pick-up sticks was? Come learn to play, then stay for a round-robin competition. Winner gets a set of sticks with the rules.
fee_itemization: Alys: Deleted "Come" from first line and changed period to question mark. Italics and caps, hyphen in title.

name: Beyond the Cloth: Persona Glassware, Early Period
description_book: Discussion of glassware from ancient times through the Middle Ages, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
description_web: Have you ever walked around an event with a glass in your hand? People will notice it long before they even think about looking at your shoes. Make a statement by having the right kind of glass vessel for your persona! Discussion of glassware from ancient times through the Middle Ages, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. A list of reference books will be available. Join us again at 3:00 pm for a live, narrated demonstration of the making of an Early Period drinking vessel by Master Ali (Arab Boy)!

name: Burn, Baebe, Burn!
description_book: A campfire is also a big responsibility. You will prepare, build, maintain, extinguish, and be safe with your campfire. Weather permitting.
description_web: That wonderful campfire is also a big responsibility. You will prepare, build, maintain, extinguish, and be safe with your campfire. Starting a fire without matches will be included. Weather permitting only. Limited materials.

name: My Ukulele Is a Guitar
description_book: The history of the Renaissance 4-course guitar and its direct descendant the baritone ukulele, and its surviving music.
description_web: The history of the Renaissance 4-course guitar and its direct descendant the baritone ukulele. The story of the lute's much lesser-known cousin, its surviving music, and its general disreputation.

name: Playing 15th-Century Florentine Instrumental Music
description_book: Read music from the 15th-century Florentine *Chansonnier*.  Intermediate to advanced instrumental skills needed.  Bring instrument and stand.
description_web: Let's read some music from the 15th-century Florentine *Chansonnier*. Intermediate to advanced instrumental skills needed. Wind or string instruments are best suited to this, but not limited to these. Please bring your own instrument and stand.
fee_itemization: $3 for copies of the music

name: Tapestry Frame Weaving Basics
description_book: A simple introduction to frame weaving such as tapestry, etc.
description_web: A simple introduction to frame weaving such as tapestry, etc. Class limited to 10 looms. Fee covers loom, accessories, yarn and instructions.
fee_itemization: loom, accessories, yarn & instructions

name: Dice Ground Targets (Youth Shoot)
description_book: Dice will be laid on the ground and players have to shoot the dice. Player with the highest score will win.
description_web: Dice will be laid on the ground and players have to shoot the dice. Player with the highest score will win.

name: Blue Feather Rainbow Fling
description_book: Tournament is open to all members of the greater LGBT community regardless of throwing experience. Focus will be on fun and community building.
description_web: Tournament is open to all members of the greater LGBT community regardless of throwing experience. The tournament will have an advanced as well as a beginner category to include everyone. The focus will be on fun and community building, but bring your competitive spirit as well.

name: The Walking Dum: Post-Apocalypse
description_book: Begintermediate and pre-advanced rhythms to get beyond the basic rhythms. Different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
This is a begintermediate/pre-advanced  drumming class. Learn rhythms beyond the usual that you hear all the time. Class alternates between odd and even count rhythms. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Samai* (10/8), *Chaka* (6/8), *Curcuna (Jurjuna)* (6/8), others as time permits.
Day 2- *Karsilama* (9/8), *Laz* (7/8), reverse-*Laz* (7/8), others as time permits.
Day 3- *Samai* (10/8), *Chaka* (6/8), *Curcuna (Jurjuna)* (6/8), others as time permits.
Day 4- *Karsilama* (9/8), *Laz (7/8)*, reverse-*Laz* (7/8), others as time permits.

name: Youth Combat Marshal Collegia: Armor
description_book: Armor inspections, tools and resources for running a list, and quick and dirty armor fix roundtable. First part of 5-part training to become marshal.
description_web:
Come talk about proper armor inspections on the list field, what tools and resources are necessary to have on hand when running a list, and exchange in a roundtable format some quick on-the-spot armor fixes to make stuff legal so kids can fight! 
This class serves as one of a 5-part training series to learn how to become a Heavy List Youth Marshal in the SCA. 
Come join us!

name: Æthelmearc Scribal Tea
description_book: Meet-and-Greet for Æthelmearc Scribes and any other scribes that wish to attend.

name: Introduction to Cloisonné Enameling
description_book: Hands on, introductory class to glass enameling on copper. Please bring a design suitable for a 1" square or circular token.
description_web: Hands on, introductory class to glass enameling on copper. Please bring a design suitable for a 1" square or circular token. No age restrictions, but this class involves flame. The instructor reserves the right to refuse anyone who demonstrates they cannot respect everyone's safety. Under age participants must have a responsible adult within audible and visual range of the tent at all times.
fee_itemization: All materials and tools required to complete a pendant or token

name: Ragnarök and the Death of Baldr
description_book: God is dead! Or at least a god is dead. How does a god die? And what happens next? Let's talk about Baldr!
description_web: God is dead! Or at least a god is dead. How does a god die? And what happens next? We’ll talk about the death of Baldr and Baldr’s dream and what these stories tell us about North mythology as a whole.

name: Humorous Food: The Humors, Food & Medieval Health
description_book: This will be a beginner's class regarding how the humors were associated with different foods and spices in period.
description_web: This will be a beginner's class regarding how the humors were associated with different foods and spices in period. We will cover a condensed history of where the ideas of humors came from and how they were used to classify all foods and spices from the smallest of fruits to fish and other meats.

name: English Rosaries and Paternosters
description_book: Discussion of prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.
description_web: Focus is on prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.
fee_itemization: Paper, ink

name: Theater Directors' Symposium
description_book: Ever wanted to direct at Pennsic? Experiences to share? Join a discussion of scripts, dreams, and teams that build memorable theater. All welcome!
description_web: Ever wanted to direct at Pennsic? Do you have experiences to share? Join a discussion of scripts, dreams, and teams that build memorable theater. All welcome!

name: Nosh Like an Ancient Roman
description_book: Ancient Roman snacking you can make anytime.
description_web: Ancient Roman snacking you can make anytime. Limited food samples available. Handout with recipes too!
fee_itemization:
$2 for a handout with recipes included
$3 for a small selection of Roman snacks to try

name: Latin Reading II
description_book: This is a continuation of the first week class. We will be continuing from Orberg.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

name: Rapier Pirate Battle
description_book: This scenario consists of two 30-minute unlimited resurrection battles.
description_web:
Theming:
Pirates are sacking the port town! The residents are defending their treasures. After 30 minutes or after retrieving 6 treasure chests, the pirates sail away. Eastern Army ship shall be named the Iron Sky. :)
Scenario Rules:
● This scenario consists of two 30-minute unlimited resurrection battles. One side will attack, while the other defends. After victory conditions are met **OR** 30 minutes have passed, there will be a 10-minute break and the armies will switch roles.
● The pirates must start on their Pirate Ship (inside the fort). Defenders must start at or behind the first row of chests (at least 60 feet from the attacker’s rez point).
● Unlimited resurrections. The Pirates must return to the gangplank of their ship to resurrect. Defenders must resurrect at the barracks.
● The pirates must retrieve the chests of treasure located within the town and bring them back to their ship.
○ There are 6 chests on the field as indicated on the map.
○ Defenders may not move the chests.
○ Pirates cannot run while carrying a chest.
○ Chests can only be lifted and carried with an open hand by 4 able-bodied pirates. If a fighter is carrying two weapons, they may gather them in their other hand, but if they do this, they may not fight while carrying the chest. If any person carrying a chest is killed, armed, or legged, the chest is set down and may only be picked up when there are 4 able-bodied pirates in position. (# of pirates to carry chest may be dropped at Beer and Brats.)
Scoring:
● A chest is scorable when it passes the threshold of the ship (delineated by the doors to the Fort). This is PAST the Pirates’ rez points.
● The Pirates can score up to one point per chest.
● It is possible for both armies to end with the same number of points.
General Rules:
● Death from behind and knee-walking are allowed.
● No rapier spears are allowed.
● **RUBBER BAND GUNS:**
○ Each pirate may carry one gun, and each gun is limited to one shot. In other words, each pirate is limited to one shot.
○ Sharing guns or carrying more than one piece of ammunition will be considered cheating and offenders will be removed from the field immediately.
○ May not be shot through walls.
○ Shots may be parried; if a weapon or parrying device is hit, the shot does not damage the weapon or device. (This is to prevent confusion or arguments on the field, as it can be very hard
to know if a rubber band gun ammo has hit something that is being carried.)
○ No ammo gleaning is permitted.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country
description_book: Suitable for beginners, we will learn 3-4 awesome English Country Dances. Choices dependent on number of participants.
description_web: Suitable for beginners, we will learn 3-4 awesome English Country Dances. We will start with basic steps and then my first favorite dance, *Rufty Tufty*.  Additional dance choices will be dependent on the number of participants.

name: Middle Eastern Melodies
description_book: Learn some different Middle Eastern Melodies that aren’t part of the typical Pennsic repertoire.

instructor: Thl Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Who Said You Can't Sing? (They Were Wrong)
description_book: Beginning to intermediate level techniques for solo and group singing.
description_web: In this beginning- to intermediate-level singing class, led by this year’s Youth Choir Director, we will practice techniques for healthy and pleasing vocal production. Warmups, repertoire and exercises to strengthen solo and group singing will be taught. Open to adults and youth 12+.

name: PA Afternoon Series: Bardic Arts Exhibition
description_book: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World!
description_web: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World! Feel free to sign up to tell a story, sing a song, or spout Shakespeare. If it fits in the realms of Bardic performance, you are welcome to participate.

name: The Tadcaster Militia Gauntlet Arcade Extravaganza
description_book: Fencing for *FREEZY-POPS!* Run the gauntlet! Fight all the Tads! Win fabulous tickets! Take home prizes! It's ridiculous fun for anyone with a sword!
description_web: The Tadcaster Militia presents the Amazing and Wonderful Tadcaster Arcade Gauntlet and Tournament! Win fabulous tickets and also prizes! Fencers will face a gauntlet of bouts against members of the Tadcaster Militia. Victories will earn tickets that can be exchanged for prizes. You might win a freezy-pop, but you'll definitely enjoy it!

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.
description_web: Focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.

name: Gregor & Lily Handfasting
description_book: No book, request for handfasting
description_web: This is a request for use of the Amphitheater for a wedding.

name: Wild Silk!
description_book: Did you know that silk comes in a variety of colors right off the cocoon? Come and learn about different types of silk and their uses.
description_web: Did you know that silk comes in a variety of colors right off the cocoon? From the silk called the "Queen of Assam" to silk production that doesn't hurt the moth, this class will explore wild silks of the Indian subcontinent.

name: Crannogs: Irish, Scottish and Welsh Lake Dwellings
description_book: Learn about these artificial islands that sometimes had Celtic and Viking artifacts and treasure. The presenter has first-hand experience with them.
description_web: Although these artificial islands can date back thousands of years, many were built and occupied during the SCA period. This class will provide an introduction to these interesting structures found in Ireland, Scotland, and Wales and look at some of the Celtic and Viking treasures found on or near them. The presenter has first-hand experience working on and around crannogs as part of an archaeology team and has visited some modern reconstructions for comparison.

name: Adult Doll Meet
description_book: This class is geared towards adults who collect or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll.
description_web: This class is geared towards adults who collect or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll as we will be making something special for them. Adults 18+ only, because doll hobbies can be expensive.

name: Historical versus Modern Homebrewing
description_book: Interested in historical brewing techniques? Curious about the EK Brewer's Guild paneling rubric? Discussion. Examples. Some samples? **Age 21+.**

name: The Richest Man Who Ever Lived: Jakob Fugger
description_book: A look at the life of the richest man who ever lived (depending how you calculate it): Jakob Fugger. The Augsburg banker who financed Europe.
description_web: A look at the life of the richest man who ever lived (depending how you calculate it): Jakob Fugger. The Augsburg banker who financed Popes, Kings and Emperors. His fortune would today be valued between 300 and 400 billion US dollars.  Fugger is responsible for redefining banking and finance as well as establishing modern capitalism. His impact reached across Europe.

name: Pennsic 49 A&S War Point: Judges' Training
description_book: Rubric review-and-answer session for A&S War Point Judges that have not been able to make the previously scheduled online trainings.

name: North African and Turkish Coffee
description_book: Learn how to make the perfect cup of coffee, then enjoy a cup or two!
description_web: "Coffee," from the Arabic word *qahwah*, became popular in the Maghreb by the 16th century. From beans to cup, we will roast green coffee beans together, then learn the techniques you need to make the perfect brew. We will look at *bunna*, Ethiopian coffee, for comparison. Come thirsty! There is an option to go home with the tools you need to make coffee, as I will have 20 kits available (approx. $30).
fee_itemization: handouts are 1.00 and supply kits containing cup, pot, coffee etc. run between $30.00 and $ 60.00 [ a few  actually have their own braziers ] depending on pot size and size/pieces in kit. as available

name: Beginner Tarot Reading
description_book: Brief discussion of the historical context of tarot. Focus of the class will be on learning tricks to quickly learn to read the cards for divination.
description_web: Brief discussion of the historical context of tarot. Focus of the class will be on learning tricks to quickly learn to read the cards for divination.

name: Bards and Dancers: Pennsic Pileathon!
description_book: Bards and dancers! Come sing, dance and/or play every song in the Pennsic Pile music collection. (https://pennsicdance.aands.org)! All skill levels.
description_web: The Pennsic Pile (https://pennsicdance.aands.org) is a songbook of music for the dances most commonly taught and danced at Pennsic over the last few years. The Pennsic 49 (May 2022 edition) is superb, and we're gonna play and dance them all! You might also find the Pennsic Pile fakebook useful to prepare. http://thedancingmaster.net/sca_dance_fakebook.pdf - two days, four hours each in the Tent of Loudness on the battlefield. Some Pennsic Piles will be available for musicians.

name: Beginner Dance: *English Measures*
description_book: A suite of dances for beginners: the basic dance syllabus of the later Elizabethan English gentry.

name: Uke Can Do It! For Teens
description_book: (12-17) Bring your ukulele and come ready to learn the chords for some SCA appropriate songs. Participants will get a copy of songbook.
description_web: Bring your ukulele and come ready to learn the chords for some SCA appropriate songs. All participants will get a copy of the song book with song lyrics and chords for all of the songs covered in this class.

name: Roman Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 1st to the 5th centuries, from across the Roman Empire! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Hafla Songs for All Instruments by Lady Melissa!
description_book: It has been 2 years! Dust off that *darbuka*. Polish that flute. Clean that clarinet. Let's get used to playing hafla classics together.
description_web: It has been 2 years! Dust off that *darbuka*. Polish that flute. Clean that clarinet. Let's get used to playing hafla classics together. Sheet music available for purchase or to borrow.
fee_itemization: Sheet music and drum rhythm sheets

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble
description_book: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities. We will hold three rehearsals to prepare for a brief concert Thursday of War Week.
description_web: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities are invited to participate in this ensemble. Join us in having fun and making music together! We will meet for three rehearsals: Monday - Wednesday; dress rehearsal Thursday. More information and music on Facebook. Concert, 6 pm, Thursday, 8/11, in the PA Tent. Age limit: 12 and up. A limited number of soprano and alto recorders are available for loan. If you play more than one instrument, bring them all. Please bring a music stand if you have one; loaners available. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder. Sheet music (intermediate to advanced) will be provided. $2 for music packet, or free PDFs can be found on the Facebook group: Known World Recorder Ensemble. Email the instructors: THL Jolicia atte Northclyfe  (washington.julie@gmail.com),  and The Honorable Lady Siri Toivosdotter (JoniSyngs@gmail.com).
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: Build a Rapier Tower IKEA style
description_book: Learn to build a sturdy structure for rapier fighting that flat packs.
description_web: Tired of using hay bales for the corners of walls and having "That Talk" with your opponent because the shot breached the air above the hay bale? Have you been a marshal with a staff trying to be the corner and praying "Not the Face!"  Well, in this class you will learn how easy it is to build a flat pack rapier tower that will be sturdy enough to lean up against, easy to take down and easy on your storage space. Class handouts will include cutting diagrams, part lists and tips on construction for hand tool and power tool users.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms I
description_book: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played, how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.
description_web: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played and how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: Youth Combat Marshal Collegia: Marshaling
description_book: How to become a marshal, responsibilities at each level, and how to build and grow your group.

name: Axe Continuous-Throw Tournament
description_book: How many axes can you throw without missing? Single rotation throws until you miss.
description_web: How many axes can you throw without missing? Single rotation throws until you miss.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? Auditions
description_book: The opportunity to be part of a live improv comedy show starts with auditions followed by a live performance.
description_web: If you want to be part of the cast of "Whose Line Doth it Be" then come and audition for the zany and fun show.

name: Leather Embroidery
description_book: We cover all known embroidered leather objects surviving from about 600-1600. Attendees try embroidering leather with silk thread.
description_web: This class covers the presenter’s compilation of all known embroidered leather objects surviving from about 600-1600. Shoes form the largest category by far, but there are also knife sheaths, belt pouches, doublets, gloves, and boots. Leather embroidery differs significantly from cloth embroidery. Class participants will be able to try their hand at it with a sample of leather and silk thread.

name: Knot That Knot!
description_book: Make sure you know what to do with your rope by learning these essential knots. Keep your tent up or save a life!
description_web: A good knot can keep your tent up in a strong wind, or even save a life when you're performing first aid, working over heights, or near water. But you have to know how to tie it, so make sure you know what to do with your rope by learning these essential knots.

name: Atlantian Unbelted 10-Man Mêlée
description_book: The Sergeants of Saint Aiden will host the Atlantian 10-Man mêlée after Afternoon Rapier Battle.
description_web: The Sergeants of Saint Aiden will host the Atlantian 10-Man mêlée after Afternoon Rapier Battle.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus* Rehearsals
description_book: *Chorulus Pennsicus*: Audition-only choir. Rehearsals are held at Camp Lochmere on the Serengeti. Auditions for Pennsic 50 are scheduled in THING.
description_web: Rehearsals for *Chorulus Pennsicus* Pennsic 49. Audition-only select choir. Previous choral experience required. Rehearsals are in Camp Lochmere, N-18. Auditions for Pennsic 50 CP are scheduled. Check THING for further details.

name: Ornaments in Arbeau's Dance Manual
description_book: Arbeau's 1589 dance manual contains a lot of information about step ornaments. We'll talk about them, and how they relate to other sources.
description_web: Arbeau's dance manual *Orchésographie*, published in 1589, contains a lot more than just dances and steps: it has tons of ornaments, too! We'll look at what he says about them, and how they relate to other sources from other countries.

name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: I host an open 12-Step meeting at 4:00 pm daily in my camp in EO7, Denys the Decadent's Camp.
description_web: This is an open 12-Step meeting open to all who are looking for a 12-Step meeting to attend for on-site support.

name: Introduction to *Shogi* (Japanese Chess)
description_book: We'll teach the rules of *Shogi* or "Japanese Chess", describe a few historic variants, and have a chance to play a game.
description_web: We'll teach the rules of *Shogi* or "Japanese Chess", describe a few historic variants, and have a chance to play a game. Teaching pieces will be available for use.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms II
description_book: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played, how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.
description_web: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played and how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: Youth Marshal Meet-and-Greet
description_book: Come meet other SCA youth marshals of heavy list and fence and discuss current challenges, while sharing solutions. Also cool down with summer treats!

name: Archery Marshals Meeting
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.
description_web: All Archery Marshals are required to attend one meeting.

name: Simple Murrine Bead
description_book: Create a simple murrine cane and use it to create a bead like those found at Birka, a Viking Age settlement. Intermediate.
description_web: Create a simple murrine cane and use it to create a bead like those found at Birka, a Viking Age settlement. Intermediate skill level; should be comfortable forming a basic bead and have some experience pulling and working stringers. Beginners are welcome to audit.
fee_itemization: gas for torches, glass

name: Cooking from Period Sources
description_book: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good.
description_web: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good. Also, a discussion of available sources for recipes.

name: *The Murder of Thomas Brynde*
description_book: *The Murder of Thomas Brynde* an original one-act play by Lord Ishmael Stedfast Reed of Atlantia, written in unrhymed iambic verse.
description_web:
*The Murder of Thomas Brynde*, an original one-act play by Lord Ishmael Stedfast Reed of Atlantia, written in unrhymed iambic verse.
The play adapts and dramatizes the documented letters between several concerned parties and the Privy Council of Queen Elizabeth I, written about the withholding of justice in the case of the mysterious murder of one Thomas Brynde in 1577.

name: Efenwealt Wystle and Company
description_book: Efenwealt Wystle and family are in the house!
description_web: Music that spans the SCA: historic, bardic, instrumental, vocal, comedy tragedy and everything in between. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: Period Card Games: *Tarot*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card deck.
description_web: Want to learn what they did with *Tarot* cards in period? Come learn to play *Tarot*, a trick taking card game using a 78-card deck.

name: Zsof and Tommaso Go to War
description_book: Zsof and Tommaso perform period, SCA, and original stories and songs. Family-friendly.
description_web: Zsof and Tommaso perform period, SCA, and original stories and songs. Family-friendly.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be?
description_book: The improv comedy show where anything can happen! Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants selected from auditions at 4 pm.
description_web: Welcome to "Whose Line Doth It Be?", the improv comedy competition where anything can happen. Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants must attend the auditions at 4 pm. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be *Around the World in 11 Nights*. Eat your heart out, Phileas Fogg!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be *1001 Arabian Nights*. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: *Seishin-ryū Mushin-an Chaseki*: Tea Ceremony
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear comfortable clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a small fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a small fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room. This is a participatory recreation of a sixteenth-century *wabi*-style tea gathering.
fee_itemization: Cost of tea and sweets - 10 per sitting.

name: T(w)een Lounge: 2nd Gen Hangout
description_book: Ages 12-17. Open Hangout Night. Come hang out and chat with adults who grew up in the SCA, as well as with your fellow t(w)eens

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Dance Party!
description_book: Live music and dance! Please come to the Middle Eastern tent for playing music and dancing to said music! All instruments invited.
description_web: Start your evening off with a **music** jam and **dancing**! Really, that's it. Show up with your instruments and your hips! Wear period Middle Eastern garb for bonus points! Live music and dance! Please come to the Middle Eastern tent for playing music and dancing to said music! All instruments invited.

name: *Trio Tramontana*: Smoky Medieval Jazz
description_book: Join us at *la Salle des Ardents* for Smoky Medieval Jazz. A concert of 14th and 15th C. music.
description_web: *Trio Tramontana* presents "An Evening in *la Salle des Ardents*: Smoky Medieval Jazz.” Rufina Cambrensis, John Elys and Deonna von Aachen present music of the 14th and 15th century on period instruments such as shawms, recorders and strings.

name: Tarl's Youth Polearm Tournament
description_book: Youth Bear Pit Tourney using only polearms.
description_web: Youth Bear Pit Tourney using only polearms.

name: The Debatable Choir
description_book: The acclaimed Debatable Choir performs music of the Middle Ages and Renaissance by composers like di Lasso, Vecchi, Morley, and Susato.
description_web: The acclaimed Debatable Choir performs music of the Middle Ages and Renaissance by composers like di Lasso, Vecchi, Morley, and Susato. For over 35 years, this choir has entertained royalty and peasants, receiving kingdom awards for both the Arts and Service along the way. Enjoy the glorious sound of a 20-plus voice choir singing everything from hymns of praise to drinking songs.

location: Courtesan Camp (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Roman Bacchanal - CCt
description_book: The Knowne World Courtesans call you to a celebration of all things Roman! Required: Early Imperial Roman dress and a coin (Free) **18+ ID required.**
description_web:
The Festival of Floralia is upon us! The Knowne World Courtesans call you to a celebration of all things Roman in the Known World! To gain entry, dress to impress in your finest 1st-century Roman garb. We will delight your senses with amphorae of wine, delicacies fit for the Emperor, contests of strength, beauties abundant, and bounteous sensory delights. All in celebration of Summer!

Requirements:
**18+ (no entry without ID!)**
*Early Imperial Roman dress
*a coin (free!); there are only 300 available so get them while they last!
*no photos or video permitted inside the camp. (We will have a designated photo area outside.)

Coins may be found exclusively during Pennsic at
*Courtesan Camp
*Past Tyme Perfumery/Medieval Medallions
*Prismatic Scales
*Starlit Studio/Sinister Peacock

Don't forget your mug!

We will be accepting donations to help offset the costs of the party both in advance and during the festivities. To donate, visit our PayPal here: http://www.paypal.me/SCAKWC . (Please select “Friends & Family” when you donate so that we do not lose a portion of your generous support to fees.)

name: Drake Oranwood: Troubadour Next Door
description_book: Drake Oranwood returns with joy to the Pennsic Performing Arts stage with some talented friends to entertain you.
description_web: Drake Oranwood returns with joy to the Pennsic Performing Arts stage with some talented friends to entertain you.

name: The Contessa's Red and Gold Ball
description_book: Join us for a fête in the style of the Dukes of Burgundy, themed Red and Gold. Many dances to be taught! Non-dancers welcome!
description_web: Join us for a fête in the style of the Dukes of Burgundy, themed Red and Gold. Many dances to be taught! Non-dancers welcome!

name: *i Genesii*
description_book: *i Genesii*: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence!
description_web: *i Genesii*: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! The greatest *Commedia del'Arte* troupe in the Known World does it again with its usual tasteless but hilarious performance!

name: Known World Players Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Players: Performing Arts Pavilion.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Players Pennsic 49 production of *Wyrd Sisters* by Terry Pratchett and Stephen Briggs.

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 1 is more linear; *Étude* 2 adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Armored Combat: Morning
description_book: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.
description_web: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: Goldwork Sampler
description_book: Create a sampler while trying a couple of different goldwork techniques. Real metal threads.
description_web: We will discuss the use of metal thread embroidery in European embroideries of the Middle Ages. We will learn more about the types of metal thread used, what the various threads were, how to use them, and we will make a sampler of stitches to keep so you can use it as a reference. We will be using real metal thread, a very good quality linen and silk for the ground fabric, and silk thread. This class will be taught in two parts. Students are welcome to attend either or both, but each class will work on different techniques. To keep cost of the kit down, you may bring your own frame. I will have a handful of 10 inch "canvas stretcher bars" to use as a frame which cost about $10 per set.
fee_itemization: A variety of metal threads, silk thread, linen thread, linen fabric, silk fabric

instructor: Baroness Aranwen verch Rhys ap Gwalter
name: Open Torch for Lampwork Glass Workers.
description_book: Open lampwork glass torch time. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Open torch time is the availability to practice what skills you have or ask a teacher to help you learn a new skill. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: Cost of Mapp gas, bead release, and glass rods.

name: Embroidery of 16th-Century India
description_book: Explore the marvelous embroideries of 16th-century India. We'll discuss techniques, materials, and designs in both European and Indian contexts.
description_web: Explore the marvelous embroideries of 16th-century India! Items embroidered in SCA-period India were used domestically and also exported to Europe, the Muslim world, and east Asia. We'll go over techniques, materials, and designs for embroidery in the Bengali and Gujarati styles, and talk about how the results could be used in an SCA context. I'll share close-up photos of three extant pieces I've examined. If you can do chain stitch, you can embroider in a 16th-century Indian style!

name: Introduction to A&S Documentation
description_book: This class will focus on approaches to documentation for projects in the SCA.
description_web: Whether you are creating an item for a competition, a gift, or simply a step in developing a skill or craft, it's generally a good idea to write down a few notes on your ideas, thoughts and lessons learned - all of which creates the seed to become documentation. Documentation need not be a "one size fits all" situation. This class will include a discussion of the essential elements, customizing your documentation, and when to start this process.

name: Lucet Cord for Beginners
description_book: A square lucet cord that dates back to the Viking period can be quickly made for lacing, bag closure or belt hanging.
description_web: Lucet cord has been dated back to the Viking and throughout the medieval periods. This two-pronged tool is easy to use and makes a quick cord that is not limited in length. This class is an introduction to lucetting and we will make a single color square cord.
fee_itemization:
Lucet $15
Cord and bobbins $5

name: Letting Down Her Hair
description_book: How the fairy tales within period (precursors of the Victorian literary fairy tale) tell the stories of women not only save themselves but others.
description_web: The assumptions made about the manner in which women have been portrayed in fairy tale, folk tale, and wonder tales have always reinforced the concept that the women have had little to no agency as protagonists. In direct challenge to that, this lecture will illuminate how the fairy tales within period, that are the precursors of the Victorian literary fairy tale, tell the stories of women with agency that quite often save not only themselves but others.

name: Basketry 101: Market Basket
description_book: Learn the basics of basket weaving and make your own 8"x12" market basket to take home. Bring an old towel and scissors for cutting reed.
fee_itemization: Oak D handle, dyed basket reed, plain basket reed, rim filler, tool usage and handouts

name: The Everyday Tudor
description_book: Clothing of the common Tudor man or woman. Will cover daily wear, sumptuary laws, sources of secondhand clothing, and clothing as an asset.

name: Medieval Food Myths
description_book: Ever get sick of the old myth about people using spices because they were serving rotting meat? Then this is the class for you.
description_web:
Ever get sick of the old myth about people using spices because they were serving rotting meat? Then this is the class for you.`
We will discuss common medieval food myths as well as ask the class for a few of theirs and where to find the real information for your needs.

name: Modern Gaming: War Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Intro to the Monongahela People and Culture
description_book: An introduction to the Monongahela people and culture based on current understanding from archaeological evidence.
description_web: An introduction to the Monongahela people and culture based on current understanding from archaeological evidence. The Monogahela culture was discovered during the Works Progress Administration during the Great Depression. The Monongahela culture was a Native American group based in modern-day Western Pennsylvania, West Virginia, Western Maryland, and Eastern Ohio.

name: Intro to Drop Spinning
description_book: Come learn this ancient skill and turn roving into yarn! History and hands-on participation.
description_web: Come learn an ancient skill -- turning roving into yarn. We will talk about a variety of spindles and fibers before trying our hands at drop spinning. There will be wool and synthetic fiber available, so if you have a wool allergy, you can still participate! Bring your own drop spindle or use a class loaner (available for purchase after class). Instructor is ambidextrous and can teach you whether you are right- or left-handed. Hands-on help will be limited to the first ten students (but all are welcome to come watch and audit!).
fee_itemization:
$3 - drop spindle
$2 - 1 oz roving 
(class is free if you bring your own)

name: Introduction to Fingerloop Braiding
description_book: Come learn to make colorful braided cords! All supplies will be provided.
description_web: Come learn the art of fingerloop braiding! This period practice can be used to make colorful cords in a variety of patterns for jewelry, garb lacing, and more! Supplies will be provided.
fee_itemization: N/A

name: 16th-C Maternity Wear: 4 trimesters in Garb
description_book: THL Fede shares her experience researching, constructing, and wearing late-period garb for pregnancy and post partum.
description_web: THL Fede di Fiore shares her experience researching, constructing, and wearing late-period Italian garb for pregnancy and post partum. Class will discuss primarily what styles of dress were most comfortable and easy to wear (from a re-enactment perspective) and what was actually practiced in period.
fee_itemization: Multipage color print out=$2

name: Care and Maintenance of Sewing Machines
description_book: A sewing machine is designed to last twenty to eighty years. Why they don't, how they can, and figuring out a machine you've never seen before.

name: Medieval Game Make-and-Take
description_book: Learn about some medieval games. Then, create your own fabric game board and pieces to keep.

name: Fingerloop Braiding for Tweens and Teens
description_book: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid, and make a bracelet to take home with you!
description_web: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid, and make a bracelet to take home with you!

name: Intro to Woodworking, Part A
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: This class is two half-days, Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand woodwork, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience. *Youths may attend if accompanied by a parent.*

name: Weaving Twill on a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: Part instruction and part hands-on class. You will learn how to warp a warp-weighted loom, knit heddles and weave variations of twill.
description_web: This is a part-instruction and part hands-on class. You will learn how to warp a warp-weighted loom, knit heddles and weave different variations of twill. I will have a card-weaving demo for the header band and several tabletop looms to practice the different stages of the entire process.
fee_itemization: Fee is for paper handout. You can download the material from here: https://www.academia.edu/39931576/Weaving_twill_on_a_Warp_Weighted_Loom

instructor: Thl Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Pennsic Instrumental Youth Consort
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all pitched and percussion instruments played by musicians ages 12-19.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all pitched and percussion instruments played by musicians ages 12-19. All levels of playing are welcome, though a basic understanding of how to read music for your instrument is required. We will learn between three and five pieces from within SCA period. The Consort will be led by THL Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes, who is also a music teacher in modern life. We will begin rehearsals on Saturday of War Week, though PDFs of the music for performance can be obtained beginning in July by contacting THL Cynthia.

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving, a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Up-gradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
fee_itemization: Sticks, string, & instructions

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: All youth between 6 and 17 are welcome to participate in the daily activities. Instruction and games will vary by day.

name: Make Beautiful Scrolls Using Micography
description_book: Learn about micography and how it was used in manuscripts. We'll work on plotting out designs, and practice what we have learned.
description_web: First we will learn about micography and how it was used in manuscripts. Then we will work on plotting out designs and practice what we have learned to create some art. Will not have handouts available past 10 gentles, but the handout is also online. (If you have lightboards, pencils, and dip pens with a crow nib (or C-6), bringing them would be appreciated, but not necessary. Instructor will have some, but may not be able to cover all participants.)
fee_itemization: $1 - for handout.

name: Parchment Making
description_book: Learn the basics of making parchment in one day.
description_web:
Learn the basics of making parchment for bookbinding and award scrolls in one day. This 6-hour workshop will cover all of the steps, tools, equipment, and some variations on the process from fresh hides to finished sheets. The first part of the class shares techniques with leather and rawhide preparation; the last half is specific to parchment. Be as hands-on or hands-off as you want. We will provide gloves and aprons; you must bring boots or shoes that can be easily washed. Wear mucky clothes. Students who would like to continue working on the project and gain more experience may attend preparation hours on the days before and after class is held.
Sadb Ingen Chonchobair will be the instructor on site.
Abigail Kelhoge's YouTube playlist can be found here: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wy2EeL-1N7I&list=PL55KgesG1cOgCcX85d0bMULiO5v-BxzC4

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre
description_book: Kids ages 5-12, join us in creating & performing, from story book to stage, your very own play! Creative minds + theatrical tools = a fun time!
description_web: For kids ages 5-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Medieval Fan Fiction
description_book: A discussion of how "fan fiction" was produced and used in the Middle Ages; how we can produce it and use it in our Society.
description_web: A discussion of how "fan fiction" was produced and used in the Middle Ages; how we can produce it and use it in our Society. Topics will include the definition of fan fiction, its modern and pre-modern history, plus its techniques and authors. Time permitting, we will attempt our own fan fiction.

name: Opening Up a Can of Worms: Research in the SCA
description_book: If you interested in doing an A&S project but don't know where to start, this is the class for you.
description_web: Does research and documentation seem overwhelming? Are you interested in doing an A&S project but don't know where to start? This class will teach you how to find, evaluate, and document the sources you need to research and complete an A&S project in any category.

name: Robin Hood
description_book: A class on the context and origins of Robin Hood, and maybe some of the early stories.
description_web: A class on the context and origins of Robin Hood, and maybe some of the early stories.

name: Making an Italian Renaissance Chemise
description_book: Instructions and walk-through for making an Italian Renaissance chemise. Includes a look at both pleating and gathering.
description_web: Instructions and walk-through for making an Italian Renaissance chemise. Includes a look at both pleating and gathering.
fee_itemization: $2 for printed handout.  20 printouts will be available

instructor: Mistress Dorigen of the Grey Gate
name: Writing a Sonnet
description_book: An overview of the form and a group exercise in writing a sonnet.
description_web: An overview of the form and a group exercise in writing a sonnet.The sonnet is a versatile building block for period poetry. We will examine the history and examples of the form and work on a group effort at sonnet writing.

name: Meet the Board and Corporate Officers
description_book: Members of the Board of Directors and Corporate Staff answer your Society-level questions. All are welcome.
description_web: Have questions about life at the Society level? Wonder what it would be like to hold such a position? Members of the Board of Directors and Corporate Staff will be available to answer these questions and more. All are welcome.

name: Sunk Cost Support
description_book: A short lecture and discussion of how we may be feeling about changing our SCA involvement after pandemic. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Sunk Cost is an economic idea that can be used to evaluate our SCA experiences. Have you found yourself questioning or wishing to change your level of SCA involvement? You're not alone. Sunk Cost Support is a community of people who are reconsidering how, and to what degree they're involved in our hobby. Please join us if any part of this rings true for you. There is also a Facebook group and quarterly calls where we discuss different facets of what goes into our decisions to change our participation. Contact info for these will be shared during the class. **Age 18+.**

name: Effing Thomas Mêlée Experiment Extravaganza
description_book: We are going to try and do some mêlée scenarios that mimic traditional war points, with the rapier spears, in a low-stakes-for-fun experiment.
description_web: We are going to try and do some mêlée scenarios that mimic traditional war points, with the rapier spears, in a low-stakes-for-fun experiment.
fee_itemization: N/A

name: *Seishin-ryū Chadō Okeiko*: Tea Ceremony Workshop
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 
*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 
If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan. Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.
There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like. There is some controversy over just how old they are. Today, men use slightly larger *fukusa* than women do. Further, men always use purple *fukusa* and women typically only use purple *fukusa* after they have become senior instructors. Regardless, here are purchase options. (1) You can always try ebay. (2) You can order online from any of several tea supply stores in Japan through rakuten.co.jp. (3) You can order one from a fellow in Portland http://www.teadogu.com/fukusa.html. (Yes, they really are that expensive.) I will try to pick up a couple of loaners (I currently have one) between now and Pennsic. Regardless, the fan is the symbol of the guest, and the *fukusa* is the symbol of the host in the world of tea.
fee_itemization: This class will include a multi-page printed handout.

name: *Canary* with **No** Training Wheels
description_book: *Canary* dance structure, basic steps and combinations, and making your solos. Improvised does not mean unrehearsed!
description_web: *Canary* dance structure, basic steps and combinations, and making your solos. Improvised does not mean unrehearsed! Nothing difficult, just multiple options. Feel free to wear stompy boots!

name: Discover Calligraphy for Teens
description_book: Here is an opportunity to learn the basics of calligraphy using a dip pen with ink! (Ages 13-17)

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. **Bring chairs.**
description_web: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class. **Please bring chairs.**

location: Pennsic Fiber Arts Pavilion Atlantian Royal Encampment/easement (Pennsic Fiber Arts Pavilion Atlantian Royal Encampment/easement)
name: Cold Water Dyeing
description_book: Hands-on beginning dye class. Experiment with three period dyes and several mordants. Modern safety precautions will be followed. Bring chair. **18+**
description_web: A hands-on beginning dye class where we will experiment with three period dyes and several mordants. Madder, cutch, and walnut will be the dyes used. We will go over fiber preparation, mordants, and a little bit of history on the three dyes. This class will have homework, as it is not practical to watch a cold water dye project come to fruition. You will end class with the materials to create a small embroidery. I recommend wearing older clothing. Masking will be required for both Covid safety and particulate concerns. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: Wool yarn for embroidery; dye and mordant; handout

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Choir.

name: Toddler Playgroup (Under 4)
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.
description_web: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.

name: Known World Rapier Cadet Tournament
description_book: Open to those sponsored by a person with a rapier peerage or high level award for rapier. Format: traditional double elimination tourney.
description_web: Come join rapier combatants from across the Known World in the Pennsic Annual Cadet Tournament. This tournament will be open to those who are sponsored by a person who has a rapier peerage or kingdom’s high award for rapier. This includes the Order of Defense, Order of the White Scarf, Order of the Bronze Ring, Order of the Golden Rapier, The Dragon's Steel, The Order of Thorbjorn's Hammer, The Order of the Queen's Blade, The Meridian Order of the Blade, or equivalent award. A person may sponsor more than one entrant. Sponsors will be required to sign in their cadet or send a letter of entrance. If you need a sponsor, we will find one for you. This will be a traditional double elimination tournament. Each bout shall be fought to a single kill. Double kills will be re-fought one time. On the second double kill, “Dead is dead!” The finals will be fought best two out of three. All bouts shall be fought with default Pennsic rules.

name: Ealdormere Youth Fun Shoot
description_book: Ealdormere welcomes the children and youth (under 16) of the Known World to join us on the archery range for a fun shoot.
description_web: Ealdormere welcomes the children and youth (under 16) of the Known World to join us on the archery range for a fun shoot. Children and youth will shoot in cohorts with coaching from Marshals and MiTs. Prizes for every participant.

name: Youth Axe-Throwing Instruction
description_book: Teaching youth 5-12 to throw axes. Focus on range rules and technique. Parent must accompany child per Pennsic rules. Tournament later in the week.
description_web: Teach youth, ages 5-12, to throw axes. This class will focus on Pennsic range rules, range etiquette and technique. There will be time for the children to throw and there will be loaner equipment available from the instructor. Parent must accompany the child per Pennsic rules. There will be a youth tournament later in the week.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: Armored Woods Battle
description_book: 1 battle, 90 minutes, full resurrection.
description_web:
 1 battle, 90 minutes, full resurrection.
 3 stationary banners (flip stick) placed evenly between start lines. **NO MOBILE BANNERS.** Each check worth 1 point.
 3 time checks 30, 60, and 90 minutes. Each check will be +/- 2 minutes from the noted time. Exact variant of time check should be generated by the marshalate prior to the start of the battle and not revealed to combatants.
 All holds except medical are assumed to be local and do not stop the clock. Medical holds are general. General holds stop the clock.
 East Kingdom and allies will start on the far side. Midrealm and allies will start on the near side.
 No combat archery or siege.
 Resurrect at the starting lines.
 At final check. Fighters within 9-foot radius of the banners will fight to last man standing.

name: NOT You Billy: Elizabethan Theatre Beyond the Bard
description_book: Shakespeare is not the only playwright to know from the 16th-C English stage. Explore other notable figures of Elizabethan Theatre.
description_web: Shakespeare is not the only playwright to know from the 16th-C English stage. Explore other notable figures of Elizabethan Theatre.

name: Archery Populace War Points
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for War Points.
description_web: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for War Points.

name: Medieval Herbed Beer: *Gruit* Demystified.
description_book: The history of Low Country *gruit* beer, as found in contemporary sources. Detailed information on ingredients and likely brewing techniques. **21+.**
description_web: The history of Low Country *gruit* beer, as found in contemporary sources. Includes detailed information on ingredients and plausible brewing techniques. Historic *gruit* beer is quite a different beer from modern herbal *gruit* ale. This class will explore the factual history of this exciting and unusual beer, as well as the dangers of assumptions in brewing research. **Age 21+.**
fee_itemization: printing costs, toner

name: Viking Wire Weave Basics
description_book: Viking wire weave is a period-correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. I will show you how to get started.
description_web: Viking wire weave is a period-correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. Also known as trichinopoly or Viking Knitting, there is archaeological evidence for wire chains constructed using “circular plaiting” in Viking burials and treasure hoards dating as early as the 8th century to as late as the 12th century. Come learn with the Mistress of Wire herself! You will learn how to make a *sextapus* to hold your chain in place, a basic 6-loop pattern, draw plate techniques, and how to finish the ends to add a clasp.
fee_itemization: Copper "sextapus" $.50, wooden dowel $.50, draw plate $1, craft wire $2, end cones $2.50, clasp $1.50

name: Upon The Hem: Finishing Your Skirt in Late Period
description_book: An overview of different ways to finish the edges of skirts. Reviews techniques and explores which methods were used when, where, and on what.
description_web: Hemming wasn't straightforward for late period women's gowns. This class will explore all the different ways the bottom edge of a skirt or dress could be finished, using extant examples wherever possible. This class will include discussion of how to do each hem treatment, plus which would mostly likely be used in various clothing applications, with different fabrics, for different social classes, etc.
fee_itemization: No fees

name: Decorated Veils
description_book: A visual trip through veil fashion; then pick up needle, thread and beads and decorate your veil.
description_web: Do you get tired of a plain veil? Did you know that veils were decorated? We will start with a visual trip through the history of medieval veils followed by a hands-on workshop where you will learn how to create a rolled hem and then how to add simple beading, or for those interested in a more complicated embellishment, the art of Turkish *Oya*. $20 "material fee" covers 1 yard of 100% linen, beads, sewing needles and thread, cotton crochet thread and embroidery needle. Please bring your own fabric scissors.
fee_itemization: $20: 1 yd Linen 3.8 oz $10; Assorted Seed Beads $4; Sewing Needles and thread $1 and cotton crochet thread and embroidery needles $5

name: English Poetry: The Nuts and Bolts
description_book: Detailed breakdown of the system of accents and rhymes in Early Modern English poetry, 1485-1603.
description_web: For readers and writers of poetry, the system of accents and rhymes in Early Modern English poetry, 1485-1603. We’ll take apart some period examples and define all the jargon. When we’re done, you’ll be better equipped to write your own poems in these forms, appreciate beauty and meaning of poems of that period, and read them aloud with confidence.

name: Divination by Sortilege One: Casting of Lots
description_book: Divination by sortilege: Interpretation of randomized symbols, such as tossed coins, runes, dice, and bibliomancy. Ethics of fortunetelling.
description_web: Divination by Sortilege, or interpretation of randomized objects, such as coins, bones, dice, runes, cards, pages of books. We will demonstrate and test many of these systems, calling on them each to answer a question from the class. Several of the systems we will explore are new to this class, researched over the pandemic, so if you've attended before, it's time to come back. Stay for Part Two, divination with cards, including tarot.

name: The Mary Rose: Ship and Shipwreck
description_book: Learn about the history and archeology of Henry VIII's flagship that sank in 1545 and was raised in 1982.
fee_itemization: Paper, ink

name: Intro to Combat Archery
description_book: An introducton to the world of SCA Combat Archery taught by the East Kingdom's Deputy Earl Marshal for CA.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to give Combat Archery a try? Are you a Combat Archer who wants to learn as much as you can about our little niche? Are you heavy fighter who wants to learn how to fight with or against Combat Archers? Then this is the class for you. Come see kenarri Hrafn Briedthskeggr, the East Kingdom Deputy Earl Marshal for Combat Archery, discuss rules, equipment at tactics, as well as answer any questions you may have on the subject.

name: Silverwing's "Laws": The Dream We Share
description_book: A look at some of the "laws" (observations, really) that inform the social structure of the SCA.
description_web: The SCA is rich in traditions, and, some would say, filthy with laws and bureaucracy. Where did some of these ideas spring from, and what do they really mean? We'll explore the foundations of these concepts, and examine some of the "norms" that help define our social group.

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 6, through and including Thursday, Aug. 11, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 6, through and including Thursday, Aug. 11, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Courtesan Persona 101 - CCt
description_book: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA. **Age 18+.**
description_web: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA. People of all ages **over 18** and all genders welcome. We will be discussing how to speak and act like an elite sex worker and how to handle a number of situations you might find yourself in while in persona at events. For a list of content warnings or any further information, please contact Ginevra at ginevrafiammettadisilvestri@gmail.com.

name: Dance Movement for Period Dancers
description_book: A practice session for dance movement associated with various period genres, with couple and group improvisation activities.

name: EK Blacksmith Guild Meeting and Panel
description_book: The Blacksmiths' Guild will hold a short meeting followed by a panel. This is for Guild members only.
description_web: The Blacksmiths' Guild will hold a short meeting followed by a panel for Guild members only. This is a chance for Guild members to submit their work to the panel for review as part of the ranking process. Non-members are welcome to attend our Blacksmithing Roundtable Q&A scheduled in the afternoon of the same day.

name: Children's Bead Bracelets
description_book: Children will learn to make a simple bead bracelet using wood, glass, and ceramic beads.
description_web: Children will learn to make a simple bead bracelet using wood, glass, and ceramic beads.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Scribal Things I Know Now That I Wish I Knew Then
description_book: Simple new scribal tips and tricks I know now that I wish I knew when I started.

name: Introduction to *Commedia*
description_book: Are you curious about "those *commedia* performers?" Join Lady Avelina del Dolce for the an introductory *commedia* class!
description_web: You may see us perform at the Performing Arts Amphitheater and Pavilion at Pennsic, SCA events, feasts, and parties. So, are you curious about "those *commedia* performers?" This class will cover the basics of *commedia dell'arte* to prepare for Iron *Commedia*. Students in this class will learn about the characters and then will have a chance to do various character development exercises. You don't want to miss the foolish fun!

name: Frying Pan Bread and Pastries
description_book: A demonstration of a period flatbread recipe and two period pastry recipes, all of which can be made in a frying pan over your campfire.
description_web: A demonstration of a period flatbread recipe and two period pastry recipes, all of which can be made in a frying pan over your campfire. The flatbread is 10th-century Middle Eastern; the pastries are both 13th-century Andalusian. The class will be taught in persona.

name: Celtic Textiles & Women’s Dress of Central Europe
description_book: Discussion of textiles, period iconography, dress accessories, and garments for women in Iron Age Central Europe.
description_web: Analysis of textiles from the Iron Age in Central Europe, along with information on dress accessories, period iconography and burial practices, this class aims to help make informed choices for crafting women’s dress in the Late Hallstatt and Early La Tene periods.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to "Gypsy" Persona
description_book: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: Bardic Symposium 2: Bardic & the Post-Covid World
description_book: The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for discussions for the Bardic Community.
description_web:
Bardic and the Post-Covid World:
Bardic was one of the few SCA activities that found ways to thrive during the pandemic. The ability to have online bardic activities helped to expand our community and attract many new performers. As we begin to discover our "new normal," how do we hold onto those positive changes? How do we re-enter the in-person bardic scene and integrate it with the online one? What bardic lessons have we learned - both as a community and an inter-kingdom subculture?

name: Divination by Sortilege Two: Cards Including Tarot
description_book: Cartomancy, fortune-telling with regular 52 and tarot decks. Attending Part One recommended but not required.
description_web: Cartomancy. Imagine a storybook filled with pages and pictures, but with the spine removed, and the pages reordered by Dame Fortuna to tell each person's life story. That book is a deck of cards, and this class will teach you how to read it. Fortune-telling theory and practice with regular and tarot decks. We will end class with a miraculous demonstration of the seer's art.

name: The Viborg Shirt Seams (11th-C Danish *Skyrta*)
description_book: This class will review the cut and construction seams used to recreate the linen shirt found near Viborg Søndersø, Denmark.
description_web: The Viborg shirt is the only linen shirt from the Viking age (~11th C) found in Scandinavia or Europe in such good condition. The shirt has 10 pattern pieces and uses 8 different seam types. This class will discuss the find, examine a recreation and work through samples of the 8 different seam types. This is a combination show-and-tell with some hands-on sewing of samples.
fee_itemization: Printed handout, linen, thread, needle.

name: Pennsic Tips and Tricks Things I Wish I'd Known
description_book: Fifty tips and tricks I wish I'd known the first time I came to Pennsic, from joining an encampment to navigating with Google Maps on my phone.
description_web: Fifty tips and tricks I wish I'd known the first time I came to Pennsic. For example, single camping is great, but next time, join an encampment. Use Google Maps on your phone to navigate the streets of Pennsic. Wrap your flashlight in glow-tape so you can find it in the dark. And there's nothing like a RAV charger to keep your phone and the kids' electronic games charged through all of Pennsic.

name: *Petits Vriens*: Two Different Ways!
description_book: Come try two different versions of *Petits Vriens*, one for three people and the other for three couples! All levels welcome and catered to!
description_web: Come try two different versions of *Petits Vriens*, one for three people and the other for three couples! All levels welcome and catered to!

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert, Thursday, War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella* with Deonna von Aachen. We will rehearse 2-3 pm Sunday, August 7, through Wednesday, August 10. The performance will be part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: *Il Titolo Provvisorio* Dress Rehearsal
description_book: ITP Dress Rehearsal.
description_web: ITP Dress Rehearsal.

name: The Walking Dum: Post-Apocalypse
description_book: Begintermediate and pre-advanced rhythms to get beyond the basic rhythms. Different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
This is a begintermediate/pre-advanced  drumming class. Learn rhythms beyond the usual that you hear all the time. Class alternates between odd and even count rhythms. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Samai* (10/8), *Chaka* (6/8), *Curcuna (Jurjuna)* (6/8), others as time permits.
Day 2- *Karsilama* (9/8), *Laz* (7/8), reverse-*Laz* (7/8), others as time permits.
Day 3- *Samai* (10/8), *Chaka* (6/8), *Curcuna (Jurjuna)* (6/8), others as time permits.
Day 4- *Karsilama* (9/8), *Laz (7/8)*, reverse-*Laz* (7/8), others as time permits.

name: *Tengwar* 2: Discussion and Practice
description_book: Practice reading and writing English using the phonetic English mode of the *Tengwar* writing system developed by JRR Tolkien.
description_web:
Intended as a follow up session to *Tengwar* 1, but all are welcome. Discuss and practice reading and writing English using the phonetic English mode of the *Tengwar* writing system developed by JRR Tolkien. While the *Tengwar* have their origins in 20th-century fiction, learning to read and write in a new way can help a modern literate scribe connect with a medieval scholar's experience learning their letters as an adult, and struggling to fit a Latin alphabet to their native tongue.

Bring your homework from Tengwar 1, or anything you want to try transcribing.

name: Iron *Commedia*: Creating a New 16th-Century Play
description_book: We will cast and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premiere at the Performing Arts Amphitheater that same day!
description_web: If you've ever laughed at the zany antics of improvisational *commedia dell'arte*, if you just love improvisation or if you want to challenge yourself and try something new, come to Iron *Commedia*! Open to all participants, Iron *Commedia* is not a competition – it is a group challenge where we will craft, cast, and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premiere at the Performing Arts Amphitheater that same day!

name: How to Be a Local Herald
description_book: What does a local herald do and how does he or she do it? A discussion of what it all means by a 20-year veteran of the job.
description_web: So you were just elected -- or just got stuck -- as herald for your group. What do you do now? I've been a group herald for some twenty years. I've documented names, helped design arms, and watched them go through the registration process. I got to shout at events and in libraries (during demos, of course) and helped with a couple of baronial and royal courts. I did the "intros" for fighters, and I worked on my shire's order of precedence. And I'll tell you how to do all that and keep reasonably (?) sane in the process.
fee_itemization: printing costs

name: Introduction to *The Tale of Genji*
description_book: Brief introduction to *The Tale of Genji*, the first novel in the world, written by Lady Murasaki Shikibu sometime in the 11th century in Japan.
description_web: The *Tale of Genji* (*Genjimonogatari*) is the first novel in the world, written by Lady Murasaki Shikibu sometime in the 11th century in Japan. It is a colorful glimpse into the world of the Heian Imperial Court full of romance, political intrigue, kidnappings, and murders by wandering spirits.

name: A Game of "Hide the Distaff": The Distaff Gospels
description_book: In the 1460s, a clerk sat down for six nights with local women during their nightly spinning circle and recorded their wisdom. **18+ for ribaldry!**
description_web: In 1460-something France, during the dark period between Christmas and Candlemas, a clerk sat down for six nights with local women during their nightly spinning circle and recorded their wisdom.
