description_book: Ways to personalize a scroll, the fine art of scribal spying and what to do when your assignment doesn’t have a social media presence.

name: Children's Crusade, Part One: The Pied Piper
description_book: A brief history of the Children's Crusade in 1212 and my rendition of the Grimms' tale, the Pied Piper of Hamelin.
description_web: A brief history into the origins of the Children's Crusade in 1212 and the independent crusade-like mobilization of poor and impoverished folk (and/or youth) as led by Stephen of Cloyes and Nicholas of Cologne, in efforts to create a second Latin kingdom in the holy land of Jerusalem; and a personal rendition of Grimms' tale of the Pied Piper of Hamelin, by myself, WarDon Necu Hawke.

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: Making It Real
description_book: Have you ever had a “Magic Moment” at an event? This class is intended to be a lively discussion of how to foster those moments at events.
description_web: Have you ever had a “Magic Moment” at an event? They are rare, but precious. The instructor, a longtime participant, will lead a discussion of how event design, planning, and activities can help give more people the Magic Moments that keep many of us coming back.

name: Mughal Women's Clothing of the 16th Century
description_book: An overview of fashion worn by women of the Mughal Empire, from early days of Babur to the heyday of Akbar, as viewed from Akbar's Nama commissions.
description_web: An overview of fashion worn by women of the Mughal Empire, from early days of Babur to the heyday of Akbar, as viewed from Akbar's Nama commissions - the *Baburnama*, the *Humayunama* and the *Akbarnama*. Focus is on extant miniatures found in museums around the world.

name: Bling Out Your Veils
description_book: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. All supplies and veil will be supplied.
description_web: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. Ten kits available. Other students may watch the class; there will be extra handouts. If you would like to attend, you can bring your own veil and beads, and take the class.
fee_itemization:
fabric for veil
beads
beading needle
thread

name: Overview: The Bara Method from *The Modern Maker*
description_book: The Bara notation is a way of expressing sewing patterns using physical math with proportional measurements. It's mind blowing.
description_web:
The Bara notation shows up on Alcega and a couple of other period tailoring manuals. Matthew Gnagy dug into the topic in his books *The Modern Maker*, Vols. 1 and 2.
The Bara notation is a way of expressing pattern in a simple way where the measurements on the pattern are represented as a proportion of a measurement of the person who will eventually wear the garment. It's mind blowing.

We will review *The Modern Maker* books and discuss why they are appropriate to an SCA setting. Then we’ll delve into the Bara method as laid out in these books: what it is, how to use it, how it was probably used historically. Then we'll walk through drafting the bodice of a woman's kirtle which would be appropriate to the late-15th to early-16th century England, France, Spain, Brittany, and Flanders.

name: Amber: Northern Gold
description_book: Make-and-take class. Learn how to take a raw piece of amber and begin to shape and polish it while we have casual discussion on historical relevance.
description_web: Amber has played an important part in history. It was sought after not only for decoration, but also used as a talisman or amulet, used medicinally to treat a variety of ailments, and used as currency for trade. Participants will be taught how to take a raw piece of amber and begin to shape and polish it to bring out the natural unique qualities of each piece of history. While you are busy shaping away, there will be a casual discussion on historical and mythical relevance.
fee_itemization:
raw amber
polishing materials

name: Six Kaftans from the V&A
description_book: A discussion of findings from six kaftans that were viewed during a trip in 2018 to the V&A's "The Clothworkers' Centre." Limit to 10 people.
description_web: A discussion of findings from six kaftans that were viewed during a trip in 2018 to the V&A's "The Clothworkers' Centre." Limit to 10 people.

name: Beginner's Beginning Knitting: Washcloth Edition
description_book: This class discusses the basics of knitting and starts the student knitting a washcloth.
description_web: Learn the basics of knitting from choosing the proper needles to understanding what yarn "weights" mean. The class will then move to casting on for a washcloth and practicing the techniques discussed. We will lay the groundwork for the student to understand the basics, giving them the ability and confidence to continue knitting on their own. Some supplies will be provided, but if the students would like to bring their own, it is recommended for them to bring a single set of needles (size 6, 7, or 8) and a ball of cotton worsted weight yarn. (Sugar & Cream recommended, or any other inexpensive yarn brand.)
fee_itemization: The fee covers the cost of knitting needles and yarn. There may be more sets available, but I am still working on sourcing the materials.

name: So You Want to Have a Jewish Persona
description_book: Advice on creating and enacting a period Jewish persona.
description_web: This is an overview class on creating and enacting a Jewish persona: how to pick a name; what garb is appropriate; what professions could your persona engage in; are there Jewish arts and sciences; and would-be Jewish armory. There'll be a discussion of Jews’ badges and why they shouldn't be worn; period Jewish fighters; and names and opportunities for female Jewish personas.
fee_itemization: The cost is for my printing the multi-page handouts.

name: Latin Reading
description_book: A daily Latin beginner reading class. We will be using Orberg's *Lingua Latina I* (purchase recommended). Handouts available.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

name: Beginning Irish Language
description_book: Learn pronunciation, basic grammar, how to meet and greet, ask a few questions and reply, count, and be polite in the Irish language.
description_web: Ever been stymied by an Irish or Scottish name, phrase, or lyric? Come learn pronunciation, basic grammar, how to meet and greet, ask a few questions and reply, count, and be polite in the Irish language in a fun and relaxed setting.
fee_itemization: Paper handouts of class materials

name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales.

name: Beginner Ball Prep for Casa Bardicci!
description_book: Join in this crash course to prepare you for the afternoon ball at Casa Bardicci! Aimed at inexperienced dancers.
description_web: Join in this crash course to prepare you for the afternoon ball at Casa Bardicci! Aimed at inexperienced dancers, we will go through several easy dances to maximize your enjoyment!

name: Open Crafting Time
description_book: Family Point is open for parent-guided crafts. We will have a craft and instructions, but there will not be a teacher to guide the activity.

name: Period Card Games: *Tarot*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card deck.
description_web: Want to learn what they did with *Tarot* cards in period? Come learn to play *Tarot*, a trick taking card game using a 78-card deck.

name: Roman Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 1st to the 5th centuries, from across the Roman Empire! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Peg Loom Basics
description_book: The tabletop peg loom is a step up from stick weaving.
description_web: The tabletop peg loom, also known as a rake loom, is a step up from stick weaving. The base allows you to do a wider piece. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: loom, yarn & instructions

name: Atlantian Five Person Rapier Tournament
description_book: The pinnacle of small group rapier fighting and strategy. Atlantian mêlée Rules. Maximum of two Masters of Defense per team.
description_web: Join the rapier community for our annual Five Person Rapier Tournament, the pinnacle of small group rapier fighting and strategy. The event will be conducted under Atlantian mêlée rules (to be explained at the event). Maximum of two Masters of Defense allowed per team.

name: Children's Crusade, Part Two: Pied Piper Parade.
description_book: **All call:** Musicians, performers, dancers, parents with children at Pennsic. Join us in celebration and noise as we march our youth to battle.
description_web:
**All call:** Musicians, performers, dancers, and parents with children at Pennsic. The Children's Crusade Parade March is happening and we need you to help make this experience magical for all the youth of the Known World. Come and join us as we march our children in parade column through Pennsic Town to the battlefield and to their War, the children's water battle. Bring your instruments, your rhythm and voice, your water guns even (if you wish to help the adults fight off the horde of heathen children trying to bring holy fun into our lands at noon), and most importantly, your children.

Come join us in celebration and merriment. Let's give our youth and the SCA of tomorrow a battle and celebration that'll live on in their memory for ages.

name: I Feel Pretty and Period
description_book: A discussion of (generally later) period beauty practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What can we safely do."
description_web: A discussion of period skin care and hair care practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What we can safely do." It is no secret that period skin care and hair care recipes often involved mercury, lead and arsenic, but there are also some great recipes and tools that SCAdians can use to further their immersion into their persona.

name: Food Safety for SCA Cooks
description_book: Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.
description_web:
Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event. Students will learn the causes of food-borne illness as well as safe food handling practices related to these:
Preventing Cross Contamination
Controlling Time and Temperature
Good Personal Hygiene
Cleaning and Sanitizing
Planning a Successful Food Event

Whether you are a new event cook, or you and your kitchen staff have been doing this for years, it is important to be up-to-date and knowledgeable about food safety.
fee_itemization: $2 for class handout

name: Text to Telling
description_book: How do you go from source text to a powerful presentation with six months to prepare? What if you have only three days?
description_web:
I discuss a simple (if time-intensive) process for taking source material and turning it into a powerful performance, using as case studies two of my pieces.  
One, "Gawain and the Green Knight" (which I have performed - in full kit - for the Brit Lit classes at the college where I work), was worked up over a period of six months. It's a 30-minute prose rendition of the famous tale of knightly virtues, attempted seduction, and sorcery. Here's the first part: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mG4MnMZwtM
The second, "The Death of The Cid," was cooked up *literally overnight*, but resulted in me being named as Queen's Champion the next weekend. I performed it at Pennsic, where a Crown Prince sought me out afterward to thank me.

name: Maple Sugar: The Pursuit of Sweet
description_book: Native American historic relevance to maple sugar collection, plus how to collect and process maple syrup on your own. Sampling may be available.
description_web: Our constant search of sweet has had people look for different ways to fill that need. Across the big pond, Native Americans have been processing maple sugars. Historic relevance and past practice will be discussed as well as how to collect and process your own maple sugar with only a few trees in your yard. Everything from materials, tree identification, collection, processing methods and storage will be discussed. Hardware and product samples will most likely be shared.
fee_itemization: cost of maple product samples

name: When in Rome: The Odd and the Risqué
description_book: The weird little quirks of Rome and some very bizarre facts. Newly updated for 2022!
fee_itemization: A multi-page handout with color images.

name: Latin Reading II
description_book: This is a continuation of the first week class. We will be continuing from Orberg.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

name: Advanced Ball Prep for the Casa Bardicci Ball
description_book: Come and review a host of dances to prepare for the afternoon dancing at Casa Bardicci! Aimed at experienced or adventuresome dancers!
description_web: Come and review a host of dances to prepare for the afternoon dancing at Casa Bardicci! Aimed at experienced or adventuresome dancers!

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Navigating the SCA for LGBTQIA+ - CCt
description_book: Resources and information, plus answering questions for those who are part of, or related to, the LGBTQIA+ and transgender community. **18+ only.**
description_web: In this class I will share my experiences in my 20+ years in the SCA as a queer person with friends and family all over the rainbow. This is not a comprehensive class but I will provide resources and answer questions in order to ease any concerns or point out pitfalls in this great game of ours. I don't know everything, but should be able to point out resources to answer questions I cannot. We are a big umbrella Society and navigating it can be intimidating. Come join us and know you are not alone. **Age 18+ only.**

name: Beginner Dance: English Country
description_book: Suitable for beginners, we will learn 3-4 awesome English Country Dances. Choices dependent on number of participants.
description_web: Suitable for beginners, we will learn 3-4 awesome English Country Dances. We will start with basic steps and then my first favorite dance, *Rufty Tufty*.  Additional dance choices will be dependent on the number of participants.

name: Beginner Sewing: Dragon Stuffies
description_book: Learn sewing basics and create a small felt dragon stuffy to keep.

name: Children's Water Battle
description_book: Assault the Fort! The Children's Water Battle is open to children 6 - 12. Bring your own water weapons (no catapults). Dress for mess. Water provided.
description_web: Assault the Fort! The Children's Water Battle is open to children 6 - 12. Bring your own water weapons (squirt guns, water balloons, etc. No catapults; they hurt!). Dress for mess and mud. Water and some balloons provided. Each participant must be in the charge of a responsible adult. Treasure provided to each participant. Extra marshals are always wanted; marshals do not necessarily get wet.

name: Middle Eastern Melodies
description_book: Learn some different Middle Eastern Melodies that aren’t part of the typical Pennsic repertoire.

name: PA Afternoon Series: *Commedia* Experience
description_book: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style.
description_web: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style (movement, vocalization, express funny ideas). Experienced actors/directors from several well-known *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes will guide you if you're new, or give you free advice that's definitely worth the price to veteran performers!

name: Russian Calligraphy
description_book: Medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet. Appropriate for all calligraphy skill levels.
description_web: Medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet. There will also be a handout for Russian-style English alphabet. The hands-on portion of the class is limited to 15 people. Please bring your calligraphy supplies if you have them. I will have a limited number of loaner nibs and/or markers and paper.

name: Ragnarök and the Death of Baldr
description_book: God is dead! Or at least a god is dead. How does a god die? And what happens next? Let's talk about Baldr!
description_web: God is dead! Or at least a god is dead. How does a god die? And what happens next? We’ll talk about the death of Baldr and Baldr’s dream and what these stories tell us about North mythology as a whole.

name: Quadratic Equations: New Method with Period Roots
description_book: Learn a new method for solving quadratic equations that has roots in period math.
description_web: In 2019, a mathematician invented a new method for solving quadratic equations. He found parts of the solution method were known by ancient Babylonian and Renaissance mathematicians. In this class we will learn Loh's method and the period math it is based on, and compare his version with other period and modern methods. This class is suitable for anyone who has taken high school Algebra I.
fee_itemization: $1 for handout photocopy costs.

name: How to Build a Germanic Lyre
description_book: A description of how to build an early period musical instrument.

name: Neurodiversity in the SCA
description_book: Join me in a discussion on how the Society has been built in a way to provide a safe port in a storm of non-acceptance, and how it continues to do so.
description_web: Join me in a discussion on how the Society has been built in a way to provide a safe port in a storm of non-acceptance, and how it provides help and growth by the way it functions.

name: Vinegar: Anti-Brewing
description_book: How to make homemade vinegar, plus a tasting of various vinegars and alcohol. **Age 21+**.

name: Known World Squires' Tourney
description_book: Open only to those armoured fighters who are in fealty to a member of the SCA Order of the Chivalry.
description_web: Open only to those armoured fighters who are in fealty to a member of the SCA Order of the Chivalry.

name: Dancing in the Villa
description_book: Join us for a magical afternoon ball in the ambiance of Casa Bardicci, accompanied by live music! All levels welcome!
description_web: Join us for a magical afternoon ball surrounded by the ambiance of Casa Bardicci. Live music shall be provided by Musica Tramontana. Some dances will be walked through - all levels welcome!

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Courtesan Patron Roundtable - CCt
description_book: This roundtable will be a discussion on what it means to be a Patron and what one can expect as a sponsor of a Courtesan(s) in the SCA. **Age 18+.**
description_web: This roundtable will be a discussion on what it means to be a Patron and what one can expect as a sponsor of a Courtesan (or Courtesans) in the SCA. **Age 18+.**

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian
description_book: No experience needed! Come and learn some of the easier (and popular) dances from the 15th-century Italian repertoire. Bring both of your left feet.

name: Constellations and Crafts
description_book: Learn the constellations by hearing their legends and recreating their patterns in crafts.
description_web: Learn the constellations by hearing their legends and recreating their patterns in crafts.

name: Beginner Sewing for Tweens: Dragon Stuffies
description_book: Learn sewing basics and create your own personal dragon (ages 9-14).

name: Children's Water Battle: Clean-Up
description_book: After the battle, the clean-up begins. Adult or older teen assistance always welcome.

location: Gunnery Point on Mt Eislinn (Top of Mt Eislinn)
name: Period Black Powder Firearms: Safety and Handling
description_book: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Powder and match supplied by teacher. **Ages 18+.**
description_web: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Owners of period arms are requested/encouraged to bring them and help with coaching newer shooters. Powder and match are supplied by instructor. **Ages 18+.** Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info. Under 18 may watch, but cannot handle arms or powder.

name: German Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 14th -16th centuries in the Dutch German Style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble
description_book: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities. We will hold three rehearsals to prepare for a brief concert Thursday of War Week.
description_web: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities are invited to participate in this ensemble. Join us in having fun and making music together! We will meet for three rehearsals: Monday - Wednesday; dress rehearsal Thursday. More information and music on Facebook. Concert, 6 pm, Thursday, 8/11, in the PA Tent. Age limit: 12 and up. A limited number of soprano and alto recorders are available for loan. If you play more than one instrument, bring them all. Please bring a music stand if you have one; loaners available. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder. Sheet music (intermediate to advanced) will be provided. $2 for music packet, or free PDFs can be found on the Facebook group: Known World Recorder Ensemble. Email the instructors: THL Jolicia atte Northclyfe  (washington.julie@gmail.com),  and The Honorable Lady Siri Toivosdotter (JoniSyngs@gmail.com).
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: Build a Rapier Tower IKEA style
description_book: Learn to build a sturdy structure for rapier fighting that flat packs.
description_web: Tired of using hay bales for the corners of walls and having "That Talk" with your opponent because the shot breached the air above the hay bale? Have you been a marshal with a staff trying to be the corner and praying "Not the Face!"  Well, in this class you will learn how easy it is to build a flat pack rapier tower that will be sturdy enough to lean up against, easy to take down and easy on your storage space. Class handouts will include cutting diagrams, part lists and tips on construction for hand tool and power tool users.

name: Two-Handed Weapon Tournament
description_book: This is a tournament of two-handed axe throwing.
description_web: This is a tournament of two-handed axe throwing.

name: Rose Happy Hour
description_book: Rose Happy Hour. **Age 21+.**
description_web: All Roses, sitting Crowns, sitting Consorts, and sitting Principality Consorts are welcome to share stories and company. **Age 21+.**

name: Painting Your Period Canvas Tent
description_book: Want to paint your tent? Painted it already and want to commiserate with others? Come talk tent decoration and share your experiences!
description_web:
Want to paint your tent? Painted it already and want to commiserate with others? Come talk tent decoration and share your experiences!
The instructor has suffered through the joy of painting three period tents and will share all her trials and tribulations so you can avoid her mistakes!

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Norman Fashion in the 12th Century
description_book: Examine styles of dress, accessories, jewelry, and hairstyles for men and women, rich and poor, formal and daily wear, as documented in surviving art.
description_web: Examine styles of dress, shoes, accessories, jewelry, and hair for men and women, rich and poor. Also includes formal and daily wear as documented in surviving art and contemporary accounts from the 12th century. Includes a discussion of fashion differences between Anglo-Normandy, Franco-Normandy, and Sicily-Normandy. Full color handout will be made available online.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus* Rehearsals
description_book: *Chorulus Pennsicus*: Audition-only choir. Rehearsals are held at Camp Lochmere on the Serengeti. Auditions for Pennsic 50 are scheduled in THING.
description_web: Rehearsals for *Chorulus Pennsicus* Pennsic 49. Audition-only select choir. Previous choral experience required. Rehearsals are in Camp Lochmere, N-18. Auditions for Pennsic 50 CP are scheduled. Check THING for further details.

name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: I host an open 12-Step meeting at 4:00 pm daily in my camp in EO7, Denys the Decadent's Camp.
description_web: This is an open 12-Step meeting open to all who are looking for a 12-Step meeting to attend for on-site support.

name: Known World Players Pit Ensemble Rehearsal
description_book: The Known World Players pit musicians will hold a rehearsal for *Wyrd Sisters.*
description_web: The Known World Players pit musicians will hold a rehearsal for this year's production of *Wyrd Sisters.*

name: KWP Auditions:  *Romeo and Juliet* for Pennsic 50
description_book: Come audition for one the Bard's most memorable pieces to be performed under the stars. All ability levels welcome.
description_web: Come audition for one the Bard's most memorable pieces to be performed under the stars. All ability levels welcome. We are very interested in having teens play the teen roles of Romeo, Juliet, Tybalt, etc., with parent's permission. Please have a relevant monologue of 2 minutes or less ready. The audition will also include reading selected scenes and simple choreography for the roles which include fight scenes. Be prepared to stay for the entire time block and wear clothes that you can move in.

name: Middle Eastern Clothing, Design, and Inspiration
description_book: We'll discuss the design and construction of basic Middle-Eastern garb using primarily Ottoman Turkish sources.
description_web: We'll discuss the design and construction of basic Middle-Eastern garb using primarily Ottoman Turkish sources. We will look at examples from within the SCA time period through the “Tulip Period” of Turkish art, approximately 150 years later. Extensive primary source material will be available for viewing.

name: Magic and Mysticism in *Commedia* Scenarios
description_book: Haunting by "ghosts," magic tricks, and palmistry... Join us for an engaging discussion about fantastical elements within Flaminio Scala's scenarios.
description_web: Haunting by "ghosts," magic tricks, and palmistry... Did you know that certain *commedia* scenarios by Flaminio Scala incorporate these fantastical elements and more? Join THL Avelina del Dolce for an engaging class about the magic and mysticism found in historical *commedia dell'arte* scenarios.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Dancing with a Veil: Performance Track
description_book: A modesty garment or... your dance partner, a veil, especially a silk veil, makes it magical. Bring or borrow a 3-yard rectangle.
description_web: A silk veil is a beautiful and sensuous dance partner; learn to move in harmony with it! Dazzle your audience with an ethereal vision of you and your silk. Learn swoops, swirls, turns, and tricks. This workshop will cover traditional use of the veil in Middle Eastern dance: entrances, illusions and interactions. Bring or borrow a 3-yard rectangle. Looks great in period clothing. Veils are also available for purchase, just ask me ahead of time. I have been teaching bellydance since 2005, studying this artform since 1997.

name: Known World Players Annual Meeting
description_book: KWP's annual meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to hear officer reports and discuss KWP's future.
description_web: The Known World Players annual Guild meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to come share ideas about the company's future, hear officers' annual reports, and discuss future productions.

name: *Noddy*: How to Play
description_book: Before cribbage there was noddy. Learn how to play this 52-card game. Rules based on *Francis Willughby's Book of Games*.
description_web:
"Cribbage is not period!" We have all heard this and it is true. It is first recorded around 1604-1606, but noddy was and is one of the games that cribbage is derived from. Noddy is a faster game that still has a slightly complex scoring set of rules that is easy to learn. Game uses a 52-card deck.

Teacher will have her copy of the book *Francis Willughby's Book of Games* (for geeks to look at) for those interested. Besides learning the rules and playing the game, each player will walk away with a copy of the rule set.
fee_itemization: the rules and playing the game, each player will walk away with a copy of the ruleset

name: Atlantia Royal Court
description_book: The Court of Their Royal Majesties Cuan and Adelhait, 6:00 pm EDT in the Great Hall.
description_web: The Court of Their Royal Majesties Cuan and Adelhait, 6:00 pm EDT in the Great Hall.

name: PA Afternoon Series: Shakespeare Open Mic Night
description_book: Share a Shakespeare monologue, scene, or inspired-by song. First-come, first-perform.
description_web: Do you love Shakespeare? So do we! Come share your favorite Shakespeare monologue, scene, or Shakespeare-inspired song, poem, or scene with the crowd. All are welcome, and performance will be on a first-come, first-served basis.

name: Æthelmearc Tag Team Tournament
description_book: Heavy List and Youth team up for a round robin tournament.
description_web: Heavy List and Youth team up for a round robin tournament.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be *Around the World in 11 Nights*. Eat your heart out, Phileas Fogg!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be *1001 Arabian Nights*. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Midnight Madness Break T(w)een Mixer
description_book: Take a break from the Madness; hang out at Family Point for low-key conversation, snacks and device-charging. **Ages 12-17. Supervision Rules Apply.**
description_web: Take a break from the Madness; hang out at Family Point for low-key conversation, snacks and device-charging. **Ages 12-17. Supervision Rules Apply.**

description_book: Lanea will perform her translations, original works, and covers she adores and will likely press other bards into service.
description_web: Lanea will perform her translations, original works, and covers she adores and will likely press other bards into service.

name: Darkyard Tree Ceremony
description_book: Annual Tree Ceremony held by House Darkyard.
description_web: Annual Tree Ceremony held by House Darkyard.

name: Midnight Madness Glassblowing Demos
description_book: We're heating up the place with our live glassblowing demos where we share our craziest pieces and techniques!
description_web: Historical Glassworks is heating up the place with our live glassblowing demonstrations all evening from 8 pm to midnight, where we share our craziest pieces and techniques! From Renaissance German crackle glass with a modern Mojito twist to intricate Italian canework designs, or even the cup of Heroes and Kings: the Viking Age Claw Beaker! You never know what we'll come up with, manipulating 2000 degrees of molten glass right before your very eyes!

name: Not Your Typical Atlantian Thugs III
description_book: A performance by various bards from the Kingdom of Atlantia.
description_web: Heck, we started a War. You should have seen this coming. The bards of Atlantia...or at least several of them, are back to entertain you!

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Come join us in the Dance Tent for open dancing!

name: Wolgemut in Concert: A Pennsic Celebration
description_book:
ONE NIGHT ONLY
Join the one and only international minstrel's troupe, Wolgemut, for a "Return of Pennsic" musical celebration.
description_web:
ONE NIGHT ONLY
Join the one and only international minstrel's troupe, Wolgemut, for a "Return of Pennsic" musical celebration.

name: *Il Titolo Provvisorio*

description_web: *Il Titolo Provvisorio*'s Pennsic Performance. Come see the lovers, the fighters, and the plot that everyone knows!
