description_web: All-level friendly *vinyasa*; all are welcome from complete beginner to experienced yogi, dancer, fighter, artisan, merchant or royal! Bring your own mat or towel and water, wear easy-to-move-in clothes. Get ready to power up and stretch!

name: Known World Players Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Players: Performing Arts Pavilion.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Players Pennsic 49 production of *Wyrd Sisters* by Terry Pratchett and Stephen Briggs.

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 1 is more linear; *Étude* 2 adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Armored Combat: Morning
description_book: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.
description_web: Youth Armored Combat, all divisions, open sparring.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: The English Language Is a Mess: What Happened?
description_book: A brief linguistic history of Britain.
fee_itemization: $1/handout to cover the cost of printing.

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: Intro to Tablet (Card) Weaving
description_book: Join us for a beginner tablet weaving lesson. We will cover the basic process and begin a weaving project. All materials provided.
fee_itemization:
$2 for 12 tablets
$4 for string

name: Egyptian *Faience*
description_book: Hands-on exploration of the precursor to modern glass; no prior experience required!
description_web:
Come learn about the precursor to modern glass, *faience*! We'll cover a brief history of *faience* followed by hands-on playing with the material. 
This class requires no prior experience in glass-working. Please wear comfortable clothing that you do not mind getting dirty. Class costs include use of all required tools, equipment and safety gear as well as all consumables. Kits will make a large quantity of beads and pendant shapes. Kits can be shared between two people, but usually people end up wanting to play with a full kit themselves.
fee_itemization: Kits will make a large quantity of beads and pendant shapes. Kits can be shared between two people, but usually people end up wanting to play with a full kit themselves.

name: The History and Development of the Houppelande
description_book: A discussion of the history and development of the houppelande, the last universal style in Europe for men and women. Pattern discussion included.
description_web: A discussion of the history and development of the houppelande, the last universal style in Europe for men and women. Pattern discussion included.  From pictorial sources, we will look at the way the houppelande developed and where it headed in each region of Europe. We will look at two different pattern ideas and what makes them each work.
fee_itemization: $7 for a full-color thick handout.  15 handouts available.

name: German Renaissance Smocked Apron
description_book: German Ren smocked apron make-and-take class. Learn to mark, pleat, and smock an apron to go with your German 16th-C clothing. Materials provided.
fee_itemization: Fabric, smocking template, needle, thread

name: Modern Gaming: War Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Humorous Food: The Humors, Food & Medieval Health
description_book: This will be a beginner's class regarding how the humors were associated with different foods and spices in period.
description_web: This will be a beginner's class regarding how the humors were associated with different foods and spices in period. We will cover a condensed history of where the ideas of humors came from and how they were used to classify all foods and spices from the smallest of fruits to fish and other meats.

name: Four-Color Flat Lucet Cord
description_book: We will make a flat cord on the lucet that will have up to 4 colors using bobbins.
description_web: Cord from a lucet can be quite flexible in color and structure. We will be making a flat cord with up to four colors. The threads hang below the lucet on bobbins to keep from getting tangled. Bring your own lucet and bobbins which can be made out of cardboard or foam, or we will have kits for $20 containing both a lucet, fiber and four bobbins.
fee_itemization:
Lucet $15
thread and bobbins $5

name: Show What You Know: An A&S Documentation Primer
description_book: You've got the project, now show your work! We'll cover the what, when, how, and why of creating A&S documentation.
description_web: You've got the project, now show your work! Whether you're preparing for a display or a competition, this class will help you figure out the what, when, how, and why of creating A&S documentation.

name: Sixteen Irish Goddesses
description_book: Sixteen of the major goddesses and demi-goddesses of Irish religion, myth, and literature are discussed, honored and invoked.
description_web: Sure, you know Brigid, but the Irish revered so many other goddesses. Learn their names and hear the stories of fifteen more deities and demi-deities. Come with an open heart. Leave with their names in your hearts and on your lips.

name: Complex *Caroso* for Everyone
description_book: The only way to learn complicated dances is to **dance them**! We'll tackle some of my favorites: *Allegrezza d'Amore* and *Bizzaria d'Amore*.
description_web: The only way to learn complicated dances is to **dance them**! We'll tackle some of my favorites: *Allegrezza d'Amore* and *Bizzaria d'Amore*. If you've taken any dance class before, that's enough to give these a try.

name: Medieval Engineering: Catapults
description_book: Learn about medieval ranged weapons and create your own catapult to hurl marshmallows at our "castle".

name: Silk Painting for Teens
description_book: Learn the basics of silk painting. Create a small piece to take home.
description_web: Learn the basics of silk painting. Create a small piece to take home. Bring a hair dryer if you have one with you.
fee_itemization: Silk stretched hoop. Paint and gutta to be shared by the class.

name: Tapestry Frame Weaving Basics
description_book: A simple introduction to frame weaving such as tapestry, etc.
description_web: A simple introduction to frame weaving such as tapestry, etc. Class limited to 10 looms. Fee covers loom, accessories, yarn and instructions.
fee_itemization: loom, accessories, yarn & instructions

name: Ansteorra Rapier Tournament
description_book:
The Ansteorra Rapier Tournament: Open to All!
Format: Two out of Three Double Elimination (if time allows).
description_web:
The Ansteorra Rapier Tournament: Open to All!
Format: Two out of Three Double Elimination (if time allows). If we have time constraints, the format will be adjusted on site.

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: All youth between 6 and 17 are welcome to participate in the daily activities. Instruction and games will vary by day.

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre
description_book: Kids ages 5-12, join us in creating & performing, from story book to stage, your very own play! Creative minds + theatrical tools = a fun time!
description_web: For kids ages 5-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Learn to Spin on a Drop Spindle
description_book: Learn to spin wool on a drop spindle.
description_web: An informal hands-on class. Come by and learn how to spin wool on a bottom whorl drop spindle. Instructor will have practice spindles and wool that works well for novice spinners. No previous experience necessary. Children are welcome to come and learn to spin too; however, those under 10 may need a parent to assist them. If you wish to keep the drop spindle, you can purchase it for $7.00.
fee_itemization: If you would like to purchase the loaner spindle, the cost is $7.00.

name: Tossing the Bones: Improvisational Storytelling
description_book: There are lots of reasons to toss the bones, but in this class, we use them as a tool for creating oral stories.
description_web: In this class, we will shake things up a bit while using improvisational techniques to create stories from the ground up. A fun class that will shake up your fears about creating stories by yourself or in a group.

name: Children's Doll Meet
description_book: Open to children ages 1-18 years of age. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as we will be making something for your doll.
description_web: Open to children ages 1-18 years of age. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as we will be making something for your doll. All dolls are welcome: ball-jointed, cloth, plastic, porcelain, stuffed, *anime*. Please note: An adult is required to accompany children as per Pennsic handbook, and some crafts may require help.

name: Safely Foraging Local Mushrooms
description_book: Wild mushroom foraging is sexy these days. Gastrointestinal distress is not. Learn from a Pennsylvania-approved mushroomer how to stay safe! **18+.**
fee_itemization: Alys: In descrip, deleted "Come" to add in age limit.

location: Barony of Andelcrag (N07 at Wainrights and Chandlers Road )
name: Sultan of Sweets: Baklava in Period
description_book: Learn the period history, recipes and techniques to create this iconic Ottoman pastry. Hands-on.
description_web: Baklava has been made for centuries but it is only in the last decade that we have uncovered the recipes related to its origins in the Ottoman sphere. Join this class to learn detailed history and redacted recipes from period sources, have a hand at learning the technique to roll your own *yufka* (phyllo), construct and bake in the Ottoman tradition and sample what is created. Both nut and non-nut versions will be made. Depending on weather and available equipment we may or may not bake in live coals.
fee_itemization: Cost of ingredients; nuts, honey, butter, flour, eggs, rosewater, musk, sugar, lentils

name: Armored Bridge Battle
description_book: Battle to be fought 5 times. Each battle will last 15 min with a 10-min break between. Siege and archery in battles 1/2/3.
description_web:
 Battle to be fought 5 times.
 Each battle will last 15 min with a 10-min break between.
 5 Bridges 18’, 18’, 27’, 18’, 18’ separated by 54 feet each. Each bridge is 90 feet in length. Widths are subject to change based on numbers and will be determined at Beer and Brat.
 Siege and archery in battles 1/2/3, only on inner bridges (subject to change per number of bridges).
Archers can go on bridges.
 Thrown weapons will be allowed on all bridges and all rounds.
 Archers may not shoot from bridge to bridge. Land to bridge is allowed.
 Siege Engines will only deploy 50 feet from bridge end (from the mid-point between 2 and 3 bridge and
mid-point between 3 and 4).
 No arrows or siege ammunition will be re-inspected between battles.
 Projectile weapons will only be used on the center 3 bridges.
 Point is awarded by ownership of 3 of 5 bridges. (Or 2 of 3 in the case of reduced # of bridges.)
 All contested bridges will be fought to the last man standing.
 No fighting or kneeling on the hay bales. Incidental contact is ok, but you cannot bear weight on the hay bales.
 Breakouts are allowed.
 Start line for troops is 50 feet from end of bridge. Traditional starting sides.
 All holds are local with no time stop. After breakouts, holds are general. Medical holds are general and
will stop the clock.
 Control of centerline will determine the bridge winner; 9 feet on each side of center line at time will be
fought out.

name: Intermediate Irish Language
description_book: Already speak a little Irish? (Or took the Beginning Irish class?) Join in medieval conversational scenes for fun and games, blessings and curses.
description_web: Expand on your knowledge of Irish, play some games, learn some (appropriate) curses and blessings, some historical and cultural background for your persona with Lady Líadan, an Irish language teacher for Irish Arts Academy of Indianapolis.
fee_itemization: Print-out of class materials.

name: *Seishin-ryū Chadō Okeiko*: Tea Ceremony Workshop
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 
*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 
If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan. Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.
There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like. There is some controversy over just how old they are. Today, men use slightly larger *fukusa* than women do. Further, men always use purple *fukusa* and women typically only use purple *fukusa* after they have become senior instructors. Regardless, here are purchase options. (1) You can always try ebay. (2) You can order online from any of several tea supply stores in Japan through rakuten.co.jp. (3) You can order one from a fellow in Portland http://www.teadogu.com/fukusa.html. (Yes, they really are that expensive.) I will try to pick up a couple of loaners (I currently have one) between now and Pennsic. Regardless, the fan is the symbol of the guest, and the *fukusa* is the symbol of the host in the world of tea.
fee_itemization: This class will include a multi-page printed handout.

name: *Tesara*: Intermediate 15th-C Italian Ribbon Dance
description_book: *Tesara* tells a visual story of weaving cloth through the arrangement of the dancers, patterns, and ribbons.
description_web: *Tesara* is a 15th-century Italian dance by Domenico that tells a visual story of weaving cloth through the arrangement of the dancers, patterns, and the rare use of ribbons. This dance is at an intermediate to advanced level so all participants are expected to be familiar with 15th-century Italian steps. Ribbons will be provided.

name: Yummy Norse Treasure Necklaces
description_book: Learn about Norse treasure necklaces and make your own tasty version! (Gluten-free available!) All ages welcome!
description_web: Learn about Norse treasure necklaces and make your own tasty version! (Gluten-free available!) All ages welcome!

name: Learning Music, Period.
description_book:
Learn the gamut of period music: *Gamma-Ut* to *Ela*, hexachords to *musica ficta*, semibreve to neume.  
We will cover some theory and vocalization.
description_web:
Learn the gamut of period music study: from *Gamma-Ut* to *Ela*, from hexachords to *musica ficta*, from semibreve to neume.  

This class is an introduction to period music study aimed at musicians and would-be musicians. We will cover some theory and a limited amount of vocalization practice.

name: Toddler Playgroup (Under 4)
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.
description_web: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.

name: Pairs Youth Shoot
description_book: Archers will take turns shooting at the cards. When an archer gets an arrow through both cards of a pair, they get a point (a pair).
description_web: Archers will take turns shooting at the cards. When an archer gets an arrow through both cards of a pair, they get a point (a pair). If an archer hits a card already hit by another archer, that arrow doesn’t count. The archer with the most pairs wins the game.

name: Youth Thrown Weapons Tournament
description_book: Youth Thrown Weapons Tournament for ages 5 - 17. There will be scoring in two age groups: 5 - 11, and 12 - 17.
description_web: Youth Thrown Weapons Tournament for ages 5 - 17. There will be scoring in two age groups: 5 - 11, and 12 - 17. This is an annual contest and only axes are used in scoring.

name: Play’s the Thing! Drama and Improv for Ages 5-13
description_book: Dramatic games, musical moments, and improv activities for kids aged 5-13.
description_web: Dramatic games, musical moments, and improv activities for kids aged 5-13. Parents must be in attendance for children under 12 years of age.

name: Archery Populace War Points
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for War Points.
description_web: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for War Points.

name: Granulation
description_book: A class, discussion and demonstration of the technique of solderless soldering used since Etruscan times for granulation and filigree.
description_web: A class, discussion and demonstration of the technique of solderless soldering believed to have been used since Etruscan times for granulation and filigree. Other jewelers who have experimented with it are invited to participate.

name: Sanskrit Theatre of India
description_book: Introduction to the theatre of India in period, with a look at the *Nātyaśāstra*, early plays and playwrights.
description_web: An introduction to Classical Indian Theatre, the oldest form of theatre in Asia. We will look at its origins, underlying philosophy/religious connections, production practices, and several notable personages.

name: Divination: Scrying and Intuition
description_book: Divination via subconscious intuition. Scrying & crystal gazing. Pendulums & dowsing. You know more than you think you do. Hack your own mind.
description_web: A speculative class on divination via access to your own subconscious intuition. We'll explore scrying and vision-seeking as well as physical ideomotor systems such as pendulums and dowsing. Learn to hack your own mind. You know more than you think you know. We will end class with a miraculous demonstration of the seer's art.

name: A Modern Technique for Informing Period Aesthetics
description_book: Use the basics of Symmetry Analysis to analyze period artworks. This method is used on art from Stone Age pottery to tilings in the Alhambra.
description_web: Learn how to use the basics of Symmetry Analysis to analyze a collection of period artworks. This method is used in a variety of academic fields to understand the aesthetic of a collection of artworks sharing a context. It has been used on art from Stone Age pottery to tilings in the Alhambra to modern financial trademarks. It has also been used to fill in gaps where portions of a piece of art have been damaged or lost over time. We will focus on frieze or strip patterns, and discuss single motifs or point patterns. More information on wallpaper and multicolor patterns can be found in the references. This technique uses some basic concepts of geometry that are now taught at the middle school level, so this class should be accessible for ages 13 and up.
fee_itemization: $1 for handout photocopies.

name: Putting Punic Back in Pennsic
description_book: There's more to Carthage than the Punic Wars. Introduction to Punic and Neo-Punic culture, with a focus on dress. Revised and updated 2022.
description_web:
There's more to Carthage than the Punic Wars. Their influence on the Western Mediterranean lingered well past 146 BC. The goal of this class is to provide an overview of Punic and Neo-Punic culture in North Africa and the Western Mediterranean, plus starting points for further research on a variety of topics core to constructing and outfitting an SCA persona or adding historically accurate flavor to a Hannibal-themed event. A substantial portion of this class is on dress. Language and personal names will be covered briefly but are their own class.
Revised and updated 2022. Online resources are available. Please email me: suphunibal@gmail.com .

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 6, through and including Thursday, Aug. 11, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 6, through and including Thursday, Aug. 11, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

name: Open Crafting Time
description_book: Family Point is open for parent-guided crafts. We will have a craft and instructions, but there will not be a teacher to guide the activity.

name: String Theory
description_book: How do vibrating string instruments really work? For players (and aspiring players) of plucked, strummed, and bowed string instruments.
description_web:
How do vibrating string instruments really work? For players (and aspiring players) of plucked, strummed, and bowed string instruments, an understanding of the “what’s really going on physically” can be very enlightening. Practical tips for technique and practice will also be shared.

Class will also include a discussion of the medieval understanding of what was going on in the context of Aristotelian (as opposed to modern Newtonian) physics. Mathematical and scientific concepts limited to length, mass, tension, and simple fractions.
Instructor has been playing guitar since the 1970s and teaching (and performing in the SCA) since the '80s, when he was an engineering student.

name: Wand Shoot (Youth Shoot)
description_book: The target will have 3 lines. Middle line is 3 points. Side lines are 1 point each.
description_web: The target will have 3 lines. Middle line is 3 points. Side lines are 1 point each.

name: Introduction to Cloisonné Enameling
description_book: Hands on, introductory class to glass enameling on copper. Please bring a design suitable for a 1" square or circular token.
description_web: Hands on, introductory class to glass enameling on copper. Please bring a design suitable for a 1" square or circular token. No age restrictions, but this class involves flame. The instructor reserves the right to refuse anyone who demonstrates they cannot respect everyone's safety. Under age participants must have a responsible adult within audible and visual range of the tent at all times.
fee_itemization: All materials and tools required to complete a pendant or token

name: Introduction to German Brick Stitch Embroidery
description_book: Come learn about the history and somewhat muddled origins of German Brick Stitch, a style of embroidery in Europe during the 13th-15th centuries.
description_web: Come learn about the history and...somewhat muddled...origins of German Brick Stitch! This survey of Brick Stitch will explore early examples of brick stitch embroidery in Europe, both as a stand-alone stitch and the embroidery style called German Brick Stitch. Thought to have originated in Westphalia and Lower Saxony, this style of embroidery was used during the 13th-15th centuries for decoration on items both secular and ecclesiastical.
fee_itemization: Handout printing fee - $2

name: Bardic Symposium 4:  Art of Constructive Criticism
description_book: The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for forums, topics, & discussions for the Bardic Community. Today's topic: Art of Constructive Criticism.
description_web: The Art of Constructive Criticism: Giving constructive criticism is easier said than done. It can be a difficult and delicate art in and of itself. Inadvertently waffle stomping somebody is a danger. Framing or delivering your feedback in the wrong way can cause the opposite effect of what you wanted to achieve. How can we better give a critique that helps a bard improve while avoiding that which causes them to become discouraged?

name: Cooking the Books: A Review of Period Cookbooks
description_book: A review of around 60 medieval cookbooks.
description_web: A review of around 60 medieval cookbooks. Does the book have original recipes, translations and/or modern recipes? The books will be available to look through following the class.

name: Navigating by the Stars
description_book: Learn a critical medieval skill: how to navigate by the stars, moon, and sun! Simple and advanced navigational tricks for orienteering.
description_web: Learn a critical medieval skill: how to navigate by the stars, moon, and sun! All skill levels covered, from "I can't find Orion" to "I have built my own telescope." I will explain simple and advanced navigational tricks so that anyone can orient themselves at any time. Handy whether you're lost in the Bog, a survivalist, or simply want to know what your persona would have known. Please note: This is a daytime astronomy class!
fee_itemization: Handout -- $1 donation

name: Phoenician-Punic *Stelae* Translation/Pers'l Names
description_book: Part I: Translate a Phoenician-Punic inscription or two into English. Part II: Spot the personal names! Multiple inscriptions will be available.
description_web:
Translate a Phoenician-Punic inscription or two into English and spot the personal names! Multiple inscriptions will be available. The second part of this class will explore naming conventions and the foibles of transliteration and our modern understanding of vocalization. 
Class materials are available here: https://wakelet.com/wake/vm8-nUPMJjMb27-aUI9sN .
Please bring 3 pens, markers, or pencils of different colors. I will be bringing enough pens for 10 people.

name: Four 15th-C Italian Dances You'll Want to Know
description_book: Covers some of the most common, yet infrequently taught, dances from 15th-century Italy: *Amoroso, Anello, Gelosia*, and *Rostiboli*.
description_web: This class will cover some of the most common, yet infrequently taught, dances from 15th-century Italy: *Amoroso, Anello, Gelosia*, and *Rostiboli*. We'll learn the basics, and then learn how to play with the stories that all of these dances tell.

name: Introduction to Roman Cooking and Eating
description_book: Hands-on class featuring recipes from Apicius. Students will make the food, then recline and dine while learning about Roman dining customs.
description_web: Introductory level, hands-on class featuring recipes from Apicius. Students will participate in making a number of dishes to then be enjoyed while reclining on a triclinium, or three-sided Roman dining couch. While eating, we will discuss Roman dining customs and practices. **Allergy Alert: Some of the recipes featured will contain nuts.**
fee_itemization: hand-outs are free, food materials used/consumed in class total $5

name: Ooey Gooey Belly Dance
description_book: Slow down! Learn techniques and combinations for slow, fluid belly dance movement.
description_web: Sometimes you just want to slow down and ooze through your dance. In this class we will learn technique behind slow dance movement as well as putting moves together into combinations that you can use in your own practice, around the campfires, or in your future projects. All dancers are welcome, though this class will best serve those with some experience in belly dance.

name: Known World Choirs Recording and Rehearsal
description_book: Children, Youth, *Chorulus Pennsicus* and KWC will record/rehearse in this order.
description_web: Children, Youth, *Chorulus Pennsicus* and KWC will record/rehearse in this order in preparation for their concert on Thursday, Aug 11.

name: Teen Carnival Shoot
description_book: (Ages 12+) Three shoots that consist of 3 shoots: Ferris wheel target, saddle shoot and balloon pop. Player with the most points wins.
description_web: (Ages 12+) Three shoots that consist of 3 shoots: Ferris wheel target, saddle shoot and balloon pop. Player with the most points wins.

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Covers the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: Egyptian Nalbinding
description_book: The first hour is discussion of extant pieces (mainly socks) from 1st-6th century CE Egypt, followed by one hour of hands-on instruction.
description_web: Isn't nalbinding a Viking thing? Not really. Class will discuss the use of nalbinding/needle-looping in post-Roman Egypt. The first hour is discussion of extant pieces (mainly socks) from 4th-6th century Egypt including variations in stitch type and construction methods. This will be followed by one hour of hands-on practice. Limited number of needles will be available for attendees or you can bring your own blunt yarn needle.
fee_itemization: Optional

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to "Gypsy" Persona
description_book: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Bookbinding
description_book: Basic binding of books, history, hands-on, practical application. Learn different stitches and page attachment; leave with a small bound book.
description_web: Basic binding of books, a bit of history, hands-on, and practical application. Participants will learn different types of stitching and page attachment, plus covers, and will leave with a small bound book and/or a girdlebook cover.
fee_itemization: Paper, leather, wax, thread, cloth

name: Open Tent Place Holder
description_book: Open tent place holder.

name: Estate Planning and the SCA
description_book: How to structure your estate (scrolls, garb, heraldry and accounts) so they work as you wish and how to give to the SCA now and in the future.
description_web:
Work with a Retirement and Estates Specialist to review your heraldry, scrolls, garb, etc., as well as retirement and brokerage accounts so that you can be structured to carry out your wishes when you pass on for your heirs and for the SCA now and in the future. 
Beyond how to leave your goods to others, we will review the various types of beneficiaries, accounts and investments and how they can be used to benefit the SCA once you pass on. 
We will also review what you can and cannot do as well as how to avoid the most common pitfalls. 
(Note: These will be general suggestions and no investment advice will be given. I wish to keep my professional license, too.)

name: Beaded Flowers 1: Rose
description_book: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nose pliers/wire cutters, bring them to class.
description_web: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth.
fee_itemization: beads, wire, yarn

name: *Chōri*: Secrets of Premodern Japanese Cookery
description_book: Look beyond recipes to the underlying techniques, assumptions, and cultural expectations of premodern Japanese aristocratic cookery and dining.
description_web:
Think and cook like a medieval Japanese chef. Look beyond recipes to the underlying techniques, assumptions, and cultural expectations of premodern Japanese aristocratic cookery and dining.
No cuisine is simply a collection of recipes. Recipes are always embedded within a culinary tradition. Learn some of the essential techniques of medieval Japanese cookery. Learn some of the built-in assumptions. Learn about ingredients, Japanese notions of "taste", dietary theory, cooking, and the essential arts of selection and presentation through cooking Japanese food.
fee_itemization: Fee partially covers producing a multi-page handout.

name: Penn U Study Hall Through Body Doubling
description_book: Take an hour away from camp to double down on your learnings.
description_web: Do you come to Pennsic University, learn something awesome, mean to pursue it, only to wind up in your noisy camp where the idea flies from your mind? Come sit with us for an hour; hone your crafts, write your notes, collect your thoughts.

name: Viking Wire Weave Roundtable
description_book: Woven some wire but now need help finishing it? Want to show off your beautiful projects? Come chat!
description_web: Calling all Viking Wire Weave Enthusiasts!!! Want to take your wire weaving skill to the next level? Come see more advanced techniques and projects. It's stitch-and-bitch, but with wire!

name: Latin Reading
description_book: A daily Latin beginner reading class. We will be using Orberg's *Lingua Latina I* (purchase recommended). Handouts available.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

name: Youth Armored Combat: Fort Battle
description_book: Youth Castle battle.
description_web: Youth Castle battle.

name: Games of the Mary Rose Shipwreck
description_book: The evidence of the games onboard when the ship sank in 1545; rule sets for these games.
description_web: The evidence of the games onboard when the ship sank in 1545. Be a well-rounded Tudor.
fee_itemization: booklet of evidence of the games and period rules for said games.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip on our mini inkle loom.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip on our mini inkle loom. Classroom loaner looms provided. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: weaving materials, string, & instructions

name: The One-Act Experience (Workshop)
description_book: Try your hand at acting, staging, rehearsing (from the script!), and performing a play all in the same day!
description_web: Experience acting on stage in this workshop by staging and rehearsing a one-act play. There is no need to memorize lines; everything will be performed from the script! We will perform the play at the Amphitheater at 5 pm on Wednesday. Join us in laughter and tears as we explore period literature through performance!

name: Wild Silk!
description_book: Did you know that silk comes in a variety of colors right off the cocoon? Come and learn about different types of silk and their uses.
description_web: Did you know that silk comes in a variety of colors right off the cocoon? From the silk called the "Queen of Assam" to silk production that doesn't hurt the moth, this class will explore wild silks of the Indian subcontinent.

name: The Oxburgh Hangings
description_book: An overview of embroidered wall hangings associated with Mary, Queen of Scots, including the glimpse they offer into Elizabethan history and culture.
description_web: The Oxburgh Hangings, embroidered by two of the most exciting women in Elizabethan-era England, provide a rich and detailed glimpse into their lives and the culture of the day. But they also offer an enigmatic mystery regarding their creation. Whether you are interested in embroidery, Elizabethan culture, or doing historical detective work, this class has something for you!

name: Peerage Basics and Roundtable
description_book: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better?
description_web: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better? During this session, we will talk about the peerages, the highest awards in the SCA, and we will have peers there to talk about what their peerages mean to them and how the peerages have changed their SCA experiences. Given on behalf of the late Liam St Liam.

name: A Walking Tour of 12th Century Italy
description_book: A tour of Italy based on the descriptions of Benjamin of Tudelo who traveled the peninsula in the late 12th century.
description_web: In 1165, Benjamin of Tudelo left Sargossa in Spain on a journey that ultimately took him to Constantinople and beyond. He left, at least, a brief description of every town he passed through. In this class, I'll use Benjamin's descriptions and other materials to talk about the towns and what he would have seen there. This includes visits to Genoa, Pisa, Rome, and Naples before he set sail for Greece.
fee_itemization: fee is to cover my cost in printing the multi-page handout.

name: Latin Reading II
description_book: This is a continuation of the first week class. We will be continuing from Orberg.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

name: Rapier Town Battle
description_book: 50-minute resurrection battle. 5 flags total.
description_web:
● 50-minute resurrection battle.
● Flags positioned as indicated on map, with 5 flags total. (Map is based on heavy bridge field design, assumed bridges to be 80 ft long.)
● Teams will have resurrection zones in each zone shown.
● Armies will deploy from inside their resurrection zone.
● Flags will be pulley type.
● Flags cannot be obscured by any object (e.g., a shield).
● There will be 3 random time checks within ±5 min of 15, 30, and 45 min.
● One marshal from the East/allies and Midrealm/allies MUST be present at each flag.
● Majority control of flags at time check scores 1 point.
● Death from behind and knee-walking are allowed.
● No rapier spears or projectile weapons (e.g., rubber band guns) are allowed.
● All holds will be local, except for a medical hold. **MEDICAL HOLDS MUST BE CLEARLY ANNOUNCED BY MARSHALS.** Medical holds stop the clock.
● Rez zones will be delineated on the flattest sections of the battlefield to maintain equity between the armies.
● Overall field size will be revisited once attendance is known (at the Meeting of the Crowns/Beer & Brats).
o A map of the contingency battle will be drawn up and made available prior to Pennsic.
● Members from each side **and** a neutral party will measure all distances prior to lay-on to ensure that rez zones are fairly placed.

name: Beginner Dance: Burgundian
description_book: Come learn slow, simple and elegant dances from the Court of the Dukes of Burgundy! Beginners welcome, all ages welcome.
description_web: Come learn slow, simple and elegant dances from the Court of the Dukes of Burgundy! Beginners welcome, all ages welcome. We will be doing *Danse de Cleves* and *Franchoise Nouvelle*.

name: Middle Eastern Drumming
description_book: These drumming classes are intended for beginner and intermediate drummers.
description_web: After a brief review of basic drumming techniques, the classes will concentrate on rhythms that have the same time signature, starting with the basic forms of the rhythms. More complex variations of the different rhythms will be covered for intermediate drummers, including more advanced drumming techniques. A limited number of handouts will be available on a first come basis. A Google docs copy of the handouts can be obtained by sending an email request to briansbeaman@gmail.com.

name: PA Afternoon Series: Storytelling Expo
description_book: An amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of storytellers from around the Known World! Share up to a 10-minute story!
description_web: An amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of storytellers from around the Known World! Sign up the day of the expo to tell up to a ten-minute story.

name: Preschooler Playgroup (Over 3)
description_book: Let our preschoolers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.
description_web: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Age restrictions are just estimates. Use your judgement.

name: *Cofia y Tranzado*: Omnipresent Spanish Headwear
description_book: All about the Spanish *cofia y tranzado*: cap and braid case. Learn the history, see the many ways it could be worn, and learn how to make your own!
description_web: In 1500s Spain, the *cofia y tranzado* (cap and braid case) was all the rage. Worn by women of virtually every rank, it could dress up, dress down, and be styled in a wide variety of ways. This class will survey the many different examples we have of the garment in use, and will include a pattern and all details needed to make and wear your own. (It's easy!)
fee_itemization: No fees

name: Introduction to Fingerloop Braiding
description_book: Come learn to make colorful braided cords! All supplies will be provided.
description_web: Come learn the art of fingerloop braiding! This period practice can be used to make colorful cords in a variety of patterns for jewelry, garb lacing, and more! Supplies will be provided.
fee_itemization: N/A

name: Russ and "Russia": 300 Years War
description_book: Wars for dominance between Grand Duchy of Lithuania and Principality of Moscow in 14th-16th centuries. Class 3 of 3.
description_web: Wars for dominance between Grand Duchy of Lithuania and Principality of Moscow in 14th-16th centuries. Class 3 of 3.
fee_itemization: For printed handouts

name: Entering A&S Competitions
description_book: With this class you will learn how to prepare for A&S competitions, set expectations, and maximize your success.
description_web: Arts & Sciences are a core part of what makes our Society so rich and fascinating, but entering competitions can seem scary! Fear not! With this class, you will learn how to prepare for A&S competitions, set expectations, and maximize your success. This class is based on my experiences as an entrant and judge in local, kingdom, and inter-kingdom competitions.

name: Sea Navigation in the Middle Ages and Renaissance
description_book: Into to period navigation. Includes techniques of Norsemen, medieval Mediterranean, 15th-16th-C Iberia and Northern Europe. Some hands-on activities.
description_web: Into to navigation in the SCA period. Includes techniques of Norsemen, medieval Mediterranean, 15th-16th-century Iberia and Northern Europe. Some hands-on activities.

name: *Origami* Lotuses
description_book: Come fold paper lotuses from the secret lands of *Khandroling*.
description_web: We will fold *origami* lotuses. This class is suitable for **all** ages.
fee_itemization: All materials provided to make 2 origami lotuses

name: North African Wrapped Dresses
description_book: Learn to wrap yourself like a North African woman. Also useful for Celts, Vikings and Romans!
description_web: This class will cover women's *Maghribi* wrapped dresses, and examine the similarities and differences with other people who wore this style, including Romans, Celts, and Vikings. We will also look at accompanying undergarments and accessories. If you want to be wrapped up before you go, bring 5-6 yards of light linen or cotton fabric, 55-60" wide. You will also need a belt or rope, and two very large safety pins, brooches, or kilt pins. Kilt pins and simple penannular brooches will be available as class materials at $3-5/pair.
fee_itemization: $1 handout. Pins for students who did not bring their own: $3/pair for 3" kilt pins, $5/pair for 5" kilt pins or simple penannular brooches.

name: Tablet Weavers' Tea
description_book: A social gathering for tablet weavers of all levels to show off current work, see projects from other people, and schmooze.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Knowne World Courtesans' Social - CCt
description_book: Join us for food, wine, and company! Open to those with courtesan personas, patrons, Tullians, and those interested in courtesan studies. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Come join us for food, wine, and pleasurable company! Open to those with courtesan personas, patrons, Tullians, and those just interested in courtesan studies. **Age 18+ due to the nature of topics discussed.**

name: Known World Dance Symposium Bid Session
description_book: KWDS has been a bit disrupted by the plague, but we have a bid for 2023! Come hear about what having a bid involves, and learn about the 2023 bid.

location: Enchanted Ground or next to it (W09)
name: Period Portable Furniture You Can Make
description_book: Chairs, tables, and a bed, all based on period designs.
description_web: Chairs, tables, and a bed, all based on period designs. At least one chair, one table, and the bed are simple enough so that someone with only basic tools and no expertise should be able to make them.

name: Empire of the Sun Battle
description_book: Fight for Honor and Glory in the Empire of the Sun! Armored combat tournament. Armor and weapons are required to appear Japanese in appearance.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: optional handout

name: Meet-the-Dance-Faculty Social
description_book: Everyone is invited to meet the people who make the Pennsic School of European Dance happen! Dancers, students, teachers, and staff are all welcome!
description_web: Everyone is invited to meet the people who make the Pennsic School of European Dance happen! This event is open for all students and dancers to meet this year's faculty and staff. We encourage all to attend. A group picture of staff and teachers will be taken!

name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: I host an open 12-Step meeting at 4:00 pm daily in my camp in EO7, Denys the Decadent's Camp.
description_web: This is an open 12-Step meeting open to all who are looking for a 12-Step meeting to attend for on-site support.

name: The Brendan Show: Favorites Old and New
description_book: A bardic journey through four decades of the Modern Middle Ages.
description_web: Master Brendan O Corraidhe reprises favorite songs, poems, and tales going back to Pennsic X.

location: E07. Off the Great Eastern Highway. Next to Denys the Decadent/Dennis Greenway. In Timothy of Sherwoods' camp.  (E07 Off The Great Eastern Highway. Next to Denys the Decadent/Dennis Greenway. In Timothy of Sherwoods' camp.)
name: Beginning Period-ish Feather Work for Fletching
description_book: Feather fronts will not peel up even when shot deeply into a target. No expensive modern jigs. Cut profiles you like. Silk thread & 7" dowel used.
description_web: Feather fronts will not peel up even when shot deep into targets. No expensive modern jig needed. Cut profiles you design. Silk thread and a 7" long dowel piece used to learn. Arrows made with this process won a kingdom championship, several tournaments and outscored a grand master bowman. This process allows one to quickly and easily rescue flights and thread from broken arrows saving money and time. Nocks, points, documentation, spine, cresting and straightening are not our focus. Please bring note taking materials.
fee_itemization: Two full length, milled turkey feathers & three, trimmed flights $3.00. A 7" dowel $1.00. Hide glue, tea lights, handout $1.00

name: Lord Éadaoin Ruadh Concert
description_book: Concert performed by Éadaoin Ruadh of Æthelmearc.
description_web: Come enjoy songs, stories, poems, and other shenanigans performed by the infamous punster and wit weaver, Éadaoin Ruadh, Red Heron of Æthelmearc, and the bardic realm at large. Any specific requests should be conveyed to her prior to the performance.

description_book: Watch two one-act plays performed for you with just one afternoon of rehearsal!
description_web: Watch two one-act plays performed for you with just one afternoon of rehearsal! Join us in laughter and tears as we explore period literature through performance!

name: Meridies Royal Court
description_book: Meridies Royal Court.

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble Concert
description_book: The Known World Recorder Ensemble presents a concert of medieval and Renaissance music.
description_web: The Known World Recorder Ensemble presents a concert of medieval and Renaissance music.

description_book: Children, Youth, *Chorulus Pennsicus* and the Known World Choir perform a concert, Thurs., Aug 11.
description_web: Children, Youth, *Chorulus Pennsicus* and the Known World Choir perform a concert, Thurs., Aug 11. Enjoy an evening of medieval and Renaissance choral music.

name: *i Verdi Confusi*: War Week Follies
description_book: *Commedia dell'Arte* keeps going all War! Join us for more follies at the Amphitheatre!
description_web: *Commedia dell'Arte* keeps going all war! Join us for more follies at the Amphitheatre!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be *Around the World in 11 Nights*. Eat your heart out, Phileas Fogg!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be *1001 Arabian Nights*. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Nine Is Fine
description_book: A Noyse of Musicians: A selection of music for nine-note instruments.
description_web: A Noyse of Musicians: A selection of music for nine-note instruments.

name: Clan Blue Feather Encampment Party
description_book: We'll have booze, snacks, and entertainment; you bring yourselves and have a good time!
description_web: Our annual open encampment party. We'll have booze, snacks, and entertainment; you bring yourselves and have a good time!

name: Midrealm Court
description_book: Midealm's Pennsic Court - Draco Invictus!

name: Simply SCAdian: No Title Required Live at Pennsic
description_book: Join Lucas and Zsof, hosts of "Simply SCAdian: No Title Required" for a live version of their popular Zoom-cast.
description_web: Join Lucas and Zsof, hosts of Simply "SCAdian: No Title Required" for a live version of their popular Zoom-cast. We'll be streaming live from the stage at Pennsic.

name: Beginners' Ball
description_book: At the Beginners' Ball, we teach all of the dances. Never danced? No problem! A perfect ball for the eager but still learning. No partner is needed!
description_web: At the Beginners' Ball, we teach all of the dances. Never danced? Not a problem! A perfect ball for the eager but still learning. No partner is needed. Bring your friends! All musicians are welcome, too! The pit is open! The more the merrier!

name: *Commedia* All Stars Performance
description_book: *Commedia* All Stars performance of hilarious plays based on 16th-century Italian *Commedia dell' Arte*!
description_web: Commedia All Stars performance of hilariousplays based on 16th-century Italian *Commedia dell' Arte*! This year's show will be greatly inspired by Shakespeare's play *Midsummer Night's Dream* including Capitano Oberon, Fairy Queen Vittoria, and a very Puckish Arlecchino!

name: Recovery for All
description_book: Support and fellowship for all people in recovery.
description_web: 12-step meetings for those  who "trudge the Road of Happy Destiny" within any program.

name: Known World Players Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Players: Performing Arts Pavilion.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the Known World Players Pennsic 49 production of *Wyrd Sisters* by Terry Pratchett and Stephen Briggs.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: The Pennsic Populace Archery War Point consists of three separate shoots; each shoot is worth 1 War Point for a total of 3 War Points.
description_web:
Format: The Pennsic Populace Archery War Point consists of three separate shoots; each shoot is worth 1 War Point for a total of 3 War Points. The winner of each shoot is determined by total number of points tallied by archers over the course of the War. Scores will be tallied each day and posted in the Marshals' Tent. Any member of the populace may participate.
Multiple individuals may share a bow; however, it must be inspected with each user to ensure safety.
Description: There are 3 parts to the populace shoot.
Castle Clout Shoot (1 Point): The target is a simulated castle turret. Archers will be shooting at about 100 yards into a square of approximately 27 feet by 27 feet giving an approximate area of 729 square feet. There will be a moat monster protecting the castle in front at about 50 yards. This is an untimed shoot; archers are allowed 6 arrows or bolts. Scoring for this shoot is as follows:
1 point for inside the moat.
2 points for hitting the moat monster.
3 points for inside the castle.
4 points for hitting objects inside the castle.
Soldier Shoot (1 Point): The archers will shoot 6 arrows or bolts, untimed, at the soldiers that are invading. These targets will be set at approximately 15 yards, 35 yards, 45 yards, and 55 yards. Any arrow or bolt hitting the painted portion of the target scores as follows:
1 point for the 15-yard target.
2 points for the 35-yard target.
3 points for the 45-yard target.
4 points for the 55-yard target.
Castle Window Shoot (1 Point): Archers will shoot 6 arrows or bolts, untimed, at a castle window located between 25 and 35 yards. The castle window will be at least 8 inches wide and 36 inches tall. There will be an object inside the castle window. Scoring will be as follows: 1 point for each arrow or bolt inside the castle window, 2 points for each arrow or bolt inside the object in the castle window.

name: Making Glass Cabochons
description_book: Making glass cabochons: intermediate lampworking. Includes making glass game pieces.
description_web: Making glass cabochons, intermediate lampworking. Includes making glass game pieces.
fee_itemization: gas and glass

name: Modern Gaming: War Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Dance Floor Break-Down
description_book: Please come and help us break down the dance floor. Jobs available for all hands. Thank you!
description_web: Please come and help us break down the dance floor. The floor is an amazing resource that lets us dance all throughout War safely and happily. If you can't come at 9 am, please do drop by later!

name: Thrown Weapons MIT Class: Test and Final Questions
description_book: Ask any final questions and take the MIT test.
description_web: Ask any final questions and take the MIT test.

name: Thrown Weapons Range Tear-Down and Storage
description_book: Come help us tear down the range and put it away. Immediately after the Known World Marshals' Meeting.
description_web: Come help us tear down the range and put it away. Immediately after the Known World Marshals' Meeting.

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre
description_book: Kids ages 5-12, join us in creating & performing, from story book to stage, your very own play! Creative minds + theatrical tools = a fun time!
description_web: For kids ages 5-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Armored Field Battle
description_book: 5 passes. Last man standing victory condition, no resurrection.
description_web: 5 passes, last man standing victory condition, no resurrection, all holds are general. CA & Siege allowed on battles 1/2/3. 10-minute break between. Traditional starting sides, no gleaning. No inspection of ammunition between battles.

name: Cut-and-Thrust Spear and Polearm Tournament
description_book: Experimental spear and polearm fencing with cutting blows allowed. Sidearms/parrying devices permitted. Polearms available for loan.
description_web:
Fencers will start each bout with a spear or polearm, and may also carry any sidearms such as a sword, shield, dagger, or other parrying device (including rubber daggers!). Cutting and chopping blows with spears and polearms are experimental in the Middle Kingdom; however, any C&T authorized fencer from any kingdom may participate.

A variety of polearms such as partisans, halberds, axes, spears, etc., will be available for loan. If you’ve never fenced with cutting polearms before, please make an effort to practice ahead of the tournament.

Polearm heads must be made from leather, rubber, or foam in accordance with the experiment guidelines. Commercial spear heads currently permitted in SCA Rapier are allowed for cutting blows. Experiment rules are available here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QLcy3kj2eypLb35aUy18uTqOIt5rr2eqLO5FHn8tgaU/edit?usp=sharing

name: Thrown Weapons Marshals' Closing Meeting
description_book: Open to all Known World Thrown Weapons marshals. Range tear-down immediately after the meeting.
description_web: Open to all Known World Thrown Weapons marshals. Range tear-down immediately after the meeting.

name: Farce & *Fabulae*: Comedic Theatre of Ancient Rome
description_book: Explore millennia-old humor from Plautus to Terence to Atellan Farce.
description_web: Explore millennia-old humor of Roman theatre from the great playwrights Plautus and Terence to the masked improvised comedy of Atellan Farce.

name: Bardic Symposium 5: Improving Bardic Competitions
description_book: The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for forums, topics, and discussions. Today's Topic: Improving Bardic Competitions.
description_web:
The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. 
Competitions are a primary activity in many kingdoms. Sometimes they can be a positive experience that encourages their participants. Then, there are the others. Is there a way this can be improved? How to keep the aspects that work while adjusting those that do not?

Wrapping Up: What can we improve? What's missing? What classes do we want to see taught that aren't? What topics do we want to discuss? How can we make the bardic arts and its class tracks even better?

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre Dress Rehearsal
description_book: Closed dress rehearsal for Youth Theatre.
description_web: Closed dress rehearsal for Youth Theatre.

name: Archery Range Strike
description_book: Many hands make light work. You do **not** need to be a marshal to help; all are welcome. Snacks provided.
description_web: Many hands make light work. You do **not** need to be a marshal to help; all are welcome. Snacks provided.

name: Latin Reading
description_book: A daily Latin beginner reading class. We will be using Orberg's *Lingua Latina I* (purchase recommended). Handouts available.
fee_itemization: One time fee is for reading handouts. Exercise handouts are free, as it is recommended (but not required) that you complete these as "homework". After the class, there will be time for free reading from a supplemental text, if desired. There is no cost for these handouts, but there will be limited copies (probably 3). I am taking on a fair portion of these costs on my own, so donations are welcome

name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia* Dress Rehearsal
description_book: Youth Commedia *Closed* Dress Rehearsal.
description_web: Youth Commedia *Closed* Dress Rehearsal.

name: Rapier Field Battle
description_book: 5 Battles. 1 Life per Combatant. Last man standing.
description_web:
● 5 Battles.
● 1 Life per Combatant. Winner of each battle gets one War Point. Last man standing.
● Death from behind and knee-walking are allowed.
● No rapier spears or projectile weapons (i.e., rubber band guns) are allowed.
● Mid/East to deploy on their traditional half of the battlefield for every Battle.
● 10 minutes between each battle to rest, water, and redeploy.
● All holds are general.

name: Middle Eastern Melodies
description_book: Learn some different Middle Eastern Melodies that aren’t part of the typical Pennsic repertoire.

name: KWP Auditions:  *Romeo and Juliet* for Pennsic 50
description_book: Come audition for one the Bard's most memorable pieces to be performed under the stars. All ability levels welcome.
description_web: Come audition for one the Bard's most memorable pieces to be performed under the stars. All ability levels welcome. We are very interested in having teens play the teen roles of Romeo, Juliet, Tybalt, etc., with parent's permission. Please have a relevant monologue of 2 minutes or less ready. The audition will also include reading selected scenes and simple choreography for the roles which include fight scenes. Be prepared to stay for the entire time block and wear clothes that you can move in.

name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: I host an open 12-Step meeting at 4:00 pm daily in my camp in EO7, Denys the Decadent's Camp.
description_web: This is an open 12-Step meeting open to all who are looking for a 12-Step meeting to attend for on-site support.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Pennsic Youth Theater Performance
description_book: Come see a culmination of Youth Theater classes displaying these students' hard work and creativity.
description_web: Come see a culmination of Youth Theater classes displaying these students' hard work and creativity.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia* Performance
description_book: The final product of the hard work and dedication of the Youth *Commedia* students of Pennsic War 47. Come enjoy the crazy antics!
description_web: The final product of the hard work and dedication of the Youth *Commedia* students of Pennsic War 47. Enjoy the crazy antics of your favorite characters and children while meeting some new characters and the rising popular faces of *Commedia*. (Youth *Commedia* open rehearsals: Sunday - Thursday, 9-10 am, in the Amphitheater.)

name: Known World Players: Cast & Crew Call
description_book: KWP: Pre-show staging. Cast & crew call, 7:00 pm.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be *Around the World in 11 Nights*. Eat your heart out, Phileas Fogg!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be *1001 Arabian Nights*. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Known World Players Performance *Wyrd Sisters*
description_book: The Known World Players present Terry Pratchett's *Wyrd Sisters* as their 23rd production. Join them for this send-up of Macbeth for Pennsic 49.
description_web: The Known World Players present Terry Pratchett's *Wyrd Sisters* as their 23rd production. Join them for this send-up of Macbeth for Pennsic 49. Performance at the Performing Arts Pavilion.
